text: orange color.. mostly floral, slight toasty malt.. very soft with dry finish

330ml bottle, 6.2%, 5 months old. Hazy amber colour with a two-finger off-white head. Aroma: dried fruits, apple, yeast, hops. Taste: dried fruits, tart apple, spices, yeast, herbal, quite rich and complex, finish is bitter. Medium bodied, average carbonation. Really nice.

Bottle. Dark golden to copper, little bit hazy with huge, frothy, white and very solid head and good lacing. Medium aromas of dried frutis with significant farmhouse notes. Very dry but not watery, little bit sour with light bitterness in the finish. Extremely drinkable!

Have had many in my time. surprised I didnt tick it until now. Depp gold pour, Larger head that leaves a lasting ring. Yeasty aroma, fruity, musty, soapy, light spices. Fruity up front, yeast, spicy, floral. Heavier body, lively carbonation. A classic.

330ml Bottle: Pours a clear light copper with large frothy white head. Fruity aroma with a slightly sour note. Flavours of caramel, sour cherry and breadcrust. Medium to high bitterness, high carbonation and medium bodied. Overall an amazing beer. Crisp and clean with an incredible complexity.

Apperance brown/red, slightly hazy. Aroma has some yeastines and caramel without much sweetness. Taste similar balance. Dry end, spicy and more bitterness than most belgian beers. Nothing else quite like this. Well done!

Kuparin värinen lasissa. Tuoksussa appelsiinin kuorta, vähän ruohoa ja belgialaista hiivaa. Maku on hieman greippinen ja yrttinen. Lopussa katkeruutta, mutta ei liikaa, vaan maku on tasapainoinen. Omassa lajissaan maistuva olut, tulee mieleen kesä ja ruohon leikkaaminen.

(3 months old, bottled 03.02.2017)
Lovely copper towards light bronze colour. Big, white head.
Duft: Perfumed fruitiness, lemon, soapy, lavender. Funky notes of leather, old hay barn and dried hay. Pine tree hoppiness. With air the funk and the pine tree hoppiness become more pronounced and rather dominant.
Very rich carbonation, quite soft, medium juiciness, fruity, funky, medium bitterness, between dry and slightly off-dry. Medium long, hoppy aftertaste.
Interesting beer, different, developing in the glass.

Shy nose of a light belgian ale, yeast, sugar and malt.
Medium body.
Sharp attack with a yeasty twist, cant put a name on it.
Finish is dry and very green.
Aromas are quite complex and not easy to name for me.
Overall very nicely done and interesting, a bit shy/uneasy to my taste, complimented very nicely the strong maroiles we were having.

Really was something else than I expected from a trappist. When you tasted beers like La Trappe, Westmalle or Spencer, this beer comes in hard. You can describe it as a kind of crossbreed between a Palm and a English ale. Though, it is very well balanced and has nice bitter fruity spicy notes. Pretty dry beer. Although its not my type of beer, it is actually good.

DOB: 9/11/20162015 BJCP Category: 28B Mixed-Fermentation Sour Beer (base style: 26A Trappist Single)
AROMA: Light clean fruity scent, especially green/white fruits and slight citrus notes. Brett character is evident; imparts minor farmhouse funk as a background note. Spicy/floral hops. Low grainy-sweet malt base. 9/12APPEARANCE: Rusty orange/brown. Extremely cloudy body. Billowy off-white foam with Belgian lace. 2/3FLAVOR: Lightly malty up front. Notes of honey and perhaps caramel or biscuit, but not especially sweet. Palette is quite dry overall from the Brett secondary which gives is a tartness. Some green/white fruit flavors with some peppery/floral hop flavor and accompanying bitterness. Esters are present, but tame. A lot of flavors happening here, but theyre rather tame overall (could be due to the age of the bottle) 14/20MOUTHFEEL: Medium-light body with high carbonation. Constantly crisp with some tartness that lingers momentarily, otherwise a clean finish. Feels much lighter and more sessionable than 6.9% ABV. No alcohol warmth. 4/5OVERALL IMPRESSION: An interesting and tasty brew and one that is difficult to peg to a style. Fun to drink. Id love to try it fresh sometime. 7/10TOTAL SCORE: 36/50
I found it Slightly bitter. Love the strong taste of yeast and a bit of caramel.

4/6/17: bottled 21/9/16. Aroma very funky, sharp. Taste rather thin, dominant carbonation, dryhopped aftertaste faint but complex and pleasant: floral, spicy, nice lingering bitterness. Mouthfeel dry. 8-4-8-4-15=3.9
Pours an amber body with a thick head. Nice hoppy aroma. Taste is a little creamy with a well balanced mix of malty and hoppy tones.

Bottle, 5 months old. Hazy amber and a big white head. Profile is nice and complex: sour fruits, sour dough, bitter herbs, white wine/grapes, funky tart, floral hops. Nice, medium body with a medium carbonation. Some bitter medicinal plants in the dry, bitter finish. Light, funky, easy to drink. Very nice.

Pours light see-through brown, slightly bitter taste with hints of caramel, yeast, malt. 
Suitable for daily basis drinking.

Big! Huge!! Enormous!!! 

Gently rolling the beer into the glass this hazy dark amber liquid developed a cocky three finger off white head. The lacing lovingly caressed the glass as the lingering head relaxed very slowly and downsized to a long lasting sudsy layer. 

The aromas are huge filling the room then flowing into the back room and kitchen the air heavy with its sweet and fruity fragrance - apple, banana, Asti Spumante and a little yeast to mention a few. 

In the mouth it's lush and luxurious with a laid-back effervescence that percolates around the mouth. 

The flavour is surprisingly and sublimely dry. Not overly bitter but satisfyingly light and crisp balanced by the background fruitiness like a mellow merlot. I say it's surprising because from the aromas I expected the sweeter aspects to dominate. My one complaint is the brevity of the flavour hit needing longer legs to carry the character to an indulgent conclusion.

Une bière brune, voilée, avec une grosse carbonatation. Au nez, le côté sucre de la levure belge est mis à lévidence avec une brett qui est un elle aussi bien présente. En bouche, on remarque tout de suite la brett qui est la marque de commerce de la Orval, placé avec un côté plus caramel, plus malté, que lon associe aux bières belges. En termes de saveurs, a part la brett, la réalité est que cest un peu mince. Plutôt effervescente, la bière mériterait peut-être un peu plus de malt pour y donner un corps plus rond.

330ml bottle. Pours a hazy brown with good head. Pear, liquorice, almonds, lemon juice, earthy, white balsamic, cloves, cinnamon, some pepper, cherry, raspberry, and oh my God, that heavenly long sweet marzipan finish. Its fruity but dry, earthy but light, bitter yet the finish so sweet, complex but not even a little overpowering. This beer really should be described in a haiku, rather than this rambling nonsense. Delicate but deep. A flavour rollercoaster. Oh yum, marzipan.

Aroma: toffee, apple, sour, hops.
Appearance: brown, haze with small head.
Taste: banana, caramel, toffee.
Palate: medium bodied, medium carbonation, long dry bitterness finish.

A trappist beer fit for contemplation as well as daily usage. It pours hazy gold, with a very big head, unfortunately full of very large bubbles that quickly dissolve. Not very appetising. You can feel the wild yeast in the aroma, as well as some hops. Taste consist of malts, yeast flavours that remind me of ripe sweet fruit, and these funky "rural" notes. its a little tart, which makes it very drinkable.

Aromas of laffy taffy, bananas, white grapes, and crusted bread. Taste is banana, white grapes, crusted bread. As it warms the flavor shifts to a stronger champagne grape, bread, yeast, banana and taffy, and black pepper.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2017 Still feeling ambivalent abt this one, prolly need a few more tries. Dry take on belgian ale, ridiculous amounts of head, murky dark orange, I like the brett funk thats coming through there, just a bit understated in my opinion, but Imma rube

I poured it from the bottle into a glass. It pours a hazy reddish color with a huge, off-white head and lacing. The aroma is yeast, banana, spice, and other fruit. The taste is banana, spice, bread, and berries. The beer was nicely balanced with sweetness and slight hop bitterness. This is a good beer.

A 330ml bottle, bottled on 3rd February 2016, best before 3rd February 2021, and poured into a Chimay goblet. It was a clear copper colour with an almost two finger white head that had great retention and left nice sticky lacing. Aromas of very fruity berries, grape, apple and pear with hints of coriander and brett. Tastes of a nice gentle fruitiness, berries, grape, bubblegum and plum with a light tartness, light peppery spice, brett, funk and a hint of banana. Dry-ish, medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall a very nice and very well balanced beer, and a must buy beer in my book.
Bottle shared at Dans. Pours pale brown with a lasting off-white head. Aroma of caramel, malt, hops, yeast and fruit. Medium sweetness, light bitterness. Medium body, soft carbonation.

The aroma is sweet with notes of fruit,yeast, orange, and other spices. The flavor is sweet with notes of orange, fruit, yeast, cinnamon, and other spices. It ends on a nice bitterness combined with an acidic note. An unique beer.
barnyard, peach,fruits,citrus, golden, cloudy, rocky head, white foam, medium bitterness, medium body, thin feel, fizzy, bitter,

Appearance - nice, reddish-brown amber color. Almost copper. Beautiful carbonation that almost reminds me of a good sparkling wine. Very inviting.

Aroma - funky farmhouse smell upfront of hay and horse stables. Citrussy, almost white wine-y. Very surprising when you first serve it, but what a welcome surprise.

Taste - citrussy, champagne-y funkiness leaning towards green apples combined with hay and a hint of horse stable. Grassy, floral hoppiness. A really crisp and green taste. With a beautiful hoppy bitterness in the after taste that makes you go yep, its still beer, though. It is so exquisitely well-balanced, something which I miss in most other sours Ive tried. Beautiful. Absolutely beautiful.

Palate - nothing of note. Not watery. Not syrup-y. A nice sparkly carbonation like those in sparkling wines. Really well done.

Overall - this is still my favorite beer. It is the beer that got me interested in craft beer. Upon first serve it simply smacks you in the face with its uniqueness, without being over-the-top. It is so amazingly well balanced in its farmhouse characteristics and its beer-y/hoppiness, and I havent really found any other beer that I have gotten so utterly smitten about. It reminds me of my childhood hometown: it is simply the countryside in a glass. If Beethovens Pastorale symphony were a beer. This would be it.

Zapach średnio intensywny, stajnia, skóra, owoce, cytrusy, siano, przyprawy, ziemia. Kolor pomarańczowy, mętne. Piana obfita, drobna, trwała, zdobi szkło. W smaku lekka słodycz, średnia pełnia, zioła, trawa, ziemia, siano, stajnia, cytrusy, chleb. Goryczka średnia, wysycenie wysokie.

The legend.. Never been a huge fan. Now I try it again after a while. I have here a 7-8 months old Orval, bought at the abbey and kept in cellar conditions. I see a dark amber coloured beer with a thick creamy foam. Funky "orval" aromas that I still cannot put into words. Bitter and dry (after)taste. Always lacked body, especially carbon for me. Still not my thing, maybe next time.

Served from bottle into glass at home. Gushes even when opened gently, pours with enormous seemingly endless white head. Medium amber in color, with orangish tint, hazy and medium low clarity. Bright spicy, fruity aroma with Brett barnyard funkiness in the background. Flavor is just as complex: yeasty spice and fruit with wet hay earthiness. Medium full body with lively carbonation and a refreshing slightly dry finish. Overall this beer is absolutely great but very different from what is expected of a Trappist ale. The addition of Brett produces an enticing funky and sour aroma and flavor that pairs well with the more common Belgian spicy, fruity yeast. I do not get much hop aroma or flavor so this is probably an older bottle, so I guess I have a reason to try it again!
Piana bardzo obfita, opada po dłuższej chwili, barwa pomarańczowa. W aromacie kwiaty, żółte owoce, trochę mokrej skóry i mokrego siana. W smaku chlebowe, słodowe.

Aromat - lekka stajnia, kwasek, morela. Generalnie czuć, że Belgia. 
Piana - olbrzymia, drobna i średnia, po chwili robią się wielkie bąble i zaczyna powoli opadać; zostaje na szkle.
W smaku skóra, stajnia, lekki karmel wraz z owocami typu śliwka; skórka od chleba.

Bottle. Hazy golden with a frothy white head. Lovely fruity and funky aroma with spicy and zesty notes. Saison-like bitterish taste with a tiny dash of sourness and crispy bitter finish. Light body, frothy texture. Amazing!

One of my first beers that I've tasted and one of my favourites ones. It's simple but genuine. Great trappist beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

When Im short of beer at home, this is a secure choice from the Carrefour near home in Milan. Definitely the best beer that it has (hidden jem among tons of Heineken, Bud, Moretti, etc.). So, last time, 330 ml bottle from Carrefour, Milano, Italy. Colour is cloudy amber orange with a huge, solid and lasting white head. Aroma: difficult. At the beginning is smell more than aroma. Funky. But soon nose is spice, hops, vanilla and lot of herbs. Taste is herbs, leafs, grass, flowers and fruit. Complex. Medium body and average carbonation.

11.2oz bottle. Cloudy orange amber color with a white head. Orange mild funk aroma. Orange yeast lemon little spice flavor. Dry medium body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a bottle into a tulip glass. Lots going on with the aroma. Fruity, malts, yeast, spices. Hazy, but beautiful copper color with a huge off-white head. Great lacing on the glass. Medium bitter and medium body. Dry bitter finish.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2017 Mousse persistante et abondante, peu de bulles, un gout très singulier, une bière plutôt légère pour une belge, une bonne amertume assez longue en note finale. Plus je la goute, plus japprécie cette Orval...
Bottle. Pours a hazy burnt orange color with white head. Funky, hay, caramel aromas. Dry, funky, mild caramel flavors. Good stuff, doesnt feel like 7%

UPDATED: APR 6, 2017 Bottle.A little hazy pale gold-orange,extremely thick and quite stable but not too pretty,off-white head,some lacing.Aroma bretty,horse blanket,some white fruits,spices,peppery,a hint of malts. Taste rather thin,dry,slightly sour,peppery,a little mealy,carbonation high,tingling, bitterness high,spicy,tannic,slightly stalky.Aftertaste peppery,fruity,spices,hints of coriander. Quite weird and quite interesting.
A Orval from 2016. Golden and a bit muddy with white foam with lots of air bubbles. Lots of flowers in the aroma togeather with yeast and malt. Fresh in the taste with lots of carbonation.

A fantastic aroma of hops, malt and very strong yeast enveloped me when I openend the bottle and started the gentle pour. Lots of carbonation, a good head and a murky appearance. The flavour was spicy - definite coriander - hops and yeast and an element of thirst quenching from the sourness. The carbonation reduced as I finished the glass. Its nice, but not my thing.
Donker bier met hoppige ambersmaak en enige citrusfruitextracten. Alcoholpercentage lijkt zwaarder dan het is.
33cl botte purchased @ So bière. Nez fruité tout en céréales. Robe orange avec une grosse mousse blanche. Attaque assez sèche mais crémeuse. Légère astringence avec une pointe damertume.

33 cl, bottle conditioned, brewed October 2016. Old friend revisited. Hazy, dark reddish amber, medium off-white head, lively carbonation. Aromas of a fruit garden straight out of the bottle, fantastic!! Mouthfeel is fizzy and dry. Flavours of red berries, dark berries, citrus, alcohol and a bit of toffee caramel at the end. Wonderful beer from Orval.

Bottle. Hazy orange. Huge head. Aroma of citrus fruits, honey, bananas, hops. Taste is belgian yeast and citrus fruits (mostly grapefruit, also some orange and lemon). Sour, dry, delicious. Strong carbonation. Dry and bitter aftertaste. Great. I preferably drink it rather fresh (~ 3 months old), as it gets older it gets even more dry and develops some kind of horseblanket/urine-aroma. Still delicious though.
Red wine, ripe orange and yeast aroma. The taste is spicy and yeasty with a crisp finish. Bubbly and delicious.

11.2 oz bottle poured into a tulip. Bottled 4/6/2015, best before 4/6/2020. 6.9% ABV. Big carbonation pop upon opening. Clear amber/orange with 3 fingers of off-white head. Aromas of malt, yeast, herbs, spices, caramel. Tastes of malt, herbs, spices, a little banana, yeast. Medium-light body with a dry finish. High carbonation.

Aromat: dosyć intensywny, słodki, nuty funkowe, słodkie białe owoce, owoce kandyzowane, rodzynki. Ciemnobursztynowe a nawet jasno miedziane, ładna gruba warstwa piany utrzymująca się. Osad drożdżowy na dnie butelki. Wysycenie wysokie, czuć je na języku.
Smak:krzepkie, wykwintne, szlachetne, spokojne i stonowane. Przyjemna i dosyć ciężka podbudowa słodowa, nie jest mdła, smaczna. Tonowana przez wysycenie, leciutką goryczkę chmielową i jeszcze lżejszą kwaskowatość. Nuty brettowe, stajenne, słodkie białe owoce, melon,banan, może delikatnie cytrusy. Owocowe i pijalne

Barwa miedziana, mętna. Piana nalewa się spora, ale średnio pęcherzykowa, szybko znika. W aromacie gorzka pomarańcza, grejpfrut, guma balonowa. W smaku ziołowo trawiasta goryczka dosyć spora, poza nią spore wysycenie, posmak pozostaje długo w ustach.
Une bière trappiste légère, un bel équilibre de houblon et de levure. Et pour couronner, une de mes bouteilles préférées, avec un design unique.
Flot orange farve med elegant hvidt luftigt skum. Citrusfrugt, kardemomme, koriander og gær noter i duften. Smagen har den helt rette kombination af sødme , syrlighed og bitterhed. Perfekt øl. .
Citrus orange peel notes. Soft mellow bitter taste. Nice orange like colour. Elegant beer.
UPDATED: MAR 28, 2017 Lovely Belgian beer. Lots of complexity in the beer. Purchased single bottle 330ml from LCBO. My bottle says 6.9% tho. As mentioned in description the ABV can range up to 7.2%

Bottle from beer hawk. Well, it is certainly an interesting beer. It combines strong sour flavours with sweet, with bitter. It is supposedly only 6.2% but is probably more (definitely feels it), have to drink it like a wine. Red wine, sour raspberry. At times felt this was stunning, at others i wanted to like it but just found it confused. Hmmm.

Fantastyczne piwo, świetny aromat brettów, dziki, trochę owocowy, nieco ziołowości chmielowej. W smaku również petarda. Wytrawne, solidnie wysycone, dzikie, owocowe, chmielowe. Niby proste piwo, bez żadnych ekstremów, ale fantastyczne.
Birra di colore ambrato chiaro, corposa ma al tempo stesso molto facile da bere. Aroma e gusto molto particolare rispetto al suo genere, forse anche grazie alla luppolatura a freddo.

Aromat: Trawa, ziemia, woda mineralna. trochę dzikości, pomarańcze, cytrusy. 
Wygląd: Złocisty i delikatny kolor. Piana wysoka, drobna, ładnie obklejająca. Szybko opada 
Smak: Białe wino, białe winogrona, trawa, ziemia, nalewka ziołowa, pomarańcze, cytryna, woda z saturatora (naprawdę nie mam lepszego porównania :)). 
Odczucie w ustach: sporo gazu, jak na belga ok. Goryczka duża, trawiasto-ziołowa, przyjemna, średnio zalegająca. Alkoholu całkowity brak, aż musiałem sprawdzać czy przypadkiem nie kupiłem czegoś innego! :D. Bardzo orzeźwiające, lekkie i sprężyste. Gładkie i smukłe. 
Ogólnie: Sztandarowy belg. Legenda tego piwa nie bierze się znikąd. Warto spróbować, tym bardziej, że chodzi u nas w cenie regularnych piw (~13PLN).
Flasche in einem Restaurant in Brüssel. Goldener Körper. Aroma Hefe, Hopfen, fruchtig. Geschmack vielschichtig leicht bitter am Anfang, verschiedene Früchte (dezent), würzig

This is without a doubt a good beer if you like hops and bitterness. Not necessary my cup of tea ( or beer if you prefer) to begin with, as I usually prefer stronger Abbey or Trappist ones, still, its obviously a pleasant one with a strong character. Quite a lot of bitterness at first, then much smoother in mouth. The end was way more pleasant to me. If you like IPA beers or classic Belgian ones, youll surely like this one a lot. APPROVED BY TAVERNYS BLACK METAL CREW!

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2017 Birra di colore giallo dorato/ambrato. Schiuma cremosa e di media persistenza. Allolfatto sentori di prugna, spezie e zeste. Al palato corposa ed asciutta con note di frutta secca, spezie, zeste, zagara e malto. Nel finale piacevolmente amara. Una grande trappista perfetta con i formaggi

33cl bottle from local Alko, Viikki. An excellent product. This effort of brewing in its style reminds me of saying: Dont join an easy crowd. You wont grow. Go where the expectations and the demands to perform and achieve are high. Jim Rohn Nice unique brew with all the farmhouse hints.
Bottle. Yeasty aroma. Awesome foam. Well, well, well. Yeast. Basement. Light. Sophisticated.

33 cl. bottle at P-Cube, Trezzo sullAdda. Cloudy dark orange/light copper colored with a frothy off-white head. Yeasty and slightly funky aroma, sour fruits. Taste is again slightly funky and soursweet. Almost no bitterness. Lively carbonation with medium body and creamy texture. A pleasant finish: somewhat sour, a bit funky and dry. This is indeed a very nice beer.

If i were to give a Beer novice a Beer that would show Her/Him exactly what a Beer should look,smell and taste like, then this beer would be it.It is perfect in my opinion.Perfect appearance,aroma,flavour.Its own iconic character.Perfect with the Cheese.No excess sugers,perfect attenuation.

330ml bottle. Pours a murky gold with lots off offwhite/slight brown head. Intense nose which has notes similar to Ginger Ale. The same Ginger Ale flavour comes throguh again in the taste with high carbonation and a slight zing.

Pours cloudy bronze in colour. Mine had a crazy aggressive head. Upfront confronting bitterness, quickly moderated by caramel malty sweetness but only to the point of balancing off the bitterness. Creamy finish includes that bitterness but again all balanced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Narancssárgás szín, szép nagy fehér hab. Citrusos, narancsos illat. Mézes, karamelles, édes ízzel indít. Aztán hosszan lecsengő utóízében már a komló keserűsége dominál. Egész nap el tudnám kortyolgatni.

Oh Orval, what can there be said that hasnt been said before? You are a steady rock in the ever increasing swell of "craft beer". You have been here before almost all other beers I know and like. You will probably still be here once the craft beer bubble bursts and the number of breweries decreases again and I love you for that.
Bottle at Herman - Slightly hazy golden color with a nice off-white head. taste is a bit yeasty, hoppy, slightly fruity. malty. very well balanced. very nice to drink. Good.

With 6.9% alc. Pours with a nice and airy foam that can be made to look very appealing. The foam also stays long. Color is of mead, very nice color. Aroma is delicious having fruits (mango, plum, black grapes) and some yeast, almost smells like fruit juice. Palate is strongly, but finely carbonated and is slightly yeasty and dry. Taste is tea-like having a "herbal" overall feeling to it (similar to those herbal pouches sold for refreshing odours) and also tastes like a hippie/vegan food store smells. Additionally taste has some salt licorice. Overall the beer has a slightly strange/surprising taste, but not bad by any means. Theres a slight bitterness from the hops. This tastes like a very good quality ale and seems to be in its own category (since I have never tasted something quite similar tasting beer). Very refreshing as well.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2017 Bottle in Ghent with commonmac, samuelito, willyp, and rosskyle. Light copper with thick white head. Yeasty funky spiced aroma. Spicy and heavy carbonation mouthfeel. Slightly murky. Taste is slightly hopped citrus on top of the heavy base of yeast. Well done across the board. A classic.

Compared tasting (2017 and 2012) at Olut, Sabadell. The older has darker colour and persistent white head. The older has a vinegarish, lambic aroma. The young has a long bitter finish and has sweeter aroma. The old one has increased carbonation, sparkling-like very small bubbles.

Bottle with friends at home.
Maybe this one didnt go to well in our tasting round, or it had aged too long for my taste.
Poured misty amber gold with a large head.
Aroma had hay, fruity, leather?
Taste was spicy, citrus, something off.
Birra storica, complessa, unica. Di quelle birre che si amano o si odiano, non esistono altre vie.

bottiglia 33 cl, premetto che è giovane, ne proverò una un pò più matura. Schiuma media grana beige molto persistente, colore ambrata, al naso lieviti note fruttate albicocca spezie, in bocca è complessa non so descrivere, carbonatazione decisa, di leggero corpo con amaro che svanisce subito, secca nel finale. Un mito!

330 ml bottle. Pours a hazy amber with a long lasting huge frothy white head. The aroma is mild, a little yeasty, leathery and rather hoppy for this style with citric fruits. Medium body with a fizzy carbonation medium bitterness. The flavor is lightly malty (pale malt) with a decent hop presence and a light fruitiness (oranges); bitter finish. Absolutely not what I expected, yet a decent beer.

Bottle at The Office some time ago. Aroma: Funk, fruit, hay, spice. Appearance: Golden and hazy body, nice high head. Taste: Very funky, some herbal notes, fruit, phenols, medium biterness. Palate: Dry finish, low body, high carbonation.

Butelka 0,33l. Obfita piana, delikatnie zamglony bursztyn. W aromacie bardzo przyjemnie, pomarańcza, gruszka, siano. W smaku owocowe, nadal gruszka, nadal siano, goryczka umiarkowana, nieco alkoholowa. Nasycenie wysokie.

Bottle (less than half a year old). Unclear amber colour, large rocky white head with great duration and lacing. Aroma is yeasty, hoppy, fruity with notes of citrus, pear, spices, flowers, light funk. Taste is light sweet, light to medium bitter, fruity (pear, apple), floral, spicy, citrusy. Medium body, lively carbonation (a bit overcarbonated). Great, but not in its prime yet.
Very hoppy and very dry. Very yeasty with an almost barnyard aroma and character. Quite effervescent. Glad I tried it.

Bottle. Amber in colour. Dense fluffy head. Hoppy, yeasty, fruity nose. Intensely hoppy. Fruity (citrus-orange, grapefruit, apricot, apple). Spicy (lots of spices). Yeasty (earthy, musty). Underlying malty sweetness. Smooth. Nice hop/fruit/spice/malt balance. Nice medium bitter aftertaste. Lovely stuff. Terrific beer! (2008)
Probably I got a bad batch. Bursted like champagne when opened. Not a good smell. Taste is kind of ok, some fruityness, some bitterness. Nothing special though.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2017 Bottle at home. Pours muddy orange, amber, with frothy head, lotsbof bubbles.Tastes like fruit, spices, citrus peel, sour notes, astringent, new leather taste. It is quite different, funky and unique. There is a mild, sweet-bitter spicyness to this beer. I like it, as it tastes like nothing I had before. Impressive.

Aromat wyraźny i intensywny, bogactwo owoców, w tle wytrawność i dzikie nuty.

Alkohol ładnie się ułożył. Niestety nasycenie wysokie, bardzo szybko powoduje uczucie sytości.

This beer is almost a beer type on its own.It is light brown beer, with a fresh malty taste. 
It has like a slightly salted taste.

033l bottle and I want to think I got a bad batch. First I had a little accident when I opened the bottle, it looks as if I had just opened champagne despite not having shacken it too much. The abv is definitely more than 6.2%, you can sense it in the smell and also the taste. Other aromas contain some pinapple, banana, and caramel. Not too strong but smells ok, baybe a bit too boozy. Then, even though it should have lost most of the gas, it was waaaay too carbonated, not very pleasant. The finish was kind of weak too, at least the texture was alright. Bonus points for its relatively low price and accessibility, but I didnt enjoy it too much. Will try to re-rate soon.

Bottled, 6.2% ABV. Pours hazy orangeish colour with long lasting white head. It has several characteristics woven together in its aroma and taste: hops, floral and citrusy notes, slight cinnamon and sweet alcohol, all of them well combined. Medium bodied yet easily drinakble, lively carbonated and refreshing. Leaves dry, bitter finish on the palate. Very nice.

330ml bottle into tulip. Very active out of the bottle, every small pour creates an enormous funnel of foam. Eventually the glass reveals a golden caramel coloured beer with a frothy white head and a million tiny bubbles. Fruity sour nose, notes of pepper and malt and sultanas. Body is light, texture is smooth with a little zing. Finish is dry with dark fruit and a little smoky malt. Late on alcohol becomes prominent. Goes well with cheese.

Tried in a tasting and I wouldnt say it is a bad beer at all, but it was the weakest of the ones we tried.
Aroma: forest notes (pine neddle), sweet expectations
Appearance: nice dirt brown ambar colour.
Taste and palate: Sweet but with a bitter aftertaste. Toasted feelings in the tongue. It has a bitter full flavour that remains for a while.
Overall: Not a bad beer but I was expecting much more from a trappist brewery.
33 cl bottle @ home. Brown amber colour, big beige head. Floral aroma, some sweet honey, and malty notes. Medium bitter taste with a sour touch. Good trappist.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2017 Orval is a unique beer, with a recognisable style of its own. That fish on the label fits very well: this beet reminds me of the sea a lot. From the very sea-like heavy foam head to the bitter hoppiness like a windy day by the sea. Smell is always a little peculiar, with a tiny hint of urine. Not my favourite part of the beer. I don?t usually like bitterness, but Orval does it nicely. Floral notes, hay, hoppiness. Quite complex.

Floral citrusy hop aroma, with leather and sweaty notes in the background. Light hint of caramel and toasty malts.

Light to medium body, but bolstered by fizzy carbonation. Slick texture with a bone-dry finish.

An incredibly complex classic. So refreshing.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2017 i know its a masterpiece but i think it should have more than 6.2%. sour and bitter taste is unique.

Dur de sattaquer à un mythe aussi fort que lOrval, mais bon après tout, il ne sagit que dune bière ! Belle couleur dorée/orangée presque transparente avec une très grosse mousse ivoire dense à montée centrale. Au nez, on sent une bière avec un caractère bien trempé ! Des agrumes (citron vert, mandarine en tête), des aromates (coriandre, basilic, thym, romarin, origan, estragon...), de la fleur (illet, tulipe, bouton de rose, pissenlit, jacinthe...) et du foin, des céréales légèrement torréfiées assez lointaines... La carbonatation est soutenue, la texture sèche au démarrage et plus souple sur la fin, lamertume étant sous contrôle tout au long de la dégustation. Lalcool est au top (6.2%), il soutient les arômes et les saveurs sans les entacher. Le final est sur la sécheresse des houblons, toujours avec ce côté floral très prononcé qui est la qualité première de cette bière (à mon sens). La levure est bien perceptible, longue, légère, dans larrondi... La longueur est intéressante, reste une sécheresse sur du velours pendant de longues secondes... On trouvera aussi des parfums marins avec un côté iodé et salin très surprenant. Très honnêtement, lOrval na jamais été ma bière préférée et de loin, mais elle a pour elle une histoire et loriginalité de sa recette ainsi que de sa bouteille reconnaissable entre mille. Je ne mettrais pas la meilleure des notes par honnêteté, mais je sais reconnaître un breuvage dexception. Bouteille 33cl, V&B Grenoble.

W zapachu czerwona wiśnia i końska derka.
Drobna, trwała piana. Bursztynowa barwa. 

Cierpki goryczkowy smak. Wysokie nasycenie . Dobra kompozycja. Alkohol niewyczuwalny.

Verticale de bouteilles vieillies de 1 à 4 ans. Bouteille datée du 14/03/2013, bue après 46 mois. Robe ambrée foncée légèrement trouble surmontée dun épais col de de mousse blanc et rocailleux. Arômes de levures sauvages, malt caramélisé, sirop de poire, pêche, sucre brun liquide, pomme fermentée et citron poivré. En bouche, malt caramélisé, levures séchées, zeste dorange séché, citron séché, herbes séchées. Saveurs très brèves, carbonatation fine et trop présente. Texture légère et corps mince. Ne semble pas avoir appréciée son séjour en cellier. 5-4-5-3-11

Bouteille datée du 27/05/2014, bue après 32 mois. Même robe. Arômes sensiblement pareils à la 2013 mais le coté fermenté un peu moins présent. Semble plus fraîche. En bouche, toujours ces saveurs brèves et sèches. Pas mal identique à la précédente mais un côté vieillot en moins. 6-4-5-3-12.

Bouteille datée du 26/03/2015, bue après 22 mois. Même robe mais un col de mousse plus épais. Arômes de levures sauvages, citron et zeste dorange. Quelques épices, poivre, fruits du verger. Soupçon dagrumes. En bouche, fruits du verger, levures sauvages, orange, citron. Également notes dépices à dessert, poivre, herbes séchées. Carbonatation moins envahissante. Nette amélioration. 7-4-6-4-14.

Bouteille datée du 06/01/2016, bue après 12 mois. Même robe, même mousse. Arômes qui ressemblent à la 2015 avec un côté canne à sucre en plus. En bouche, levures sauvages, poivre et zeste de citron. Un peu de pomme, clou de girofle. Saveurs brèves. Forte carbonatation qui fait encore évoluer la mousse dans la bouche. Texture épaisse et mousseuse, corps mince. 7-4-6-3-13

Cerveja acobreada, muito frisante, grande formação de espuma. Aroma bem complexo, frutado (banana, figos), "funky" e uma base de pão, dá pra ficar cheirando por uns bons minutos e descobrindo novas nuances. Sabor igualmente complexo, cítrico, com limão, banana e uma base de malte, que dá lugar a acidez e leve azedo das Brettanomyces à medida que evolui. Final amargo, adstringente, seco. Ótimo corpo, efervescente, complexa, uma cerveja para qualquer ocasião.

33cl. bottle @ Home.
Aroma: quite intense aromas of cider, apple, spices. Hints of citrus, orange peel, malts, yeast.
Appearance: deep and pretty amber-orange color with super huge and super creamy rocky slightly off-white head and extra high retention. Medium-to-high Brussels lacing. Hazy beer.
Taste: low sweetness, low-to-medium bitterness, low sourness. Flavors of cider, malts, spices, citrus, grapefruit, yeast.
Palate: light-to-medium body, oily texture, average carbonation, quite long dry bitter finish with an acidic touch with flavors of cider, malts, spices, orange peel, yeast.
Overall: excellent appearance, foam thickness and retention. Good aromas of cider, spices, citrus. Good flavors of cider, malts, spices, grapefruit, citrus, yeast. Probably the best foam retention and thickness Ive ever seen on a beer, simply amazing. Very different and complex beer, but very well balanced and pleasant. Good beer.

La tradition brassicole à labbaye de Notre Dame dOrval est relativement jeune, car ce nest quen 1931 que la brasserie a été créée pour financer la reconstruction de labbaye. Est-ce par inspiration divine, que le maître brasseur Pappenheimer crée lOrval ? On pourrait le croire, tant les spécificités liées à sa recette et la maîtrise brassicole liée à sa réalisation en font une bière de référence. En verre, lOrval est dun beau cuivré, limpide et son effervescence marquée lui confère une mousse blanc-cassée, majestueuse, imposante saffaissant par « cratères ». Le nez est très développé. Personnellement, il me fait penser à celui dun cidre fermier, où à la ferme elle-même avec un côté terroir développé. La dégustation est dune richesse infinie. Chaque gorgée vous fera découvrir un pan de la bière, et ce nest quen fin de dégustation quil est possible dapercevoir toutes les subtilités de celle-ci. Lattaque marque dentrée lamertume, mais liée à la douceur de la poire et de la pomme. La deuxième bouche permet de découvrir une amertume intense, fraîche et herbacée (utilisation dun houblonnage à cru). Larrière bouche est quant à elle plus douce, sur des notes de caramel et de fruits rouges. Léquilibre est splendide car tellement tenu. Lalliance entre lamertume et le sucré, soutenu par une pointe dacidité (et jai bien dit une pointe!) est remarquable. Et une légère âpreté vient donner du caractère à la bière, mais sans trop assécher le palais cependant. Le final est très long et laisse sur le final découvrir une amertume évolutive, plus « grasse » sur des arômes dorange. Vous êtes devant un tableau de grand maître, où à chaque coup dil vous percevez un détail supplémentaire et où en vous déplaçant, votre perspective vous fait redécouvrir luvre. Comment alors noter une référence ? Je nen sais rien, nous sommes dans lincomparable. Seul le 5 me paraît simposer.

Aroma: Malt and yeast (my memory can?t be more specific than that) ; Appearance: Copper, cloudy, white foam, nice head ; Taste: medium bitterness ; Palate: full body, slick feel, important carbonation, not (imo) a very long finish.
This is, in my humble opinion, one of the most overrated beer of all time. It is only my opinion, of course, but after several tastings, I never could get to like this beer. I like other beers of similar styles, but this one, for me it?s a nope.

Pours golden brown with a big head. Rich taste, sweetness of banana, that probably originates from the yeast. Good introducing trappist.

Good, very lovable beer that differs from other trappists. Amber color,spicy herbal aroma with a few fruity notes,fresh palate. Limited aftertaste.

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2016 9:35 AM on a Tuesday
Anchor: Good morning Philadelphia. With us today is Frank Reynolds. Local business owner and a man with a harrowing story. 
Frank: Thats right. Three days ago three thugs tried to mug me. 
(grabs sandwich and waves it around)
Frank: Now I want to be very clear about something.
(takes a bite of sandwich)
Fank: These pieces of garbage, they dont know who the hell theyre dealing with-
Anchor: Excuse me, now do you think maybe you could eat that sandwich later? 
Frank: Im starving. You dont got nothing to eat on this show.
Anchor: Lets get back to-
Frank: Right. Now these punks, I dont know if they wanted money, or if they wanted something more sexual. But its a lucky thing I had my pieces.
Anchor: Pieces?
Frank: My guns
(pulls out two guns and points them at the camera)
Anchor: Oh...
Frank: Anyway, I started blasting (gesturing with guns). BANG BAH. Now I dont see so good so I missed. Then they ran away. I ran after them. BANG I tried to shoot them in the back but I dont run so good either. 
(sets guns on the table and faces the crowd)
Frank: Anyway, you guys all think Im a hero and Ill accept that responsibility. 
Anchor: Werent you concerned that an innocent bystander may have-
Frank: Crime in this city is out of control. Thank God I went down to Gunthers Guns and picked up a spare. I dont think one would have done it. Im gonna go out and buy some more. 
Anchor: OK-
Frank: And I think you should too. Dont be a victim. Its time to fight back. 

Had this plenty of times over the years but was finally coerced into typing up a rating. These bottles were bottled April 27, 2016. At 5 months old this is the youngest we can get Orval in the US and even though its between that hoppy fresh flavor and that nicely aged (12-18 months) mildly funky stage its still a damn good beer. 
As always its highly carbed, hazy, bitter, and delicious. Takes a while for the head to die down. As mentioned before, this has not yet developed the characteristic funk that it gets after a year in the bottle. Mind you thats under proper aging conditions. Aging in your closet does not count.

bottled 4/2012. the aroma is mostly catty (in a pleasant way), earthy, grassy with some dark fruit and spices. pours pale amber with a full-on head with large white bubbles. its def hazy. med body with slightly oily texture and more than moderate astringency. flavors of raisins and candy sugars. fruity esters and slight funkyness. significant bitterness that lasts long through in the aftertaste both smooths out over time. this is great Belgian drinking very close to its peak. label says it should cellar well into 2017

Bottle from vinum in Tübingen. Pours hazy orange. Smells of citrus and something bitter i cant quite Put my Finger on. Taste is so weird. Maybe i cant appriciate it yet, but it tastes like sanbitter or crodino mixed with beer. I bought another bottle, so Ill rerate it in a different setting.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2016 Aromat kwiatowy, owocowy, estrowy, fenolowy, bogaty i przyjemny. W wyglądzie miedziane, mętne, z obfitą kremową pianą. W smaku suszone owoce i owoce świeże - winogrona, śliwki, figi, rodzynki. Piwo dość pijalne, lekkie, bardzo smukłe i aksamitne, delikatne, a mimo to lekko rozgrzewające. Pozostawia lekką goryczkę. Można powiedzieć, że taka esencja belgijskich piw - ma w sobie lekkość saisona, mimo tego jest bogate w smaku i aromacie, niczym tripel lub abt. Są tu estry i fenole, jest też owocowość i lekka kwaskowatość lambic-ów i kwasów. Czuć tu też rękę trapistów, piwo jest dopieszczone, perfekcyjnie ułożone i bogate w doznania. Z jednej strony gasi pragnienie, ale da też się wypić w chłodny jesienny wieczór jak dziś w celu degustacji. Pyszne piwo
