Flaska från SB. ljust gul med massa smutsvitt skum. Tydlig funk och humle i doften med stall, läder och citrus. Lätt och bra munkänsla, smak av citrus, lite skumbanan och brett.
Bottle. Pours amber with thick white head. Aroma is sweet with notes of strawberries, honey and flowers. Taste is rich with notes of strawberries.

Smells funky, fruity and lightly sour. Also tones of herbs and spices in the smell. Light brown and somewhat clear. Head is white but disappears quickly. Taste is Brett, sour, dry, fruity. Somewhat dry and bitter tones join in after a sip. Aftertaste is quite neutral, and slightly dry. Quite carbonated with a oily body. Overall a unique and interesting Belgian Ale, and one of the best Trappist beers.

Złocista barwa, piwo bardzo się spieniło, trochę za bardzo, piana drobno i średnio pęcherzykowa, szybko dziurawiąca się. Niezły aromat, banan, guma balonowa. W smaku wytrawne, trochę fenolowe, lekko pustawe, goryczka średnio niska.

UPDATED: APR 28, 2017 The Best Belgian Ale. 07/2015. Gut ein Jahr alt ist das Bier fast unwiderstehlich lecker. Extrem andersartig kräuterig, spritzig und tripelig gehts zur Sache. Kraftvoll und erhaben. Mehr später....🙂. 0,33/40DKK in der Klosterkaelderen, Roskilde. April 2017. M-CAFE Leuven. Ein 3 Jahre alter...Pfannekuchen Belgian Lover, marmorierter Flemish Red Anwärter & zeitweise trocken wie ein Weißer. Dem Frischen wurden die Haare gestutzt 😀 19!!!!!

Bottle. Dark orange cloudy color, thick white head. Aroma is funky, bretty, lot of fruits, oranges, zest, spices, floral notes. Taste is solid malty, bretty, oranges, spices, zest, funky notes. Decent hoppy, dry finish, very good balanced

33cl bottle at home. Appearance: hazy orangy golden with big white head. Aroma is funky with a tart note, typical for lambic, floral notes, light malts. Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness and slightly acidic. Caramel, grapes, spice, mint. Finish is long and quite floral. Palate: medium bodied, oily texture and lively carbonation.

The gold standard. Whats left to say? Perfect hoppy/funk balance. And only gets better up to 2-3 years, where the funk takes on more complex sour characteristics and the bitterness fades away. Having tried all the way up to 5 years old, there is a noticeable drop-off after 3 years (IMO), with 2 years seeming to be the magic number. Love this beer.

A mio parere è una birra dalla personalità spiccata e sicuramente con un sapore poco comune e riconoscibile. Non è però granché complessa e si scopre un po troppo velocemente. Inoltre la persistenza del gusto amaro risulta troppo insistente per i miei gusti.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2017 Un clasicazo. Color ambar con capa de espuma blanca de más de dos dedos de grosor. Varía mucho dependiendo del tiempo que haya pasado desde su fecha de embotellado. He probado distintas Orval de distintas fechas y la diferencia es más que notable. Si está cerca del embotellado suele ser más lupulada, tanto en aroma como en sabor, con menos restos en la botella y con un carácter más acido y muy seco, que recuerda al champán o la sidra. Si ha pasado más tiempo, esa acidez se va matizando y convirtiéndose en dulzor y los restos en el interior de la botella son más notables. Según un experto en Orval, cuando han pasado dos años de la fecha de caducidad es cuando mejor está. No creo que vaya a tener la posibilidad de comprobarlo, pero de todas formas es un gusto tomarse esta cerveza en cualquier momento haya pasado el tiempo que haya pasado desde su embotellado.

Aroma of caramel, strong brett aroma, leather, earthy mustyness, some medicinal notes, sweet cereal aroma. Complex and quite intense! Amber to dark amber quite cloudy, medium to large sized head that stays put forever. Taste is quite balance with tart, sweet, hoppy, astringent with bitterness being quite strong. Amazing balance.Astringent and medicinal notes are present but not in a negative way, earthy hoppiness, tartness and quite bitter. Salinity and caramel is quite strong too. Medium body, medium to high bitterness. 
Fresh is so tasty but I still remember the taste of a 5 years old Orval with tartness and amazing funkiness....
Helt unik. Smager lidt hen ad noget vildgæret. Mørk gylden med tæt sprudlende skum.

Pours cloudy orange/dark amber with a big foamy, long lasting white head. Complex aroma of hops, malts, fruits, spices, yeast, citrus and barnyard. It tastes heavy bitter but balanced by a medium sweetness, leading to a long, dry, light sour, bitter and "bready" finish. Creamy texture, soft carbonation. Unique, very well balanced, but not the best Trappist for me, due to the hoppy flavour.

[backlog] 24-01-16 / bottle at Le Saint-Loup, namur, Belgium. My favourite belgian trappistes. Nice hop aroma. I started rating my beers with Untappd and a few basic notes. Now I want to rate them on ratebeer. So my rating sometimes lack some information. Just ignore it, it is for my personal statistics. Untappd-Rating 3.75/5
If I had to choose to drink one beer forever orval would be the one. Verry impressive how it developes in two years from pale ale to sour to complex brew. The best

0,33l bottle from Firmabier. Pours light brownish colour with a lot of head. Aroma has yeast, fruitiness, lighty tartness, hops, floral, some spices maybe. A bit bitter, lively carbonation, medium body.

Copenhagen 2/9 2016. 33 cl bottle from Meny. Nice chubby little bottle with small label with fish getting a dental examination. Bottle opens with an explosive pop. Pours hazy golden yellow with huge head. Lacing on the side of the glass. Settles as 3 cm thick layer of foam. Aroma is intense and fruity. Peach, slightly fermented plums and Belgian yeast. Medium carbonation and slightly thick palate. Flavor is well balanced. Medium sweetness followed by medium bitterness - more bitter than many Belgians. Bitter aftertaste and dry finish. A very nice one from Belgian monoliner Brasserie DOrval. And I like the chubby little bottle.

Aroma of peaches, grapefruits and spices, like pepper.
Medium-high bitterness (rather high for a belgian beer), medium sweetness. Leaves a bitter grapefruit atfertaste.

Authentiques bières trappistes. De par sa rareté et sa finesse, elle doit être consommée et dégustée avec attention. 
Cest une bière de fermentation haute et de maturation longue qui associe rondeur et amertume à la perfection.
I taste a lot beers in Belgium (including all of West Vleteren, Rochefort, ......) and in Europe. Orval is for me the best I taste.

Barwa bursztynowa, piana intensywna, redukuje się do obrączki.
Aromat średnio-intensywny, skóra, butwiejące drewno, skisłe siano, w tle nuty słodkiej brzoskwini.
W smaku wytrawne, z niuansami biszkoptowymi, wyprawiona skóra, siano. Finisz ze średnią goryczką ziołowo-drożdżową, na krótko zalegającą, cierpki i wytrawny.

Bottle 33 cl. Birra Trappista Il gusto un po vinoso si perde nellaroma di cereali e nel gusto fortemente luppolato, la schiuma dolcemente cremosa e persistente, va bevuta in un calice a tulipano molto ampio (classico dell´abazia) Questa birra è un prodotto eccellente, non mancate di provarla, il sapore estremamente complesso, le mille sfumature dellaroma la rendono prefetta per una degustazione lenta, interiore, quasi fosse un whiskey pregiato! L´Orval è certamente ottima se degustate insieme carni arrostite alla brace o cotte sulla pietra ollare, ma anche piccoli pezzi di formaggio d´abazia serviti insieme a sedano salato!

Beautiful cloudy amber unfiltered beer with an off white head that never stops. Aroma of hay overlaid with fruity and floral notes. Flavor is full of funky fermentation character with some raisin and fig notes, and a bitter finish.
Dry frothy fizzy and wonderful. Exactly what I imagine when I think trappist.
Bottle. Poured hazy, dark amber, foamy, lasting off white head. Aroma was figs, pear, some banana, sweet hay, dusty. Taste was mild bitterness, some sour notes, dry, medicinal lingering finish.

Bottle @ Musei Vaticani, Rome. Pours hazy amber with a big white head. The aroma features fresh and slightly sour apple and yeasty notes; very earthy, farmhouse-like theme. Taste is crisp and dry and a bit tart. Sour apple, yeasty spiciness and a touch of floral hoppiness create a refreshing, biting mix. The palate is medium-bodied, the carbonation lively. Yeast is playing a leading role here, hops a supporting one; malts do not feature much. Refreshing.
An unfilteted beer with a large foamy head, Strong carbonation. The aroma fruty, actually hints of flowers. The taste is fruty with bitter end.

Pullotettu 7.7.2011, BBE 7.7.2016 eli pari vuotta vanha tapaus. Samea, runsaasti vaahtoava vaaleanruskea olut. Vaahto jättää kivasti pitsiä. Tuoksu omenainen, viljainen ja epämiellyttävän saippuainen. Maku jatkaa samalla linjalla ollen ennen kaikkea kuivan omenainen ja hieman viljainen. Varsin yksiulotteinen joka tapauksessa. Kuin kuivaa siideriä joisi. Ja kun siideri ei omaan suuhun maistu, ei oikein tämäkään. Yhden pullon ajattelin jättää kypsymään pidempään, katsotaan josko tämä paranisi edes hieman.

11.2 oz bottle. Massive bubbly off white head. Color is a hazy, opaque burnt orange. Aromas of alcohol, yeast, very ripe banana, candied dark fruits. Medium body built on heavy carbonation. Chardonnay-like, dry, apricot, yeast, some funk, caramel. Some hoppy bitterness in the finish.
Theres something about these Belgium beers. They taste funny. Maybe Ill get used to them eventually.

i bought this from my local shop and was told to get the best flavor possible from it i was to pour half, swill the bottle and the pour the other half. i dont know if i messed up what seemed to be a very simple procedure but im not really a fan of this beer, that may just be my taste though. it pours into a fantastic looking deep red with an expansive looking head resembling any science fair project volcano in any american film that has a science fair. aroma is somewhat sour and almost reminiscent of the wild beer signature aroma, but not. the taste is dry with a primary taste of citrus but fades into hay. i must say as im writing and drinking i dont think its so much the beers fault as much as its the fact that its just not the taste i like.good beer, just not my kind of thing.

Apparence : Cuivrée, carbonatation élevée et rapide, gros col blanc, dentelle moyenne. 
Nez : Levure, épices, herbes, agrumes légers, pain grillé léger. Intensité moyenne à bonne. 
Goût : Levure tout à fait dominante sous forme dépices et de goût typiquement belge. Les houblons font leur part avec des notes herbacées et dagrumes. 
Sensation : Effervescence plutôt élevée, corps mince, piquant partout en bouche, légère amertume en finale, légère chaleur dalcool, longueur moyenne. 
Bref : Bière dominée par la levure belge et bien appuyée par des houblons herbacés et dagrumes. On a droit à une bière réellement bien équilibrée, sans rien de déplacé, tout est «à sa place». Buvabilité très élevée.

A bottle at the Cafe Bastille near Tai Power Building. Aroma: fruity, I detect pear. Appearance: clear golden brown, dense but minimal head. It looks great in its branded chalice. Palate: astringent and long-lasting. Taste: weird - I dont like it! The yeast in this one gives it a very special flavour - I appreciate that its a complex beverage and one that you shoud try if youre interested in the Trappists, but it simply isnt my cup of tea...

A trade with YantarCoast. Huge thanks. Hazy amber. Tall airy head. Average retention. Aroma: leather, horse blanket, fruit, ascorbic acid, brut champagne, floral hop. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Oily textute. Complex dry taste. Fruit & citrus peel. Champagne. Caramel malt. Light refreshing sourness. Solid resiny & floral bitterness. Long hoppy ending. Amazing how craft-like it is! A very distinct one. Great experience.

Originally rated on 9/26/08. Orval pours a mid to light brown body, super big head, with good carbonation. Aroma of apricots, raisins, and alcohol. Mouthfeel was a little on the light side and it was smooth. Flavor wasnt that great for me, alcohol was dominant with very slight hints of sour yeast. Overall it was a decent beer but at $ 5.00 + a bottle it wasnt that great, i might try one again someday in the future.
A little bit funky to begin with but aroma grows fragrant. Beautiful dark colour and highly carbonated. Reminiscent of crunchy nut cereal. Not too memorable but would give it another try.
Orange color, unclear. Sweet fruit aromas, oranges, spices. Very dry, white wine, yeast, fruits, some hop. Almost like a champagne. Dry finish.

Robe orangée, opaque, avec un col de mousse équilibré. Au nez, les levures belges dominent sur le fruité. En bouche on a une bière très équilibrée. Entre les notes de céréales, de fruit (pruneau, agrumes), le sucré et lamertume. Le palais passent par ces différentes étapes, et la bière est ronde. Une excellente bière sainte. !

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2016 33cl bottle, served in Orval trappist chalice. Poured cloudy amber with a two finger ivory head. Delicious aromas of orange peel, peach, cherry, grenadine, grapefruit, bready malt. Taste: Orange, peach, cherry, grapefruit, hoppy bitterness, caramel, spice, grapes, grenadine, citrus, bread, jam, strawberry, blood orange. Very foamy, creamy mouthfeel. Medium body with a funky dryness in the finish. Very good combination between the hoppy bitterness and malty sweetness. Delicious fruity Trappist ale!

UPDATED: APR 22, 2017 (176 nap) Gyönyörű, enyhén homályos, vörösbe hajló borostyán szín. Óriási, nagyon tartós, fehér hab. Határozott gyümölcsös, narancsos-mandarinos illat, némi karamellel. Íze intenzíven komlós keserű, kissé karamellás, citrusos, némi gyantával. Egy icipicit kiérezni az élesztőt. Utóíze hosszan tartó, kesernyés, kicsi gyantával és gyümölcsösséggel. Testes de nem nehéz, nagyon karakteres, de még nincsenek az ízek igazán összesimulva. (314 nap) Különbség: kissé intenzívebb citrusosság, sokkal jobb egyensúly, az élesztősség eltűnt. Ez már egy határozottan jobb sör. (570 nap) A karamell szinte teljesen eltűnt mind az illatából, mind az ízéből. Ízei összesimultak, a gyömölcsösségből csak az ipás keserűssége lóg ki egy kicsit.

Aroma is plum, cherry, any number of dark fruits, light sourness/acidity, sweet caramel. Appearance is golden amber with enormous frothy off white head. Taste is cherry forward with plum and dark fruits. Some sourness and light acidity. Sweetness from the malt is nice but this is a fruity beer. Palate is light and crisp. Dry but some residual sugars still. Cherries linger in the mouth with the Brett. Overall an amazing beer. One you need to try. Changes with age as the Brett continues to ferment and evolve. This was about 2 years old and there was plenty of sweetness left in the bottle..... would love to try one all dried out after 5 years or so. Really a fun and one of a kind beer.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2016 Bottle. Pours hazy dark amber. Has an enourmous fluffy white/cream head. A true beauty. Aroma of fruits, perhaps some sour berries, caramel, hops, lemon zest, citrus, and finally some floral features. Taste is well-balanced, not as tart as the aroma might lead one to suspect. Has a malty, bitter quality, some caramel like sweetness, and a dry finish. Perhaps the taste has some spices. Medium carbornation.

Bottle - Hazy deep amber colour, large and stable rocky off-white head. Rich fuity and malty aromas with decent herbal and flowery hops. Taste is comlex malty with gentle hop bitterness. Peach, grapes, some caramel, dried plum and some orange. Medium body, average carbonation, silky texture, fruity finish with elegant hop aromas. Well balanced, really great belgian ale with complex fruitiness and sophisticated hopping.

Great authentic trappist ale (barley wine), though very different from the rest of them. Has similar aroma as the Grimbergen Ambrée, just more controlled and toned down. Can only recommend!  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Un grand classique. Grosse mousse, robe assez sombre. Classique, sucre et amertume bien équilibré. Du fruit confit (prune) Un peu surcoté mais bonne bière.

UPDATED: APR 12, 2017 Barwa herbaciana, piana dosyć szybko się redukuję. Aromat wyjątkowy i niepowtarzalny. Podobnie jest w smaku. Ciężko go opisać w kilku słowach. Trzeba po porostu spróbować. Dosyć mocne wysycenie. Piwo leżakując robi się delikatniejsze i bardziej ułożone. Świerze jest bardziej owocowe.

Bottle from 2013. Hazy dark amber pour with huge white head. Aroma has lots of spices. Some citric brett and also cherry. Taste has instant sourness. Sparkling feeling. Beautiful and loaded with flavours. Lots of similarities with wild fermented brews. Medium carbonation.
Pours a medium amber with a thin white head. Yeasty, bready aroma. Lots of carbonation. Somewhat fruity taste with a tingly sensation and a dry finish. Not as enjoyable as I expected.

Bouteille 33 cl - couleur orange abricot, mousse blanche intéressante, odeur dagrumes, fruité, au goût : un délice, on part sur les agrumes, la levure et on finie sur lamertume, très forte mais étonnamment agréable et très longue en bouche, une très bonne bière

Poured from 33cl bottle [bottled in 2011 (label is messed up so cant tell when exactly); best before 18/07/2016 - aged]. Clear, orangey brown with off-white head. Aroma of orange and peach, light belgian yeast, some spice. Taste of yeast and spice with very mild brett and a subtle dry hop finish. Flavour actually dissipates a bit quickly and is almost a light watery finish. Quite good, but it doesnt quite land the vault.

Cloudy honey. Large head, low retention to medium head, then on hogh retention. Aroma intensity 3.5/5. Yeasty aroma, notes of hay and thyme. Medium bitter, light sour. Medium dry finish. Fizzy carbonation. Light to medium body. Interesting palate

At home, 2016 33cl bottle.
Pour: golden honey, dark orange, tall head, slow dissipation, lumpy foam.
Smell: malt, metallic, toffee.
Taste: first - sweet, malt, ; mid - malty; after - dry metallic bitterness.
Mouthfeel: slightly aggressive, strong malty bitterness, dry.
Verdict: Pleasant and filling experience. Strong flavours, but a very good ale.

Citrus, grass, flower, amber/copper with a good white head very persistant, light/medium body, medium carbonation, very dry and bitter, grass, bread and citrus...this fish will be a beautiful and unforgettable dream when the glass will remain empty on the table.
Aus der Flasche (vom Händler bezogen) getrunken. Golden trüb im Glas mit betonharter Schaumkrone. Im Antrunk voll trappistenhefig und etwas wässrig. Später kommt eine leichte Sprittigkeit durch.

330 mL bottle. The pour is a bright golden orange color with a huge pillowy white head that fades down to a thicker collar and a light film with a pretty decent lace left behind. The aroma is surprising. There is a nice tartness that I would imagine comes from the dry hopping. There isnt a lot of belgian character here. There is a light caramel and a decent malt, but its mostly tart and crisp. A combination of hop and grape skins. The flavor is interesting. There is a tartness and a profound hoppiness, but its strange. There is a light malt and that same vinousness. The carbonation is bright and spritzy, which isnt that well matched, and a lingeringly bright, tart finish. This is completely surprising for what I was expecting. Nothing like a Belgian at all. Hmm...

Nice amber color, minimal white head. Sweet aroma of brett yeasts, fruits like orange and peach, light caramel aroma. Light sour and sweet, light body, fizzy carbonation, medium bitterness. Good wild refreshing beer

Fles van Januari 2016. Oranje kleurig, troebel, matige witte schuimkraag, deze zakt aardig snel. Aromas: Brett wilde gist, tikje banaan, moutig, bloemige / fruitige hops, hooi.
Smaak heeft een zuurtje van de wilde Brett gist, citrus. Ook wat kruidige toetsen en iets zoutigs. Hopbitter is floraal in de nasmaak.
CO2 is behoorlijk aktief in de mond, body medium, de afdronk is wat droog. Ik hou wel van deze stijl.... kan me ook goed voorstellen dat er mensen minder enthousiast zijn. Klasse Trapist met een heel eigen stijl !!

Bottle from the Queen Edith, Cambridge. In a terribly inappropriate glass but I can live with that. Golden with a huge, loose, slightly off-white head. Yeast domimates the aroma with an indefinable floral funk. A perfect aroma. Sweet, yet slightly sour, with a cheeky medicinal hop bitterness at the end. Theres something almost sexual about the aftertaste. I crave this.

Great. The fresh taste of the dryhopping and the smooth taste of the sugars in combination with the orval yeast makes this beer simply perfect. One word: Unique 

Serving Tip: if you want to have a great beer taste experience make sure your glass is cleaned and flush very well. Flush the typical Orval glass with hot water 60-80 degrees celcius to make sure all germs and dust is removed. Secondary, make sure that all the carbonate is flushed with water. Cool the glass afterwoods with cold water to prevent it from braking a part. 

This process will give you the ultimate taste sensation an Orval Trappist Ale deserves!

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2016 Dark golden with well lasting frothy white head. Aroma is flowery hops, papaya, passion fruit, citrus. Taste is fruity sour but also bitter. Foamy mouthfeel but atill with a good body. Long hoppy bitter finish. Overall very good.

Update: 12 year old version (2004): there is more caramel and forest and the beer is much sweeter.
Ocher-apricot color, off white thick head. Fruity aroma, cherry. Bubblegum flavors, salt, cherry, sweet and sour. Full taste, strong finish, pleasant.

I was really excited by this beer. It pours a darkish orange and has a big fluffy head. it doesnt have strong aromas but you can pick up very hoppy notes. It is the smell you would get if you were to have the hop resin and nothing else. very herbal. The taste is totally different to any other Trappist beer. It is very dry and not much else. It has high carbonation but once this mellows the taste of the beer comes through a little more. However even then it is nothing special, just very hoppy. The beer also feels stronger than the 6.2% on the bottle. It is very warming considering but its pleasant I suppose. I will get more of this beer and see how it does with a little more ageing. It should calm down and become a little more complex, perhaps even more mellow.

Freshly bottled. Unclear orange amber. Off White lasting head. Moderate funk, growing as it warmed. Citrus. Some earthy, spicy hops; mild bitterness. A little woody. Semi dry. Light body. Very interested to try an older vintage.
Leicht trübes Bernstein mit reichlich Schaum. Malzig, fruchtig, etwas Apfel, Zitrus, leicht bitter, trocken, sehr spritzig.

Nice shape of the bottle. Amber color with huge white head. Slightly sour taste with medium bitterness in aftertaste. Fruity, funky aroma. Good beer but a lot of carbonation! I have to pour it in larger glass, so it doesnt grow in my mouth. Taste of alcohol very well hidden.
UPDATED: MAY 9, 2016 Bottle at home. Dark amber colour with a medium white head. Nose is slight sourness. Medium bitterness, with low lingerig sourness. Dry mouthfeel. A trappist masterpiece!

Une excellente bière de grande qualité mais un peu trop amer à mon goût, manque darômes et de finesse pour moi. Très longue en bouche ce qui est agréable mais pas assez onctueuse à mon goût. Une vrai référence malgré tout à goûter absolument.
Cloudy amber to brown color. Very abundant off-white head. Sourish aroma. Hop bitter, some malt notes. A bit thin texture and abrupt finish,

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2016 Pours a hazy golden with a huge white head. Aroma is sour, Bretts, slightly fruity. Taste is sour, hoppy bitterness, yeasts. Hoppy bitterness aftertaste. It tastes totally different to all others Trappist beers. Not a fan of so sour wild stuff :-) But if you are, then this beer will be tasty for you.
orange beer, white head, peaches, biscuits, sweet orange. Too high carbonation, when it warmed up and carbonation went off, it kicked me out of my shoes. But earlier it was tough to drink

Détonation unique au décapsulage : un coup de carabine à air comprimé.

1 / Lapparence :
- Mousse : Fine, "solide", se creusant et laissant un relief montagnard inspirant, dun blanc cassé assez terne, bien persistante, collant amoureusement au verre.
- Couleur : Ambrée orangée presque rougeâtre, assez trouble
- Bulles : Petites, quelques.Effervescence petite à moyenne quand on prend le soin de bien laérer au service, verre TEKU 33cL.

2 / Lodeur :
Houblon vous dîtes ? je perçois dabord les levures sauvageonnes, cube de levure boulangère bien marquée, définie à la perfection.Notes de pomme, cidre, calvados par le côté vraiment sec et franc de la pomme "transformée", cidre extra brut aussi peut-être, cidre artisanale paysan qui titre 6-7 °
Quelque chose de pamplemousse, agrume sec et amère.
Notes épicées, parfum dambre, qui arrondissent le nez plutôt de prime abord sec et fruité.

3 / Le goût :
Fluide, franche, bien sec et amer mais pas tant astringent, donc délice.
Le houblon prédomine avec des notes vertes et fraîches.
Une certaine fraicheur herbeuse mais bien emmitouflée dans ses notes épicées et levurées rondes bien que tranchantes et marquées.Vous connaissez le cube de levure boulanger ? cest exactement ça, et on retrouve la même chose cher la XX de de Struise.
4 / Leffet en bouche :
Arômes assez secs mais corps sachant tempérer leurs ardeurs et ce de façon vraiment délicate et subtile : équilibre de lensemble, équilibre discret qui cache son jeu.Le chemin cest sec, moelleux, sec.Mais pas astringent donc jamais trop sec.
Grosse persistance, la grogée avalée continue à stimuler pailles et capteurs de flaveurs nasales.

5 / Facilité à boire :
Grosse tuerie, pardon lexpression est simple mais cest vrai.elle est unique, un peu moins depuis la XX de de struise (qui est largement moins bien maîtrisée mais intéressante).

Le côté pomme allié à ses levures belliqueuses "boulangères" cest inédit et le tout enrobé dun corps qui dit pas son nom mais fais le job quand son bras droit "taux dalcool" vous appuie sur la nuque et vous tapote le front vers la fin du verre.
Onze, cleat, nice yellow foam. Aroma of wild yeast. Bret, sweet, malt, dry with growing hoppines in the aftertaste.

Wow. What a head on this thing. I'm pretty new to Belgian ales but this is what I've been looking for in a Belgian. Great body but really easy drinking. Could easily drink a few of these an not notice the alcohol until much later. Very happy with this one. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is a good beer, for sure, but I wouldnt go so far as calling it one of the best available. Maybe its not my type or maybe the one Ive had was from a less fortunate batch, but the hops did not feel so well balanced in the taste throughout.

Cerveza muy compleja como todas sus hermanas trapenses. Cuerpo medio, muy buena apariencia y espuma duradera. Equilibrada y sin notas de alcohol que estropeen la experiencia. Predominan las notas dulces y a platano, pero sin llegar a empalagar. Muy recomendable.
Pobudzająca zmysły klasyczna butelka bez prawdziwej piwnej etykiety przypomina butelkę do wina. Mocne piwo klasztorne, jedynie w małych butelkach 330 ml.

UPDATED: APR 15, 2016 Appearance. Clear amber with huge headAroma: grassy hops Mouthfeel: medium light, high carbonationTaste: spices, citrus. Overall: great beer, no boozy notes. Light and easy to drink
Fizzy orange color with HUGE white head. Creamy strong yeast with some grass aroma. Light sour and quite bitter taste. Quite bitter and yeasty aftertaste too. Dont like this one.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2017 1) Bue 4 ans et 8 mois avant DLC. Bière rousse avec pas mal de bulles et un très beau col de mousse qui tient. La mousse colle au verre. Arômes dagrumes prononcés mais aussi dautres fruits (?). En bouche, crémeuse. Final sur lagrume et la levure dans 1er temps puis sur une très forte amertume avec une longueur en bouche exceptionnelle. Fond de bouteille avec levure beaucoup plus doux et fruité.

2) Bue 3 ans et 8 mois avant DLC avec camembert bien coulant. Mousse a crateres de ouf. Tres belle rondeur et pointe dalcool malgre ses 6,2%
A nice and coplex mix of yeast, malt and fruits in both aroma and taste. A good beer.

0,33l bottle at home. Bottled 08/10/2015. BB 08/10/2020. bit of a gusher this one. amber quite hazy color, quite big off-white head. smells quite funky, lightly sour, green apples, light belgian yeast, light sweetness, peach, nutty, marzipan. very nice smell. medium body, light carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes grassy, light funk, caramel, rather malt heavy, citric, herbal, peppery, spices, nutty. rather short finish with rather strong bitterness of grass and citric notes + some spices. 2nd glass: after pouring way more gentle, the 2nd glass has a lot of carbonation, very soft mouthfeel, for me a little too much carbonation though (bloats your mouth), grassy again, also with some flowery / parfume like notes. My first Orval. very lovely smell, unfortunatly the taste was rather surprising / not what I expected / not as good as the smell. Rather strongly bitter on the finish, actually a bit disturbing even. On suqsequent sips also way too much carbonation. Might try an older bottle when I get the chance. Overall still quite nice though.
Ça sent les foins, avec quelque chose de sucré. Ça demeure semblable au goût, le tout tellement bien balancé.

Pours orange colour with a magnificent head. Aroma of apples, some banana and quite a lot of funk. Slightly sour in the taste with a profile corresponding to the aroma, pepper/oregano finish and delicate carbonation. Ive tried this one a couple of times before and its good news that the beer is still in good shape.
Au la Falstaff. Cloudy, reddish orange with a thin white head. Fruity aroma, slightly sour. Taste is fruity, dry finish
Pours orange with big head. Aroma is sourish, some oregano, light smoke, cinnamon, citrus, grass. Taste is grassy, some yeast, light bitterness, dandelion, lemon peel. Better with yeast. Quite good!
Dirty orange colour with a sticky white head. Quite a lot of hoppiness going on, along with subdued bread, yeast, banana... Nice, but not my favourite Belgian...
Bottle pour at home as part of the National Orval day from last week, light golden pour thin soft white head, dry citrus, banana aroma, tast has a lot of bite, tart finish, very nice beer.

330 ml bottle.

Large long lasting white head. Deep amber color. Strong aroma.
Bottle from systembolaget. Pours a hazy bronze like colour beer with a large head. Fruity, bretty and yeasty very pleasant. Dry bretty finish

Bottle 21/02/2016 Cloudy amber color, medium white head. Aroma of yeast, peach, apple, funk. Flavour of yeast, fruits, grain and dome funk. Medium bitter finish, slightly dry.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Sehr interessantes Bier. Viel Schaum, trüb, kupfer/braun. Schmeckt nach Gwürzen, Lakritze, herb/bitter.

Klasyk. Butelka 33cl, 6.2% alk. Wspaniała bujna piana i ten aromat... Lekkie nuty chmielowe w postaci ziół, cytrusów i żywic oraz masa stajni, konia, ogólnie brettów. W tłe przyjemne winogrona, aromat winno-octowy. W smaku mocne (przynajmniej dla mnie) doznanie tanin, piwo bardzo wytrawne. Bez wątpienia mamy tu do czynienia z Belgią, dodatkowo z idealnie ułożonym winnym, kwaskowato-dzikim finiszem. Lubuje się w Breattanomycesach, dlatego Orval jest dla mnie wielką przyjemnością.

Aromat chmielu (sosna, zioła, cytrus) miesza się z klasyczną stodołą (słynna końska derka), do tego klasyczna przyprawowo-ciasteczkowa belgijska baza. W smaku bardzo wytrawne, z bazową belgią, posmakiem suszonych owoców i gumy balonowej i kwaskowatym, lekko dzikim finiszem. Musujące szampańskie wysycenia i lekko winne posmaki. Wspaniałe piwo !

Pours a clear reddish orange gold with a big eggshell bubble-bath head that supports itself and lingers in a tulip glass. Aroma is dough, yeast and straw with little hints of citrus. Taste is bread pudding and very thick french toast. Vanilla, banana and spring water. Maybe even a little melon. Undertones of bread crust and some nearly imperceptible hints of darker fruit. Palate is crisp. Finish is clean and leaves very slight and pleasant bitterness behind. Outstanding.
Bottle from appellation wines. Pours hazy Amber. Nose of dandelions, tart fruits, resin. Taste is sticky and a bit sweet but mostly nice and sour. Full bodied. Complex and tasty.
a complex mixture of flowered hops and lambic style ferments. quite unique blend; very floral and bitter yet surprinsingly acid: most pleasant combination though.

Bottled on December 3, 2015. Aroma is barnyard, dust, pine, earthy hops, very rustic, slight banana, funk, sight citrus and tartness, complex and really really good. Appearance is dark amber golden, off white head, I poured it more aggressive than I thought because I got an outrageous head, and its hazy. Taste is very good, earthy hops, barnyard, dust, dry, pine bitterness, citrus, tart, slight banana, maybe apple skins, there is a ton going on here. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, crisp carbonation, dry and dusty aftertaste. Overall, Im not so familiar with the style to give it a top notch rating but...a standard has been set. This is very good.

Hazy golden colour with avesome head, high carbonation. Aroma: lots of fruits, citrous, yeast, some spices. Dry, flavour is again belgian style fruity, bitterness is quite low, but finish is very hoppy. Only disadvantage is very high carbonation.
it pours an orange hazy body with a great two finger white head.it smells sour fruits like plum,.The taste is sour with a sweet aftertaste.very complex and great at food pairing.Awesome beer

Bottle, 690th rate. Cloudy light Amber beer, YUGE white head. Aroma lemon, urinal, complete with freshener biscuit. Taste is urinal cake and ammonia. Thats nasty. Drain pour.

Tried it again. Better, but still has that chemical flavor. Cant do it.
Una de las mejores cervezas del mundo que no se puede copiar, la reina de las belgas

Nice lasting head. Hazy beer. You basically get two beers: one with the yeast and one without. Without yeast is a fresh, slightly hoppy, full bodied beer. Yeast adds breadiness. Great balance. Wonderful beer!

33cl bottle, served in an Orval glass. Pours semi opaque dark copper with huge sturdy creamy off-white head; layers easily an inch over the lip of the glass and retains substantially even as the volume goes down. Aroma is lightly sweet pale malt, hint of candi sugar, dry finish with a slight floral tart note. Taste is medium clean caramel malt, balanced sweetness, super dry finish. Dry hops show up first, light Brett tartness comes though on the back and lingers through the finish. Great beer, unique flavor while still very easy drinking. Fun to see how restrained the Brett is here vs. the big sour bombs much more common now.
This beer was my first expierence with brett. Something I will have to get used to I guess. Will maybe come back later to re rate.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2016 0,33l bottle. This version wasnt aged maybe it gets better from some cellaring. Copper/ruby colour with the longest lasting creamy off-white head that I ever seen. Beutiful. Aroma: Banana, candy sugar, yeast, fruity notes, wine. Very complex. Taste: Sour/bitter taste. Unexpected from a belgian ale. A bit similar to the lambic style but not that harsh, pleasent and well balanced. Medium/full body with soft carbonation. Long bitter finish. A Very special beer, unique.

Amber body with a white head.
Sour and fruity aroma. I know this beer is dryhopped, but I cannot smell it.
Spicy, fruity and funky flavours. Lightly sweet taste with moderate bitterness and acidity. Dry and, I guess, funky finish. I like the initial taste a lot more than the finish. Fresh, and well balanced.
Medium body with a soft mouthfeel and prickly carbonation.

This beer is difficult to rate. I know how highly regarded it is, and I inevitably ask myself: "what am I missing here"? I think it is good, just not *that* good. Maybe it is simply a case of this combination of flavours not really appealing to me. In the end, I need to stick to what I think of it.

This one is 10 months old. Dark orange/light brown, murky, huge dense and quite persistent head. Aroma is bright: mildly funky, lemon rind, apricot, fresh grass, a hint of spiciness. Also slightly earthy, but it does not get in the way of a greatly refreshing feel. Taste is juicy sweet with notes of lemon and apricot. A slight hint of tartness. Fresh grass again. Finish is strongly bitter and dry with a note of grapes. Light to medium body, average carbonation, goes down so smooth with a dry finish that makes you longing for another sip. So rich and complex and yet so smooth and refreshing. Great

0,33l bottle from BeAbout, Bratislava, Pours cloudy amber liquid, big frothy stable white head, Aroma: light to medium brett, spicy, light phenolic, citrus, lemon grass, red apples, Taste: light to medium sweet, light to medium bitter, light to medium sour, lemon grass, phenolic, brett, yeasty, Palate: medium body, soft to average carbonation, slick to creamy mouthfeel, long bitter spicy aftertaste, Overall: enjoyed, perfect beer, complex, spicy, very drinkable.

05-Mar-2016-0,33L Flasche-bottled-06-01-2015. Goldgelb-rotbraun, ziemlich trüb, gigantische weisse ewig haltende feinporige Schaumkrone. Aroma: Grasig-hopfig, getreidig, Brett ! Antrunk: Hopfenbitter, leicht malzig, Holznoten, starke Brett-Töne. In sich rund. Immer wieder klasse, egal wie alt.

Very carbonated. Nice aroma, and the brett is prominent but not too heavy. The color is a deep orange/copper, with a reddish hue. Nice mouthfeel, and suprisingly easy to drink. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

11.2 ounce bottle, label says bottled on 17/07/2014, best before 17/07/2019. Served in an Orval chalice, the beer pours a hazy orange/amber color with about an inch and a half frothy off-white head that stayed around for a really long time. Theres also a good amount of lacing. The brew smells like citrus peel, apple, white grapes, banana, peppery spice and some earthiness. Taste is similar to the aroma, but theres also some grassiness and pear noticeable. Mouthfeel/body is medium and is well carbonated. But the carbonation is soft, and doesnt hurt this brew at all. Its easy and enjoyable to drink. I have to say I like Orval more now than I did when I first tried it years ago. I really do need to buy this more often!

Bière embouteillée le 7 juillet 2015. Blonde dorée à la mousse abondante, et à la carbo bien pêchue. Nez porté sur la pomme, amertume prononcée avec une légère astringence. Léger goût de levure, pas de trace aromatique trouves-je. En létat, jai du mal à comprendre lengouement général pour cette bière. Dans le doute, je vais laisser vieillir les autres bouteilles. Déçu déçu déçu...
Fles. Mag je ons altijd voor wakker maken, prachtig bier. Uniek in zijn soort.
UPDATED: MAR 17, 2016 Es una ceveza con poco sabor. Demasiado gas para mi gusto. El aroma es interesante, pero no es significativo. Y encima en la composición lleva azúcar.

What I like about this beer the very strong and powerful hoppy side. Its not a beer centered on the yeast taste or on the malt taste, the hop is the most important part of the aromas and flavours of this beer in my opinion. Its quite bitter, not a bad bitterness, the kind that gives a good aftertaste added to it a small sweetness. The beer looks good, its foam is extra creamy and long lasting, I rarely get to have such lovely foam in a beer. Nice and long aftertaste, kind of sweet. The first time I tasted it I didnt really like it.... today is different, I just love it.

Bottle ordered at Bulldog NE. Unfortunately this place doesnt have the proper glassware. Huge negative for Bulldog NE. Pours a beautiful orange color with a healthy white head. Aroma is actually more medicinal/soapy than expected which Im guessing is a flaw in the bar not the beer. Taste just isnt as amazing as it was in Belgium in its freshest form. More sour and tart than it should be but the good Belgian qualities are somewhere in there. Born in date is Dec 2015 so Im not attributing the disappointment to the freshness. Maybe it needs to age? Some sweetness present. Warms up to create a better taste but still not quite there. This rating is true to what I tried tonight but not indicative of the beers potential.
The best trappist & one of the best belgian beers ive ever tried , unique flavor & aroma , fantastic foam!

UPDATED: APR 1, 2016 Bottle, one year old. Slightly hazy orange golden with a huge fluffy head. Aroma is funky with notes of blue cheese, wine, Belgian yeast, green apples, spices, fruity esters and earthy hops. Moderately sweet with sourish notes and flavors of fruits, spices, pepper, yeast, herbs, bitter hoppy finish, complex and balanced. Medium bodied, dry and fizzy on palate. Great.

Unique trappist beer, taste this at any age and it is wonderfull. 
When young, this will show you what Brettanomyces is. Drink it at ten years you will be blown away by the smell of bananas and sweetness.
Great, great beer.

hazy goldfen, big white head, fresh fruity yeasty, very malty smell, light/thin mouthfeel, nearly no sweetness, medium bitterness, fizzy carbonation, smells better than it tastes, but taste is very nice as well, quite bitter

Grape, citrus, banana in aroma
Very lasting foam
A little alcohol smell
Complex bitterness in finish
Citrus flavour
One blemish is a subtle rotten egg

Intricate taste in good way

Pale, a bit hazy yellow colour. Medium white head. A bit of horseblanket, blue cheese and hay in the aroma. Grassy and refreshing beginning. Caramel and flowers in the middle. Sweet but really pleasent finish. Really interesting and refreshing beer with suprisingly light body.
Unique. This is brett, the way it should be. Dry, bitter, learhery, esthery, funky, complex. One of a kind.
UPDATED: FEB 13, 2016 Pretty much bubble. Taste medium sweet, medium bitter (much hop). Aroma of orange peel. The body is little weak.
Todo un clásico belga, que no puede defraudar, una pena que se esté extinguiendo poco a poco.

Bottle to tulip. Pours clouded copper, creamy beige head. Aroma of citrus, bread, caramel, clove, banana. Taste of same with added spice and orange marmalade. Highly effervescent. Dry finish with green apple.

33cl bottle, pours a cloudy orange/brown with very persistent frothy head. Aroma of cloves and yeast and slight citrus. Taste similar to aroma, dry, bitter with slightly sour finish. A great example of a Belgian trappist ale
Der Klassiker in der 0,33l Flasche. Alles schon gesagt. Tolles Trapistenbier.
Intense very stable head, light orangey amber. Intense brettanomyces, horse, fruity extremely complex. Extremely dry finish. Unique style!

Bottle at home from Freshfields in Croydon. Pours hazy dark orange with impressive white head that dissipates quickly. Aroma of orange peel, herbs and a little fink. Tastes of coriander, orange with a hint of funk. Really nice.

Mooi oranje trappistenbier met flinke schuimkraag. Licht zuurtje, veel hop. Mooie balans, redelijk dun.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

How could such a masterpiece have such a low rating. Any official Trappist should start at 4.5 and move up. Pours cloudy with a very thick foamy head, beautiful aroma of sweet flowers, essence and love. Great beer but not at the top on the Trappist list for me.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nez : Pomme 
Bouche : Pomme, agrumes, levure, sécheresse en fin de bouche et amertume douce et longue

L: a deep orange, hazy, a big two fingers of fluffy white head. 
S: a big acidic vinious white wine note coupled with yeast, citrus, grass. Slightly funky, big and bright, orange, light spice. 
T: delicious, sour citrus, orange marmalade, bready, a little champagne grape sweetness. I get different things at different stages. A sweet umeshu note, slightly boozy, hits my nose and palate. Theres malt, Belgian yeast, brett. So complex. 
F: effervescent, bubbles dancing on the tongue, and a fluffiness that really fills the mouth. That stays, and the malt drags back down the throat, leaving you with a fluffy tongue. It finishes really dry. 
O: Classic, wonderful Belgian pale. I get a new experience each time I try it.
Trappista insolita, segnata dai luppoli, complessa e secca al massimo grado. Inconfondibile e di carattere.

33cl bottled
cloudy orange~brown color
clove aroma, hint of herb
grassy fruity taste
strongly carbonated

Embouteillée en février 2015... Je goûte lorange amère et le fût de chêne. Cest un peu terne et la présence de levures est très importante. Cest un bon produit normalement mais celle-ci semble avoir été mal conservée ;-(
Sometimes there are no words to describe a beer! What a wonderful beer! I reserve for myself the special moments. One of the best Belgian beers

Yellow golden haze, larger bubbles. Smell of sour lambic, as if was also a wheat beer, sour peat note, a slice of caramel sweetness, roses. Actually nice and complex multilayered smell. The taste is almost as good, very similar tonality but lacking some sweetness and roses and yet, this utter lambic sour bitter wheat peated beer, thats what this is. Not strong but mild-sour ale. A house style for sure.

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2016 330ml bottle, bottled 15 Feb 2015. Beautiful sunset orange pour with large dense frothy head in my Westvleteren goblet. Unmistakable brett in the aroma - horse blanket, barnyard notes, lightly sour lactic acid notes are quite apparent as well. Fantastic balance in the taste between the sweet honey maltiness, very light apple cider vinegar sourness and earthy, funky, mouth puckering dryness and bitterness. Light bodied and very drinkable. This beer has such a legendary reputation for good reason. Brilliant.
Origin: Bottle. Vessel: Stange. Supplier: The Flyer (Bristol). Unmanageable head. Slightly soapy taste.

Bottle, 330ml. A clear orange beer with a big foamy head. Aroma is of belgian yeast, orange, alcohol and maybe roses (or some similar type of flowers). Taste is bitter with a strong belgian yeast finish. Medium bodied with considerable carbonation and astringency. Aftertaste is full of characer with bittersweet finish. A world class beer.

Bottle, 33cl. Deep orange/copper with a frothy offwhite head. Sticky aromas of citrus zest, Belgian yeast, alcohol. Medium to robust bodied with moderate to fizzy carbonation. Lightly sweet with a subtle but considerable bitterness. Dry and astringent, with a refreshing fizzy character. Earthy malty and spicy body with a complex bitterseet finish. A legendary beer that lives up to its history.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2016 33 cl bottle from Belgium. Hazy dark amber color with a huge with head. Lightly tart aroma, followed by citrus, dried fruits, caramel, grass, brettanomyces, lactobacillus and further "belgian" yeast. Taste reflects the aroma, but less tart and more funky. Medium bodied. Low+ bitterness. And medium++ carbonation.
A nice Amber color. Good head with almost too much carbonation. Tastes of spice with a hint of sweetness

Bottle. Hazy orange amber with amazing lasting and lacing white head. Aroma of citrus and grapefruit with spicy notes and Brett. The flavours starts light sweet but turns light sour before a light bitter finish. Great balanced. The body is light and the texture is juicy. Average carbonation. A really enjoyable classic.

33cl bottle at home. Pours a giant white frothy head over slightly hazy gold. Nose is Belgian, slightly leathery, a little woody - subtle and very well balanced. Palate is just off dry: great balance between sweet candy sugar, malt, and bitter hops. The carbonation is a bit mad on this bottle, hence the lower mark for palate.
Great non overwhelming aroma, flavor is not overbearing and is just right. Easy drinker

33cl bottle at home. Pours a dark amber colour with a big foamy white head. Aroma of caramel, candied sugar, belgian yeast, figs, biscuit, pineapple. Taste is light sweet and medium bitter with a bitter and dry finish. Notes of pineapple, caramel, belgian yeast, cherry and banana. Texture is oily with decent carbonation.

helles trübes Bernstein, beständiger weißer Schaum. 
Das Bier ist nicht leicht zu trinken, man muss sich drauf einlassen. Ich würde sagen von den belgischen Trappisten das eigenständigste. Das Bier ist leicht säuerlich und ungemein würzig, leicht süßlich karamellig, etwas kräuterig, ziemlich trocken. Empfehlung!
deep golden hazy low white head. like champagne. aroma barnyard sour cherries cork and oak wood. taste dry sourish. too high carbonation. balanced. refreshing. too carbonated.
Soury limon v gone off taste. Pleasent but then again the stuff that can fuck u up big time
Aromas frutales, sabor a manzanas verdes , carbonartación alta. Final muy seco, una cerveza en conjunto bien compensada con muchas variables en juego.
Pours extremely heady - lots and lots of bubbles and a super foamy detergent tan head. Almost a volcano to pour. Aroma is quite unique with notes of yeast. Taste is extremely dry and

Hazy gold/brown fig color with strong white foam. Aromas of figs, caramel and sugar typical to belgian ale. Palate, full body with medium sticky texture. Some carbonation present and has medium fruity finish. Taste quite sweet and fizzy, and fruity. Overall I dont know it is nice beer and everything just not as amazing as other Belgian ales, still nice though but there are better.

Laranja escuro, opaco, espuma de abundante formação e longa persistência, a ponto de atrapalhar a degustação. Aroma transparece o álcool, fermento típico belga com acidez notável, casca de laranja, cítrica. Paladar de leve acidez e dulçor, amargor aparente e lupulado. Aftertaste mantém as notas do paladar. Um boa cerveja, mas já fui mais fã.

Karamellbrunt med nydelig høyt skum. Duft er gjærpreget med gård og krydder og frukt. Smaken følger bra, noen ørsmå kledelige sure toner. Mye, men ikke for mye kullsyre. Lang og fyldig munnfølelse. En "killer" til rakfisken.
UPDATED: MAR 10, 2016 Zesty smooth and well balanced drink. Fairly unique with the light bret edges. A testament to the variety and quality of belgium beers.
Pours amber with a large qhite head. Fruity aroma pineapple and hint of hay. Taste is boozy fruit. I find it strange tasting but pleasant.
Mørk gylden farve med en ok hvid skumkrone. Aromaen er citrus og blomster medens smagen er æble og karamel. Eftersmagen er humlet, bitter. En rigtig god øl.

Une très belle couleur, qui ne peut annoncer que du bon... Et pourtant ! Une amertume qui me sera tout à fait insupportable. Des agrumes, dorange, une céréale fondante, et ce sera tout pour moi.
Pour ceux qui apprécient lamertume, nul doute que son caractère et sa furieuse ouverture feront lunanimité !

caramel, citrus, some very (!) gentle barnyard, and some gentle acidity, sweetnes. not much else. quite gentle. 
amber, hazy, minimal head, white foam, average retention. light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour. light body, slick feel, some gentle fluffiness, lively, long smooth slightly sweet finish. overall this beer is quite drinkable, pleasant, but nothing special. Could be drier, more prominent flavour and taste notes that would still be balanced.

UPDATED: DEC 14, 2015 Bottled 22/12/2014. Prachtig bier met zoet mout en grondige smaken door een fris zurige gistrijke basis. Backlog from 2015/03/06.
At Maakuns. Droge saison + brandnetel hoppige IPA + zoet alcoholisch gebeuren van barley wine. Backlog from 2015/05/15.
Legit beer alright. White head. Fruit, sugars, sweet, maybe some pineapple? Bubblegum. Tasty shit. Glad to finally see and try it
UPDATED: DEC 7, 2015 Awesome saison like beer with a wonderful brett character. Refreshing and complex.

Una schiuma bianca-rosata sormonta con imponenza un vellutato colore rame. Il naso è sorprendente, i brettanomiceti sono in concorrenza con il citrico ed i frutti gialli. In bocca si alternano sensazioni leggermente acidule con quelle dolci di malto. Il finale è secco ed imperioso, con un retrolfatto elegantemente funky che ti porti dietro per ore. Una regina.

Totally overcarbonated. Cap was propelled about 3 or 4 meters...Bad batch? Bb 09/06/2020
Couldnt taste anything...  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Bottle to tulip - never rated...WOW.
Grape, lemon, grass, bread, yeast and a hint of pepper. Hazy amber with a a big partly frothy, partly creamy off white head with tons of lacing. It settles to a 1/2 cm creamy head. Taste is fruit, spice, and hops.
Denne Oral har et gyldent og klart udseende med et medium hvidt skum. Øllen har en lidt syrnet, men frisk citrus aroma og smager derefter med bitterhed i afrundingen. Medium karbonering.

Pours a hazy copper colour with foamy white head. Nose starts with bread and yeasty hints, then sour vinegar, then lemon. Mouth is spicy peppery with flavours of herbs and cloves. Also some banana sweetness in there. Very dry finish on the palate and a high carbonation which tingles the tongue.
Boa formação de espuma e duradoura. Bem diferente do que esperava. Tem um amargor diferente do padrão. Percebi um azedo até agradável, mas meio exagerado. Pode ser algum problema no meu exemplar.

Help! Wat is er met Orval gebeurd? De vertrouwde witte peper geur die de Orval zo herkenbaar maakte is reeds een tijdje verdwenen maar waar is de bitterheid en de zurigheid naartoe? Het bitter gevoel gaat blijkbaar verder achteruit. Zo dronk ik een 6 maand jonge Orval: Mooi fijne witte schuimkraag die vlug verdween. Troebel licht amberkleurig met weinig pareling. Bloemige geur met wat bret. De smaak was matig bitter met een vleugje zurigheid. In dezelfde omstandigheden en even net gewassen glas proefde ik een 1 jaar oude Orval: Mooi fijne witte schuimkraag die wel bleef kleven. Deze was donkerder van kleur. Alleen de bret geur bleef. Hier was natuurlijk de bitterheid nog minder maar opmerkelijk was dat de zurigheid niet in de smaak zat maar dat er hier sprake was van NA zurigheid!

Bottle bbe 28.05.20. Murky, dark yellow beer with a huge head. Intense Sour Ale like aroma, fruity citrus. Light body, hoppy dry taste with sour (Kellerbier-like) notes. Interesting and refreshing beer, surprising for a Belgian Ale.
¨robably the best of all. The small may seems strang at first but you get use to it really quick. For the tast, the best is to wait at least to be 6 months old (even best if you wait a year).

UPDATED: JAN 9, 2016 Heel anders dan andere trappistenbieren. Niet mijn favoriet. Goudbruin met veel koolzuur, een sterk fruitige geur en een wat bittere, droge smaak. Doet me denken aan de paar IPAs die ik wel eens heb gedronken. Dat is niet echt mijn soort bier.

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2016 L'Orval présente une robe très légèrement ambrée, surmontée d'une généreuse mousse blanche. Le nez est partagé entre notes sur le houblon frais mais aussi sur la levure sauvage. La bouche, qui présente une magnifique pétillance est elle aussi portée sur la brett, à savoir la levure sauvage. Le final est amer, sur une belle longueur

Cor de mel, turva. Espuma muito abundante e persistente. Aroma adocicado de especiarias e floral, levemente cítrico. Sabor amargo equilibrado, com notas florais, de especiarias, madeira, citronela e damasco. Retrogosto amargo com final seco. Complexidade e sabor.
Aroma e sabor super agradáveis, lembrando muito uma cidra, porém com um certo amargor na medida certa. Aparência dourada para marrom. Sensasional!

Nutty brown appearance with lots of foamy head. Complex tastes of bitterness from vegetables, spices, some gum, grass and wood. Medium body, somewhat aggressive carbonation, and a bitter finish. A not that great bitter trappist
UPDATED: DEC 29, 2015 Pours hazy amber/redish with an of white head. Aroma of brett and funk, apricots, floral, citrus. Taste is a bit sweet, light caramel, funk, floral. Fuck yeah!

From bottle at Martinique, Stavanger, 29.10.15. Cloudy orange. Dense and persistent off-white head and lacing. Aoma and taste of brett, fruits and pale malt. Still quite complex. Refreshing, with good drinkability.
An orange brown with a HUGE fluffy head. Aroma is lemon sherbet. Quite fizzy tbh. Not the best trapist beer Ive had but not bad.

Lustiges Fläschchen - optisch dicht, karamellbraun. In der Nase irgendwie muffig. Im Trunk setzt sich das fort, leider. Dann im Abgang leicht bitter. Anders, ja, aber irgendwie seltsam. Nach etwas anwärmen (laut Flasche 12-14 Grad) ändert sich der Charakter tatsächlich.
Die Muffigkeit verschwindet, ich schmecke einen Hauch Kirschen, etwas Cognac/Sherry. Hintenweg cremiger.
Faszinierend - bloß nicht zu kalt trinken!
Beaucoup de levures et un fond herbal. En bouche : on retrouve la levure qui donne un côté très poivré étonnant. Laspect herbal finit la bouche dans une amertume modérée.

Five proofs exist: 1) the Argument from Motion, 2) the Argument from Efficient Causes, 3) the Argument from Possibility and Necessity, 4) the Argument from Gradation of Being, 5) the Argument from Design. If Orval had existed in the 13th century, Saint Thomas Aquinas would have added it as his 6th proof for the existence of God.
It is the beer if beers: barnyard, dry hops, thirst quenching, complex, historic.

Bottle. Orange color with thick and large head. Aroma has apricot, other fruits, yeast and malt. Taste is malty with long dry a somewhat hoppy aftertaste. Flavors of malt, yeast, nuts, citrus, spices. A bit acidic mouthfeel but wellbalanced.

Botella. @El Cabanón, Avilés 21/10/2015,Bottled:18/06/2015 BBD: 18/06/20
Color marron, sabor matoso, toques agrios, final seco, carbonatacion alta. Cerveza peculiar.

26.09.15

Orval  bottled 03.06.15  (3 1/2 months old)

Appearance: Amber coloured beer, one finger, fluffy, cloud-like white head - very tightly packed. Leaves nice lacing on glass which then slowly slips away to rejoin the beer in the glass. Very nice looking beer, especially when served in the correct Orval glass (that was designed by the Abbeys Architect, no less). 
As Im coming to the end of the glass, the head is still made up of the tinniest bubbles you can imagine. Bubbles so small that you can barely see them, they are ever so tightly packed. As I swirl the last, probably 15ml of beer in the glass it remains stuck together almost like a fried egg in a frying pan - a sure sign of a quality product.

Aroma: Strong aroma of apples and pears with dry white wine and other acidic sour fruits. The smell is really nice, cant pull my nose away from the glass. Getting a hint of banana along side the apples and pears as its warming up. 

Taste: Hoppy then sour then hops coming on strong again in the finish. A very refreshing beer. This beer is still fairly cold as I poured it straight from the fridge. Its very unique taste wise and seems to be different every time I try it - which is fairly often. Always thoroughly enjoyable. Love the way the hops are fighting with the sour flavours of the brett yeast all the way from start to finish.

Mouth feel: Dry, tart and bittering (which doesnt sound pleasant but absolutely is where this beer is concerned).

Overall: An absolute all-time favourite. If I could only drink one beer for the rest of my life (heaven forbid!), then this might quite possibly be the one, purely because it never fails to surprise and is always familiar yet somehow different. 10/10, no questions asked!
_____________________________________  bottled 06.08.14  (14 Months Old)

Appearance: I was really surprised by how much the appearance has changed over the 3.5 month old Orval. It has lost a lot of its bright amber colour and is now much paler. Head is not is not fluffy as it was in the younger brew and, although it is covering the surface of the beer completely, the beer can seen through the head when looking from above.

Aroma: The aroma has become stronger, punchier and more acidic. The apple and pears are still present.

Taste: The hop flavour has dropped off a lot but is still dectectable in the finish. The sourness from the brett is now dominating from the start.

Mouth feel: Dry and slightly tart, as with the younger brew.

Overall: While I am thoroughly enjoying this beer, I have to say I preferred the younger brew but Im not sure if thats due to me being extremely tired while reviewing this slightly older Orval. It seems that while Im not a huge fan of hop forward beers, the hops in the fresher Orval complement the unusual yeast strain, as both fight to dominate the palate.

330 ml bottle. Bought in La mise en biere in Lausanne. Nice smell, and different, smell like wood, pepper and earth. Very good looking, amber and large white head. Taste just like it smell, there something like meat in it, but is not meat, is close, i dont know how to describe it. Its very heavy taste, may not be for everyone, but i liked it. Very good beer, but not the best trappist out there.
Лучше Орвала придума& всего лишь немного вариант& но если не знаешь, что выпить - выпей Орвал.
beautiful looking and smelling beer really big. head clouded orange/amber nice hops in aroma flavor full bodied some sweetness caramel but also some sour nicely balanced quite a beer
Bottle at home orange yeasty aroma flavour is yeast bubblegum some fruity notes finish is dry hoppy yeas

Earthy aroma, with a hint of barnyard funk. Pours amber with a giant head, at the present, I cant check the clarity because of all of the visible carbonation on the glass. Very complex flavor with a touch of floral and fruit notes, fades over to an earthy note with just a touch of barnyard in the finish. As the head fades down, it leaves lacing on the glass with the head forming a craggy appearance. This finishes very dry with a light palate. This is a fantastic beer. If you havent had it before, you should definitely try it, and dont be concerned about some dust on the bottle.

Cerveja boa, mas não chega a ser sensacional. Não achei tão boa como falam. Tomei em Bruxelas

Very well balanced beer. Has a beautiful and longlasting head. Great golden/amber color. Probably one of my favourite.

Pours a hazy dirty amber. Aroma of sour apples, dirt, candi sugar. Flavor rather bitter and dry, earthy, almost leathery, with some banana-y fruitiness lingering toward the back, more candi sugar. Amazingly different beer, good.

Bowling pin to Orval chalice. Cloudy light yellow-brown. Mountainous peaks and valleys within 2 minutes. They?re still there on the last sip. Biting carbonation. So dry. I want another sip immediately. Definite bright citrus character. Tartness present but relatively subtle after only 9 months in the bottle.

Cloudy amber, gorgeous sexy coating with extra strong legs...stinks like rotten apples! (not finding it pleasing)

Rich flavors of dark fruits and burnt bitter hops with slightly sweet apples and lemon. Powerful coarse and dry after taste. Very strong vinous feel and a dry coarse mouth coat.

Overall : Looks can sometime be deceiving... Perfectly drinkable for trying a different taste, but way too spicy for me, or was my bottle too fresh? I will try this beer again after at least 2 years in the cellar, until then I dont see why this beer is so popular.
From a bottle at a fancy restaurant. Great complex flavor. Earthy but sweet and slightly tart. Outstanding balance. Unique in a crowded segment. One of my favorites. Want to try again.

Bottled 28/08/2014. Amber colour with a long lasting white big head. Fruity hoppy aroma; a bit sour also, yeast. Taste is lightly sweet with a quite an intense bitterness. Rather complex beer with a hoppy and somewhat dry character in the beginning with a finish that is best described as a mix of maltiness, burn sugar and belgian yeast , Full body and lively carbonation.
Ive never rated orval, thats weird. Tastes like orval. Its great, if youre reading reviews to consider buying orval, youre in trouble.

Lichtbruin troebel bier met veel schuim wat mooi blijft staan. Daarmee is ook alles gezegd. Smaak is iets zuur en apart, citroen en muffig. Ik blijf dit een bijzonder bier vinden wat niet bij me past.

Bottle from Cornelius (bottled on 24/03/2015). Hazy copper, big fluffy off-white head that gently collapses down to crags. Yeast, dry grass, dried stoned fruit (cherry, prune?). Medium body, initially quite sprightly fizz that fades a little. Some booze, malts, farmhouse hops and light bitter finish. Caramel sweetness and slightly oily. I can see why people get excited.
Amber color,spicy herbal aroma with a few fruity notes,fresh palate,nice white head,my favorite Trappist.

Not quite sure why this gets such a high rating. Its good but it aint that good. Rich hazy amber almost orange in colour. Much more bitter than the average Belgian ale with a hoppy spiciness that disguises its strength - in fact 6.2% is rather humdrum in its native land but thats hardly a criticism. I like it but Atletico Bilbao rather than Barcelona for me.

Pours a dense hazy copper brown with white frothy/rocky head. The head never really settles. The nose is very classic and at the same time truely unique. Yeasty, barn qualities, fermenting hay and mineral, brown plum. The taste is refreshing with mineral, yeasty fruit. Unripe hops delivers bitterness and ballance. A slight sour note is detectable in older expressions and this can bring further complexity. The aftertaste is slightly malty, slightly yeasty, farmy and finishes in a refreshingly bitter way. Im glad I live in world where there is Orval. Please dont change.

bottle from beergeek during the wow meet. got it to share with matt and eric but ended up drinking it myself after they left. pours cloudy brown orange with a creamy head. aroma of banana, raisin, musty yeast. taste was surprising tbh. much more sour and hoppy than expected. theres still some fruit and malts in there but i wasnt loving it as much

Mocno zbita, drobna piana. W aromacie czuć intensywną dzikość, końska dera, te klimaty. Leciutko czuć owocowe, chmielowo-estrowe akcenty. W smaku wytrawne, ściągające, sugerujące kwas, który jednak nigdy nie nadchodzi. Nasycenie wysokie. Dziki aftertaste, który nie każdemu przypadnie do gustu. Definicja słowa "funky".

330 ml bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 4/15/2013. Pours slightly hazy orange/amber color with a 2-3 finger foamy and fluffy off white head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Nice dense soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a large amount of streaming carbonation retaining the head. Aromas of big lemon, pineapple, cherry, pear, apple, white grape, hay, straw, pepper, grass, toasted biscuit, musty funk, light leather, and herbal/yeast earthiness. Fantastic aromas with great complexity and balance of fruity/funky/spicy yeast, earthy hops, and moderate bready malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big lemon, pineapple, cherry, pear, apple, white grape, hay, straw, pepper, grass, toasted biscuit, musty funk, light leather, and herbal/yeast earthiness. Good amount of yeast spiciness and earthy hop bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of lemon, pineapple, cherry, pear, apple, white grape, hay, straw, pepper, toasted biscuit, and herbal/yeast earthiness on the finish for a short bit. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/funky/spicy yeast, earthy hops, and moderate bready malt flavors; with a great malt/spiciness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Moderate dryness after the finish from the carbonation. High carbonation and medium bodied; with a very smooth, crisp, fairly creamy/bready, and lightly prickly mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an absolutely incredible Belgian Trappist ale. All around fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/funky/spicy yeast, earthy hops, and moderate bready malt flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink for the ABV. A highly amazing offering all around. I feel this is at its best right around the 3 year mark, and this one was getting near to that age.
Sweet hay and herbal aroma; dark amber (orange) colour, long-life big off-white porous head; medium to full body; medium carbonation; sweet malty and sour taste; dry palate.

11.2 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Poured amber, with some slight haziness, nice generous off white head and some lacing. Aroma of dark fruit, yeast and spices. Taste has some tartness, dark fruit, and yeast. Very complex, very interesting and certainly very enjoyable.

At Yuma Bar in Orval glass. Persistent head, light colour, difficult to specify in a bar with red light. Spicy, herbal, some citrus notes. Completely dry, crisp, refreshing, very fine carbonation. I usually have a problem with Trappist beers, theyre too heavy for me. This one is great!

En bouche : on retrouve la levure qui donne un côté très poivré étonnant. Laspect herbal finit la bouche dans une amertume modérée.
Étonnante et assez unique.
Bottle from Willows Market in Menlo Park, CA. Aroma is spiced fruit / esters. Taste is mild malt with super hoppy / spiced herbal finish (which was the most memorable / distinct feature).
Bottle. Some grass in the aroma, but mostly tasty malts. Heavily carbonized, but matched with a strong malt backbone, also no killing the hops bitterness. Very fresh palate. What a good beer!
I love trappist beers and this one is no exception. It wanted to run away from the bottle, well I drink it quite warm. Spices, barnyard, white and red fruits, cherries, wonderful and complex brew.
Awesome beer!Amber in color, malty and slightly bitter but easy to drink. Slight herby flavour. Slightly too gassy though.

Ciemnozłote, mętne piwo o obfitej pianie, która zdobi szkło i pozostaje do końca w postaci warstewki na powierzchni. Aromat intensywny typowo belgijski, owocowy. W smaku podobnie belgijska owowcowość, lekka słodycz i kwaskowość. Goryczka średnia, szlachetna, niezalegająca, przyjemna. Ogólnie po prostu klasyka jasnego belgijskiego piwa, bardzo owocowe w belgijskim stylu, warte spróbowania.

Ill have to revisit this. I might have had a bad one. I typically love this style, but tried this deep into a tasting night, so my palette may have been tainted.

Pours dark amber with huge big-bubbled head which quickly fades. Aroma is some candy and funk. Flavor has some agreeable malt character, but also a sour skunkiness. I really wanted to just dump this down the drain. Dry and tart finish did not have me craving more.
An excellent beer! there is nothing that I would add or subtract... The only issue is that its not always easy to find

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2016 Beautiful gold with nice white head. Spicy smell and taste, extreme dry.
clear bitter. Only 6,2%, but feels like more
extraordinary beer in a nice bottle

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2016 Bottle, 33cl.
Sweet hay aroma, grapes, very herbal and complex, with a few fruity notes, very balanced and fresh. Fabulous dense white head that stays in place for the whole time, on top of a cloudy dark amber liquid. As for the flavours, right away a somewhat bitter woody taste: oak and leather, very herbal and developing in mouth to grapefruit. The taste is very dry on palate, which, together with the woody flavours, gives it an almost whisky-like character. Creamy-slick texture and medium carbonation with a clean, bitter finish. Medium to full, if not full, body. A marvellous beer to enjoy slowly due to the greatness -in every sense-  of the flavours and aromas.
What can I say, it is a beer unlike virtually any other one. A very particular trappist that leaves nobody indifferent.
Dark orange with a huge white head. Barnyard, leather, floral, malt sweetness. Sweet, little bitterness. Creamy with a light to medium body, lively carbonation.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2016 Golden with a big soapy white head. Fruity citrus aroma. Sour. Quite unique, but not really my thing. Of the three bottles i have had (New bottles stored correctly,) two were bad. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
330ml bottle at Billys Bier Kafe. Nice and hoppy, well balanced with a dry finish.

Gorgeous rose amber colour with a lively white frothy head. Aroma of smokey orange malt with . Well balanced flavours of sour bitterness and dry roasted nuts. The more recent bottles , as I have been drinking it for 20 years, seem to have more sweet malt and less sourness or it could be my age.

Bärnsten med ett rejält vitt skum. Jäst i doft. Tunn smak tyvärr är detta inte min grej.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Spora, gruba i nietrwała piana, o dziwo zdobi szkło, barwa ciemno bursztynowa, lekko mętna, piwo ładnie pracuje w szkle. Zapach przede wszystkim dziki, nieco kwaskowy, stajenny, nasuwający skojarzenie z końską skórzaną używaną uprzężą a z drugiej strony estry owocowe (czerwona porzeczka i morele) i lekkie fenole (czerwony pieprz, może ta szałwia właśnie). W smaku wytrawnie, nie jest tak dziko i kwaśno jak w aromacie, bardziej przypomina wino domowe z głogu, z rodzynek, z winogron, sfermentowane owoce, suszone owoce... Po kilku łykach w posmaku pojawia się cukier kandyzowany, słodkie owoce. Goryczka wyraźna, niespotykana na takim poziomie w innych piwach trapistów, bardzo przyjemna, ziołowa, nieco piołunowa. Nagazowanie powyżej średniego, odczucie w ustach półpełne, gładkie, niewyklejające. 
Nietypowe piwo trapistów - dość agresywne w odbiorze, wyraźnie odczuwalna dzikość, solidna goryczka, subtelnie wiążące to wszystko kandyzowane owoce, rodzynki i suszone gruszki... Mimo to trunek jest zaskakująco pijalny, ułożony i smaczny.
Pours hazy orange with persistent big white head. Funky aroma, earthy, light herbal. Taste is light sour and sweet, with a dry palate. Easy drinking. Unique belgian ale.

Poured from a bottle. Slightly obscured golden color, medium frothy white head. Funky yeast and sweet fruit aroma. Medium body with a clean light funky fruit flavor and a nice finish.

Cherries, orange, tart jellied fruits, pine and even lavender in the nose. Taste is super dry and well balanced and certainly pleasantly delicate for a beer of its strength. Smooth on the palate too. Ticks a lot of boxes.

Birra estremamente attraente all?analisi visiva, di un bellissimo ambrato con un compatto e fine cappello di schiuma bianco sporco.All?olfatto offre una grandissima complessità che spazia dagli aromi primari (crosta di pane e miele), agli esteri della frutta a pasta gialla, floreali e speziati.In bocca, l?entrata restituisce tutto ciò che l?olfatto ci aveva promesso mentre in uscita regala una secchezza e lieve nota acidula che invita subito ad una nuova e ricca sorsata.Grande birra!
The best beer (my favorite), really tasty, not too heavy and not too light. Its color is beautiful and so the froth.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2016 
Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, wheat, Belgian yeast, fruit, banana, apple, hops, citrus, grapefruit and brettamonyces.

Appearance:

Turbid orange/brown beer with a medium/large off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Medium sweet and slightly bitter with malts, wheat, Belgian yeast, fruit, orange, apple, banana, hops, citrus, grapefruit and brettamonyces.

Overall:

A Belgian ale which has it all. One bottle could be a weizen, the other one a pale ale and the last one a geuze-light. This beer is truly amazing and unique, one of the only beers where I could understand a perfect rating.
This beer combines what I like best about belgian trappist and english IPA. The result is an extremly well-tasting beer. One of my top-5 in the world!
Wow, i get the fuzz about this one! Wide palet of flavours, from sweet to sour, from fruit to flowers. Simply love it!
Golden color and a bit cloudy, very specific bitter and fruity taste, with wide palate.
Surdeg, karbolsprit. Geuze liknande. Rikligt skum ovh mycket jäst. Det behövs mat till.

Somewhere between bright amber and deep golden in colour. Pours with thick light-beige head which hangs momentarily before it begins to dissipate. Great nose, floral and herbs, sharp citrus and to a lesser extent honey and some yeast. The hops jump to the forefront but are balanced with the taste of orange, green apple, brett and spice with pepper and banana on the end. Finishes clean and dry with a subtle hop bitterness left behind. Active carbonation cleanses the palate and leave a great fuzzy feeling. Overall a very enjoyable, complex and unique Belgian Ale.

Shared bottle. Pours is light amber hazy with medium persistent white head. Aroma of lemon, leather, floral. Taste is light sour, light bitter with some acidic notes, nearly funky Id say. Medium body, dry, sticky texture.

$3.99/11.2 fl.oz/6.2 pabv. Brasserie DOrval, Villers dOrval, Belgium. Age dated beyond use 4 years: bottled 7/17/2014 vintage; beyond use 7/17/2018. Short but cream-colored head, cream-umami crisp floral notes over fragrant mineral scented head; over green yeast-stained bottle conditioned body color in red Burgundy Spiegelau glass. 

Medium bodied and medium carbonation; this seems to me to be umami-tinted and not bretted.  Hops are of the deeply bittered but sweetly fragrant variety, with a bite of malt over crisp, butter hip hops. With a sweet smoked ham and dijon moutard with a ancient vines type sandwich bread cover to accompany it. Nice choice for a food match. High-tannin phenolic hops demand food, not at all like Leffe in style but nearly as highly rated.  The dry dry dry style pivots on sandwich bread to become bitter-sweet.  Drink now-2018 or beyond.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2017 Very dry sometimes sour. No sweetness. Some lemon tart I guess from the yeast. Very different than what I expected. Unlike pretty much anything else. Very refreshing and thirst quenching. Some pepper it almost reminds me of a saison. Bitter floral hops at the end. Not something I?d drink on the regs but defo a must try!

Yes, it is possible that this is a Trappist and that they often are highly valued among beer connoisseurs. Initially, it is also mentioned that the Orval are so special that you either love or hate it. I hate it!
It has lots of hops and in that respect I will admit that it has a nice bitterness in the end. Unfortunately overshadows the far too dominant acidity (brett), overall impression and it falls far from my taste.
