Very cloudy amber with huge off-white head that reduces steadily but leaves persistent skim.
Aroma of a sour, with green apple, stone fruit and funk. If chilled, let it warm closer to room temperature to open up. Even so, the upfront taste of this nine-month old bottling is must and heavy aromatics tending toward camphor, as though it were poured from a not particularly well-sealed cedar chest.
Some pear notes find there way through, and plentiful carbonation provides a satisfying mouth feel and attractively dry finish. But even with aeration, this lacks the complex flavor profile of many other Trappist ales. Im going to try again with a bottle aged longer, because this one was disappointing.

Amberish color with huge head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is of yeast and bread and floral with bit of toasty taste to it. Mouthfeel is quite effervescent. Tastes like the Trappist ale youd expect with dark fruits, dryness, and bready goodness

From a bottle at Franklin's Bar at the Delano in Las Vegas. Pours a dark copper and makes a Belgian thick head with a lot of lacing. Aroma is of yeast and bread and plums. Mouthfeel is quite effervescent. Tastes like the Trappist ale you'd expect with dark fruits, dryness, and bready goodness. You want to savor Orval slowly and don't drink it too cold, the flavored will come alive as it warms up. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Vintage 2012 bottle. Beautiful clear ambee hue with a long lasting film of head. Nose is packed with brett, sweet malts, raisins, lots of figs, yeasts, grassy hops. Flavour is raisins, brett, spices, grassy, bitter hops. Big carbonation and dry finish. Full bodied with a chewy texture.

330ml bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy dark copper, large foamy white head. Sour aroma, green apples, herbs, bread. Fizzy mouthfeel. Fruity and spicy taste, apricot, pear, green apple, orange peel, herbs and malt. The finish is tart.
Bottle 0.33l. Its a good beer. Shady red color with a good taste. Best to drink from a cup and not more than one bottle.

Hazy gold pur with white top. Spicy cinamon aroma. Spiced taste with a hint of the banyard. Not your typical trapist as it is more bitter than sweet but fairly balanced. Highly recomended even for tge ones who dont usualy go for Belgian style beers.

Bottle, fresh brew. Dark and hazy orange color, small white head. Aroma of barnyard, horse blanket, herbs, hint of sweet fruits and rectified spirit. Taste is dry, funky, tart. Small herbal bitterness. Aftertaste is dry and tart with some citrus note. Medium body and carbonation. Classic but beter when older.
Aroma a limon y flores. Buen cuerpo. Carbonatacion agradable. Sabor con toques de limon y herbales, en un conjunto complejo con un final fuertemente seco, amargo y duradero. Algo lambic?

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2016 An unclear orange beer with a fantastic head. The aroma is sweet with notes of fruit, orange, and other spices. The flavor is sweet with notes of orange, fruit, yeast, cinnamon, and other spices. It ends on a nice bitterness combined with an acidic note. A great beer - but not the best of the trappists.

Illata kissé csíp?s, nagyon komplex, inkább f?szeres mint gyümölcsös. Illatában ugyan ez jelenik meg csak fordítva, itt a gyümölcsösség kerül el?térbe a f?szerességgel szemben. Opálos narancssárga\barna szín sok sok fehér gusztusos habbal

UPDATED: NOV 3, 2015 Trappist mixed fermented. Amber colour with thick beautiful foam. Astringent and fine carbonation. BRET is defining the taste - green apples, grape, flowers, medical closet, soap  sour and with fine notes of vanilla, peach and orange. Medium bitterness.
Schiuma molto densa e persistente, tipico ed accentuato gusto amaro che la caratterizza rispetto alle altre trappiste
Thuis, heerlijk ontspannen een trappist gedronken. Goudbruin van kleur. Zeer hoppig. Sprankelend in de mond waarvan de fruitige smaak nog even blijft hangen. Lekker voor een zomerse dag.

Pours a hazy copper colour with foamy white head. Nose starts with bread and yeasty hints, then sour vinegar, then lemon. 

Mouth is spicy peppery with flavours of herbs and cloves. Also some banana sweetness in there. Very dry finish on the palate and a high carbonation which tingles the tongue.

Really a complex and unique beer, not similar to other Trappist ales and a definite favourite.

330ml bottle pours slightly hazy orangey amber. Nose is yeast, wine, bit of vinegar and candied fruits. Taste is very light, some sharp bread dough and mild fruity notes. High carbonation, light to medium body with a very drying finish. Really good bitter and lasting, bready finish. Interesting.

Aroma of fruits, spices, hops.
Taste is practically the same.
Good beer but little bit overcarbonated as for my taste

Bonito color miel, turbia. Aroma a limon y flores. Buen cuerpo. Carbonatacion agradable. Sabor con toques de limon y herbales, en un conjunto complejo con un final fuertemente seco, amargo y duradero.
Oval uit de fles. Flinke schuim kraag . Troebel. Zoet met een lichte bitter. Zelf een rokerige toon. Interessant biertje
Color is a lovely orange red,not haty,but not penetrated by light either.Aroma is almost like a wine full scent of alcohol an fermentation.

Hard to describe, as the taste of this beer changes pretty dramatic as it ages in the bottle. Can be quite sour, dry and bitter and unlike other beers I know. Good with sour bread with Belgian cheese. One of my favorites.
Bottle shared with my mom. Pours Hazy orange/golden with a dense white head. Aroma of brett, fruits, hops, Taste is bitter, yeast, fruit, hops. Lingerin dry aftertaste very pleasnt! This is the shit!

Aroma: roasted dark malts, phenols, farmhouse.
Appearance: slightly hazy copper color, nice creamy head.
Taste: low bitterness, belgian phenols, farmhouse caramel, roasted malts, dried fruits, semi-dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation.
Overall: Great beer, complex, harmonic, perfect.
Bottle. 2014 edition. I love this beer. So tasty so great nice and lovely. Love thism.....

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2015 Karaktervol, super onderscheidend. Nog geen bier geproefd met zoveel diepte in de smaak. Wat romig maar een prikkelende smaak op de tong. Bittere nasmaak. Ideaal voor een herfstdag.

Colar muito encorpado e de boa duração. Aroma marcante, levemente adocicado, lembrando um pouco de especiarias. Bom corpo, mas cerveja muito suave na boca. Pouco amargor. Algum amargor no retrogosto. Aparência com alguma turbides. Excelente cerveja. Suave e saborosa.

Gutes Bier

Zitrus,Banane sind präsent
-Kaugummi,honig und leichter malzcharakter
-gut carbonisiert
zu leicht und wässrig im abgang mit starker hopfennote.
Kann nicht ganz mit den Top Trappistenbieren mithalten aber auf jeden Fall nen Versuch wert.
Bottle from Saveur Bière. Lively bubbly white head. Golden, muddy body. Smells of yeast, apricot, apple. Tastes dry, pear, gooseberry, grapefruit, sweet and sour with a bitter aftertaste.

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2017 Bottle, bb 15.10.2019, tasted 1.6.2015. Pours amber with large, white head. Distinct wild aromas, some barnyard or cellar notes typical for Brettanomyces, some fruity notes and hints of sourness. Moderately bitter, with fruity notes. Medium bodied, lively carbonation. Intense, complex aroma and taste. 

Note: the same batch tasted 2 years later (14.06.2017): less aromatic, with distinct notes of oxidation (honey), still with barnyard notes.

Pours a dark hazy orange with a frothy white head. Complex nose is spicy with barnyard and fruity brett aromas. Some bubblegum too. Taste is bitter with fruity notes. Dry finish. Sweaty brett notes are also there. High carbonation. Great complex Belgian beer with a nice wild yeast touch!

Bottle at bar. Lively pour. Honey amber with full white head. Aromas of floral, Belgian yeast, sour dough bread, toffee. Fresh sweet mint. Tastes sweet caramel, light syrup, fresh and bubbly. Clean palate, good beer

Pours caramel amber medium foam. Aroma is floral with a delicate sour edge, grassy floral. Taste is peaches, fruity and a wild yeast delicate tarty taste builds up dissipating into a slight bitter and riped dried banana after taste.

Hard one to describe almost a sour ale but quite complex some fruit bread something medicinal its all going on with this one, decent but just that 
Little to spour for my liking.

Theres something new about this beer every time.
Complex but rewarding definitely.

A huge white frothy head mostly diminishing, good lacing. Hazy medium amber body. Medium malty aroma with nutty tone. Grassy, herbal, citric hops, heavy cheese and earthy yeast aromas. Notes of pear, wood and banana. Medium sweet initial feel, hoppy and dry finish. Long and rather acidic finish. Medium, oily texture with lively carbonation. Very complex and rather excellent.

Bottle. Big off-white head exceptionally long lasting (rocky). Hazy amber (1cm beer left in the bottle). Citric and slightly sour aroma, also spicy. Taste is acid, citrus, slightly spicy with sour (brettomices) hints. Sour finish and aftertaste. A sour ale.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 26B/28A, adapted). Bottle 33 cl - Batch unknown. AROMA: brettanomicyes notes of barn, stable and a faint sweet malty background. APPEARANCE: dark orange color and hazy. large ivory head weth average retention. TASTE: initial brett notes that evolve into a somewhat sweet malt character. medium-high bitterness with a semi-sweet and bitter finish. PALATE: medium-low body with high carbonation. OVERALL: a trappist ale with a special yeast blend giving it a unique aroma and flavour.

From the bottle at The Pub in Las Vegas. Pours a rich amber color with large foamy head and non stop bubbling. The smell is ripe apricots, metallic and dried fruit. The taste is like surprisingly smooth, easy, yet complex. Unique. Bread, honey, sour.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours golden, maybe a touch darker with an solid head that produces a fair amount of lacing. There are aromas of citrus, a bit of floral, and a bit of yeast. It is very dry on the palate first and foremost. There are floral tastes with a bit of citrus, and yeast. It has considerable carbonation. It is even a slight bit s

Bottiglia. Ambrata, con abbondante schiuma poco persistente, che lascia "traccia" sul bicchiere. Aroma tra il floreale e note erbacee, come rabarbaro. Amara, ma ben bilanciata. Secca, carbonatazione vivace. Una birra molto valida, magari non subito apprezzabile, ma con la giusta pazienza saprà sorprendere.
UPDATED: JUN 8, 2015 Bottiglia. Ottima birra che sprigiona tutte le caratteristiche se lasciata riposare per qualche minuto a temperatura ambiente.

Top quality beer, but very different from other trappist. This has a vaguely cidery, slightly sour taste with pleasant bitterness. Great aroma, good palate, great finish. Mine had enough yeast in the bottle to begin a brewery. Beautiful bottle with a minimalistic label, very nice.
De hoppigste trappist, lekker, licht bitter, fris. Heel anders van smaak dan de reguliere trappist.

UPDATED: JUL 12, 2016 Bottiglia invecchiata 15 mesi.
Ambrata carica e velata dai lieviti in sospensione, bellissima schiuma bianca che svanisce abbastanza velocemente ma si attacca letteralmente al bordo del bicchiere.
Molto carbonata, corpo medio-leggero.
Al naso forti note floreali, stallatico (Brettanomyces), note terrose, zucchero candito, e lievi note fruttate che ricordano luva bianca.
Al palato nota amaricante erbacea contrastata da un dolce dato dallo zucchero candito; man mano che la birra si riscalda viene fuori una piacevole nota alcolica.
Retrogusto complesso e molto lungo di amaro erbaceo, frumento, uva bianca, lieve nota zuccherina.
Rispetto ad una stessa birra più giovane risulta un po più gentile, perde un po di amaro erbaceo e di crosta di pane così da non risultare quasi "salata".

Poured from 330 ML bottle into a tulip glass.
Aroma- Great aroma of fruit and hops.
Appearance- Has a great amber orange color with an enormous white head.
Taste- Fantastic flavor of fruit and hop.
Palate- A medium bodied beer with heavy carbonation.
Overall- An excellent beer. This should be on everyones want list.

WYGLĄD: Barwa ciemno bursztynowa, zmętnione. Piana drobno i średnio pęcherzykowa, wysoka, trwała.
AROMAT: Dość intensywny. Świeży. Na pierwszym planie belgijskie drożdże, a nawet trochę dzikie, przypominające lambic. Z owoców czuć suszoną morelę oraz odrobinę cytrusów.
SMAK: Podobnie ja w zapachu z tą różnicą, że tutaj mamy do czynienia z gorzkimi cytrusami. Goryczka średnia, zalegająca.
OGÓLNIE: Bardzo dobre piwo o sporym potencjale, ja piłem je stosunkowo "młode" (6 miesięcy od zabutelkowania).
Birra dal forte carattere, da il meglio di se bevuta a temperatura ambiente.difficile da apprezzare subito. Veramente unottima birra

Foam: medium white foamy head, slowly diminishing, 
Colour: golden hazy orange yellow, slightly amber in colour, 
Aroma: light sweet malt and dark fruits, aroma of brad, grass, spices, funk, sweet yeast, floral, grassy, leather, earth
Taste: is slightly sour very good balanced with malty base, earthy, grass, some banana, a little hoppy, a little yeasty and a little dusty, good smooth bitterness finish and carbonation, included a nice dry finish with a bitterness in aftertaste that lingers, little acidity, a little oily, very nice beer, better not served to cold
Bottle from Craftissimo in Hong Kong. Pours hazy golden amber with a white head. Aroma of Belgian yeast, hops, spice. Dry bitter finish. First time drinking this in ages and its still great.
SB Malmö hansakompaniet, flaska. Surdeg, karbolsprit. Geuze liknande. Rikligt skum ovh mycket jäst. Det behövs mat till. Kuriositet.
alcohol, bread, barnyard, roasty aroma. amber, hazy, frothy, appearance. lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, fizzy, bitter, finish.

Bottle from McTapps, thanks Sabine. Looking forward to this so my score may reflect some disappointment. Murky amber, large white froth. Some pepper, well carbonated, hop zing. Decent but not even worthy of polishing the boots of Rochefort beers.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2015 Compra: www.elcervecero.com
Opinion: Sabe un poco como a rancio. Desde luego es la trapense que menos me gusta, de lejos...
33cl bottle. Pours amber color with big off white head. Beautiful strong fruity aroma. Very complex taste with light bitterness. Very enjoyable beer.
Butelka 0,33l wypite w Orval na rowerze.Bursztynowe z dużą pianą, trzymającą się dzielnie. Aromat słodowo-chmielowy z cytrusami. Smak wytrawny cytrusowy z żywicą, metaliczne.Bardzo dobre piwo.
Pours hazy orange with a large white foamy head. Aroma of spice & floral. Taste is slightly sour, earthy, orange, vanilla. Creamy texture. Smooth bitterness finish. Good carbonation.

UPDATED: APR 4, 2017 Bottle. Pours clear and amber in colour, with fantastic cloud-like and very thick head that stays for long during drinking. In aroma malt, bread, bretts and some hoppiness, floral hints on the back. In taste sour but the beer is very balanced with malty base. The beer is dry, quite bitter for belgian beer. carbonation is very fizzy. Must have if you are discovering world of Belgian beers.
Slightly spoiled aroma. Very dense foam. Also surprisingly dry taste with bitter aftertaste. Also boozy. Smooth. Complex beer.
Bottle poured into a tulip glass..golden pour with fluffy white head..aroma of brad,grass,spices,funk..tastes just like it smells..dry,lingering finish..just ok.

Birra di ottima qualità e piuttosto sorprendente per via del suo gusto veramente molto secco e della sua frizzantezza prorompente. Inizialmente, poco dopo stappata, si avverte un grosso aroma vegetale e speziato che dopo qualche minuto e a temperatura più alta lascia spazio a note di miele e caramello. Il gusto è armonicissimo e riflette tutte le sensazioni olfattive con un equilibrio notevole tra dolce e amaro. Lho trovata validissima nellabbinamento con dolci e credo possa essere ottima con il sushi.

Aroma is immediately a slight funkiness and sour grapes tone. Light sweet malt and dark fruits. Taste is light sweet malts accompanied again by sour grapes, maltiness, slight earthiness and yeastiness. Appearance is a cloudy orange with a thin pearl head that retains fairly well.
0.33 l bottle @ restaurant in Brussels. Nice hoppy taste. Refreshing and goes well with food. I ate rabbit prepared in gueuze.

Pours slightly hazy light golden with a white head. Turns into a fair amount of lacing with litlle creamy clots of foam. Very nice floral aroma with citrus, yeast and pine. First impression is the sourness of this Trappist, too sour for my taste, but then it unfolds, mirroring the aroma with citrus, yeast and pine backed up by a very dry, malty taste. Bitterness of the hops appears in the quite short aftertaste. Atypical Trappist - perhaps the "summer Trappist" in its sour lightness. Not my favourite Trappist, but still a good and complex beer.
Aun no siendo un estilo que me apasione tengo probadas unas cuantas. Sabor a lupulo y levadura, con el olor tipico de las trapenses. Espuma media, buen cuerpo.

UPDATED: JUL 20, 2015 Hazy copper/golden wih a thick fluffy, off-white vanishing head. Floral, caramel, citrus, hops, earthy, cellar notes. Sour, dry, bitter, lightly sweet, hoppy, dry and bitter lingering finish. Highly carbonated, medium bodied,  slick and fizzy, astringent. A total beer experience.

So much going on with this beer. Pours an orange/copper colour. The nose is huge, sweet yeast, floral, grassy. Taste has some banana, floral, subtle funk, grass. Im not a huge fan of Belgian beers, but this is a cracker

Toujours aussi originale et sans concession, cette trappiste exigeante, bien quassez peu alcoolisée pour ça gamme, moffre une expérience différente à chaque fois bien que son amertume particulière soit toujours fidèle au rendez vous. On pourrait pas laccompagner toute la nuit mais on ne sennuie jamais en sa compagnie.

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2016 Bottled on 25.5. 14: Golden reddish opaque colour with mousse-like white fim head. Medium visual carbonation. 
Aroma without notice of an alcohol. Dominate note od grape muscat and some spice, which I can not identify.
Taste is similar without notice of an alcohol, but with note of grape muscat, oranges, lemon, grapefruit.
Malt sweetness is low-medium, hop bitterness surprisinly high. 
Finish is bitter - dry, with long lasting bitterness. Body is soft.
Very good beer. 6-5-8-5-17=4.1
Bottled on 26.6.16: 
Pours golden color, clear, with long lasting white head. Older versions were dry-hopped with noble hops, like styrian golding, now they use american tomahawk, which have dual purpose, for aroma and bittering. That is also evident in new modern - new age version. rate: 6-5-8-5-17=4.1
I drunk 2 years old version, which had some intense acid tart notes but the rate is the same. Some bottles are in cellar for aginig.












1
bottle. Pours golden with a massive foamy cream-colored head. Aroma is predominantly yeasty with banana-like Belgian character. Light bodied with some spiciness and banana. Quite good.

Dune belle couleur caramel, une mousse beige, un goût houblonnée, de levure, du fruité, il y a une subtilité peu courante aux bières belges, cest remarquable. Bouteille de janv 2015, 33 Cl Académie de la Bière
Aroma of yeast and hops with a lot of carbonation and a qite bitter alcoholic warm finish. Nose is sweet and a bit sour. One of the Best trappist beers so far.
Lekker bier erg bitter speciale smaak ik drink hem in goed gezelschap dan smaakt het nog zo goed

It pours golden, maybe a touch darker with an solid head that produces a fair amount of lacing. There are aromas of citrus, a bit of floral, and a bit of yeast. It is very dry on the palate first and foremost. There are floral tastes with a bit of citrus, and yeast. It has considerable carbonation. It is even a slight bit sour.
What a wonderful beer. Nice color, thin head, refreshing, tasty with a balanced carbonation.
33ml bottle, bottled on 03/04/2014. Light peachy brown with tall white head leaving plenty of lacing. Fresh funky citrus aroma. Dry, bitter, funky citrus taste. Lively but very dry mouthfeel.
Lune des meilleures bières belges, un rapport qualité prix imbattable. Une bière unique et quasiment parfaite. Je nai malheureusement pas eu la chance den faire vieillir une...
Acobreado com espuma bege persistente de bos formação. Malte predomina, algo de wisk, adocicado. No paladar final herbáceo com leve dulçor. O wisk, conhaque predomina. Boa carbonatação.
Wow! Such a simple bottle! And it contains one of the best things Belgium has to offer!

Très bonne bierre. très désaltérante à boire en été.
Toujours en stock à labbay.
Gouter aussi son fromage, cest un délice

(1 year old) Muddy ambery color with long lasting foam. Light smell. The taste is a little hoppy, a little belgian yeasty and a little dusty. The carbonation is lively and big bubbled. The aftertaste is not really sensational either. However, if I remember correctly, a younger version of it was better.

Bottled. Slightly cloudy, red-brown colour with a small off-white head. The aromas and flavours are both dominated by fruit and spice, like a spiced, mixture of stewed apple and pair. Slightly sour and acidic, with a very dry finish. Good.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2016 Aged 15 months prior to tasting (served at the À lAnge gardien pub, Orval).
Amber orange with greenish shades. Incredibly thick ivory head.
After ageing for more than a year, the secondary aromas (still present, such as fermenting bread, yeast, yogurt, cider) yield way to fragrant white flowers.
Noticeably sour, but never to the point of being unbalanced. Dry, bitterish, and long-lasting. The after-taste is reminiscent of bitter herbs. So different and so marvelous.

When aged more than 10 years, as I had the privilege of tasting in Kulminator, Antwerp, the sheer acidity and secondary aromas yield to a perfect balance of almost all flavours except sweet and a predominant aroma of wild red berries and roses. Amazing.

3/26/15 (Bottle) - Very nice dark amber pour, solid carbonation and nice thick tan foam head. Aromas included citrus, raspberries, yeast and hops. Excellent taste matched the sweet aromas and included a nice dry finish. Smooth, strong and pleasant going down. Over all excellent beer.

Something went wrong with my bottle for sure. Its definitely bad. Aroma from the bottle is wild sour. From the glass its less wild, more fruity and malty with a notes of champagne and white wine. In general aroma is nice. Its also super over carbonated. Gushing from the bottle, enormous head. The bear itself is amber color, almost clear. The mouth feel is wrecked by the carbonation, its to huge. Taste has almost nothing in common with belgian ale. Its completely dry, no sweetness at all. Its sour with a tiny touch with wooden barrel note. Its a pity that I wasnt able to try a proper Orval.
Bottle pours dark amber, hazy, with a very big white head. Fudge, mixed sweets jeasty aroma. Dry medium body with a bitterness on the end

Come ogni birra trappista la promessa è di essere una birra eccezzionale e lOrval non delude.
Il suo colore tendente al bruno e la sua abbondante schiuma invitano alla bevuta. Al naso si mescolano aromi animali, donati dalla rifermentazione con lieviti Brettanomices, a quelli di frutta sciroppata. In bocca si spalanca una girandola di sensazioni che vanno dal vinoso alla frutta sotto spirito, passando per note lievemente tostate ad acide. 
Lequilibrio tra le componeneti è incredibile, il corpo è medio e cè una leggera secchezza che non toglie niente alla rotondità della birra ma aggiunge una nota di pulizia prima del bel finale.
Carbonazione media ma adeguata.
Una birra da invecchiamento e comparazione. Una birra imperdibile.

UPDATED: APR 15, 2016 It is a main classical beer. I bought this beer in Amstein, Vevey. The body is orange-brown troubled, white and orange foam. The taste is complex and I believe that it is important to drink it at the right temperature. The sensation is in the mouth sparkling, yeast, sugar, plum, malt and hop. It is a perfect beer with a good "foie gras".

Orval is een bier die zich niet zomaar aan je openbaart.
Bij de eerste kennismaking kan je lichtelijk teleurgesteld zijn.
Echter de heerlijke afdronk en nasmaak schudden je langzaam wakker.
Als je dan weer in de gelegenheid bent om er eentje te nemen, ga je hem steeds meer waarderen.
Super.

0,33 l bottle from EDEKA Mohr, bottled on 18/2/2014 (so just over a year old). Clear, amber with a large, foamy, slowly diminishing, tan to white head. Lovely and intense aroma of white grapes, fermented apples, gooseberries and citrus with gentle but not unpleasant medicinal notes. Nice, sourish taste of fermented apples, citrus, white grapes and hints of candy sugar, followed by a long, medium bitter and very dry finish. Medium body, creamy and at the same time spritzy mouthfeel, lively carbonation. Very special but also very good. The acidity still leaves some space for a balancing fruitiness in the aroma and a gentle bitterness in the finish.
Mild taste with hints of caramel. Old dryhopped. Grassy/hay type. Good foam with hazy orange colour. Good carbonation and present but not strong after taste.
Flaska Bishops örebro. Gulaktig kulör med stort vitt skun. Frisk doft av söta äpplen och stall. Smaken drar åt fuktig jordkällare med äpple, hö och örter. Välkolsyrad och frisk.
Orval is absolutely stunning. If I had to pick a single beer to drink every day until I die, Id choose Orval.

Bottle. Beautiful fresh, clean aroma. A delicate sweetness, with a hint of banana makes this an enjoyable beer. Good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A: Perfume, raisins, apricot, "flowers" T: Perfume! :-S O: For me this is very strange. Far to much "artifical" flavour to me...

Bottle 33cl. Amber coloured with a huge white top that fades somewhat. Pour it slowly, otherwise it will run over the glass. Aroma is a bit salty, with malts and hops too. Hints of citrus can be recognized too. The taste is very special. Bit salty and metallic, while the glow of the alcohol is present too. The aftertaste is bitter.

Amertume trop puissante qui déséquilibre.
Pétillance forte avec néanmoins un équilibre général respecté.
Pas mon type de bière
Bottle at home. Sour and yeasty. Floral flavour with spicy tone. Warming finish. Good.

11.7.2014. So much velvety foam that its difficult to pour. Appearance is slightly hazy orange. Aroma has citrus, zest, pepper, rubber. Palate is soft, disappearing carbonation. Quite full bodied but taste is disappointment. It feels like it disappears as carbonation. Its somehow bittersweet, peppery, quite dry, bittery dry finish with some alcohol.

Huge white head, beautiful amber color. Aroma come citrus note and brettanomyces, floral, light dry hopping. Very dry but complex and an intense. Very drinkable. Simple. One of the best beer of the world.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2015 Uitgeschonken in Orval glas. Mooi licht mistig amberkleurig bier, met volle lichtbeige schuimkraag. Geur van grassige hop en citrusfruit. Dit trappistenbier heeft een zeer goede balans!, mooie bittere en droge tonen, smaken van grapefruit, vers brood, en groene kruiden. Het mondgevoel geeft een perfecte carbonatie door met een droge en aangenaam bittere afdronk. De Orval is een uitstekend en uniek bier wat met geen enkel ander Trappistenbier valt te vergelijken. Er is maar 1 soort Orval, maar het is het Trappisten logo meer dan waardig. Ook zeer interessant om dit bier enkele jaren in de kelder te bewaren, benieuwd wat het met het smaakpallet en de bitterheid doet.

big and strong off-white foam, nice lacing, amber, clear; fruity, yeasty, barnyard and acidic aroma; medium bitterness, lightly sweet and sour; medium body, tart, crisp, lively carbonation, long very dry finish;
Overall: a great one, high drinkability, great aroma, perfect look, tasty
One of a kind. Appears amber/red with a foamy, almost endless head. Retains an olive kind of bitterness, thanks to its hops and its yeast.

330ml bottle, from Chez Sophie, Shrewsbury. Nice and fresh, only a couple of months old so much less of the bitterness I remember from my last bottle. Pours hazy amber with medium white head. Nice sweet hoppy aroma. Taste is fresh, hoppy, sweet, with light saison-esque spice and ultra high carbonation. Refreshing and hugely enjoyable beer.
Hazy copper with debris and enormous off white head. Aroma of fermented fruit funk. Light slightly sweet malt taste, some citrus bitter. Herbal spice funk brett in the finish.

It smells amazingly fruity. Definitely dry and leaves a bitter taste that I can't describe.

Bottled 19-Oct-2011, aged at room temperature (20C) and drank 28-Feb-2015. Great head but it did not remain for long. Persistent high Aromas of sherry, aged alcohol, aged plums, figs, old hops. No malt aroma detected. Flavors of leather, earth. Low bready, biscuity malt flavor. Alcohol taste is smooth, aged. Acidity is low to medium, not lactic or acetic, but like a good wine. Mouthfeel is medium thin, with good carbonation; little warming alcohol. No astringency. Aftertaste is short, pleasant and dry. A bit odd but I did not pick brett in the aroma as I expected.

For me this is the perfect beer. Golden amber beer with a creamy head that lasts and lasts. The aroma is citrus and hoppy. The taste is slightly bitter but the palate is perfect and well balanced. I love this beer!

UPDATED: DEC 6, 2015 hazy amber liquid with yellowish frothy head. Sour aroma, cider vinegar. Taste of cardboard, light sweet medium bitter, med sour. light body, thin feel, average carbonation, bitter finish.
Complex (but in a good way) taste, with bitterness in aftertaste and very good hop.

330ml bottle from Masuyos in Asagaya. Poured into a stemmed tulip. Hazy brown/orange color with a huge off-white soapy head. Strong barnyard, brett, orange zest, brown sugar aromas present. Nice lacing throughout. Nice sweet/sour notes on the palate with a great long dry finish. Citrus and brett notes become more present as the beer warms up to room temperature. World class beer.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2015 Rating the Trappistes is pretty difficult since many of them are world-class brews, they are generally all complex, offering a variety of often subtle flavors, and many cleverly disguise a high alcohol content. I drank Orval decades ago in Belgium and am drinking it again now. Not my favorite of this style, with a lower ABV and a less complicated taste profile, it is still a fine example of brewing as an art. Enjoyed in a Chimay chalice it is a little bitter, certainly quite dry and with a bit of a metallic finish (or maybe thats cloves)... still understated and quite drinkable.
Amber color with nice head. Aroma: fruit, spicy, wine accents, brett notes. Nice bitterness. Dry, sour, beer. High carbonation. Good but only good for me.

Rich amber color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of yeast, clove, floral, & spice; Flavor of malt, hops, some yeast, citrus, and spice; Finish is slightly bitter & and a little acidic; Has a nice hop character -

Golden colour, huge white head. Aroma is fruity and yeasty. Taste is really mild, yeasty, fruity, with an aftertaste of cake. Nothing special, almost boring. Overrated, probably because the label reads trappist. There are far better Belgians out there, in my opinion.

UPDATED: APR 22, 2017 Butelka, warka do 15/10/2019. Bardzo bujna, biala piana, brudzaca szklo, opadajaca w ten troche mydlany sposob - coraz wieksze pecherzyki. Barwa piwa bursztynowa, ciemna, nieprzejrzyste. Na dnie drozdze. Aromaty nieco stonowane ale bardzo bogate - owoce (i ciemne i cytrusy i gruszka i jablka - fajnie wymieszane). wino, łąka. sa tez ewidentne brety. Po lekkim ogrzaniu bretow jest duzo wiecej. Pierwszy z moich belgow, w ktorym to okreslenie "stajnia" tak dobrze opisuje temat. chociaz ta stajnia ma tez nuty apteczne :) W smaku praktycznie nie ma slodkosci, i chocby tym bardzo sie rozni od wiekszosci trapistowskich piw. w ustach wytrawne, goryczkowe, owocowe, kwaskowate. Wysycenie srednie, czyli jak na trapiste niskie. Alkoholu w smaku czy w aromacie nie ma, jest za to - chyba - jako posmak, mieszajac sie z goryczka - jezyk szczypie az po bokach... to szczypanie daje wrazenie korzennosci, ktorego ani w aromacie (no, moze ciut) ani w smaku sensu stricte nie ma. Piwo niewatpliwie i nieszablonowe i ciekawe i warte sprobowania. Na tyle, ze chetnie wrzuce do piwniczki kilka sztuk, niech sobie pofermentuja ;) pasuje mi. Na koncu, po dolaniu wzburzonych drozdzy - smak sie praktycznie nie zmienia, ale aromat przechodzi jeszcze bardziej w stajenne nuty.Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).Rami Rami is drinking an Orval (2013) by Brasserie dOrval at Saska Kępa

Dzikusy bardzo ladnie sie zmienily, taka wiejska droga zadeptana i obsrana trawiasta sianowa, calosc mocnonowocowa, mirabelkowa, jablkowa.
A really good beer! Round taste with a lot of notes in the taste. It fills the whole mouth.

A hazy, reddish orange coloured beer with a thick and frothy white head. A fruity, plummy and cherry, with a hint of red wine vinegar, plus a straw like grassiness. Dry and fizzy mouthfeel. The taste is a sour, red fruit, vinegary and a grassiness that then brings forth a hint of peppery spice that lasts into a sour led finish.
Nice ocher colour, large head. Fruity aroma. Light body, light carbonation. Taste is bitter and a bit sour, with strong accents of hops.
Bouteille de 330ml. Beau col blanc crémeux et persistant. Arôme belge fin et subtil. En bouche, cest un accord parfait entre le belge et le sour. Un classique indémodable, une référence.

330ml bottle. Six months after bottling date. Pours hazy amber with a very impressive rocky white head. Tonnes of lacing. Funky aroma of lemons, yeast, sourness, reminds me of a faro. Sour fruity and spicy taste with a bitter finish. Meh, I dont get this beer.

Questa è senza dubbio la più particolare e complessa delle trappiste. 6%, colore ambra acceso e una schiuma intensa, compatta e molto persistente, al sapore è secca, decisamente amara per il luppolo rispetto alla maggiore dolcezza di altre trap, pungente grazie anche a una discreta frizzantezza. UPDATED: FEB 17, 2015 Have had this numerous times. Pours orange, brown with a nice head. Fantastic balance between funkiness (brett), bitterness and lots of dryness. This is my go-tobeer in any bar I ever visit. For me THE Belgian Ale. 4.4

Medium body with a creamy texture. Normal carbonation with a bit of effervescence in the finish.

 Unfortunately, the flavor profile isnt as impressive as the appearance or the aroma. It is intense, lacks complexity, and is poorly balanced. From the onset, phenols dominate and little else comes forward. In the middle, a bit of biscuit sweetness is underneath, but you really have to "look" for it. The finish is dry.

Bottle at home. Pours cloudy yellow, nose is spicy, floral, taste is similar, dry - had it too young apparently.

In bottle. White/beige, frothy, rocky head,persistent. Amber/copper, fairly cloudy. Intense and persisten at nose. Light honey, citrus, spicy, light caramel, pine, yellow fruit. Fairly intense in the mouth, persistent. Medium body. A bit of warming sensation, medium carbonation. A bit sour. Sweet in the entry and bitter lingering in the mouth. Balanced. Armonic.

Poured from a fresh bottle - Pours with a sparse white foam head into an opaque dark brown. The nose shows a lemon tartness akin with some slight brett tones. The palate is slight sweet with a very slight brettiness. Medium-full bodied and very foamy. A medium bitterness shows at the end. Bitterness seems somewhat off-putting as the brettiness should take center stage.

Poured from a 10 month old bottle - Colors are the same except the foam is slightly more dirty. The nose shows more brettiness. The brettiness becomes more pronounced in comparison to the fresh version. The bitterness also slightly increases. Shows good potential to age a lot further.

33 cl orval bottle. Rust coloured beer with a start a big head. Very interesting spiced beer with a sweet citrussy taste in it. Perfect blend for the taste. Dont forget that you have to drink it at 12 degrees Celsius.

La cervecería de Orval pone una sola cerveza en el mercado, cerveza de alta fermentación, refermentada en botella, titulando un 6,2% vol.alc. Esta cerveza se constituye exclusivamente de agua de manantial, de maltas de cebada, lúpulos, azúcar candi y levaduras. El aroma y la finura del gusto de la cerveza de Orval tienen más a los lúpulos y a las levaduras que a las maltas.A esta cerveza se le echa bastante lúpulo y esto en dos momentos distintos de su producción: la gran cantidad de lúpulos finos utilizados en sala de macerado le confiere un grado de amargura muy elevado al mismo tiempo que una larga conservación. Por otra parte, el método inglés de la lupulización cruda --  dry hopping -- practicada en bodega de guardia es alcual se le debe el buquete lupulado que hermosa la nariz de los consumidores más apreciados.En la cata, cerveza y queso de Orval se adaptan maravillosamente.Las formas muy particulares del vaso y de la botella así como el diseño de las etiquetas, cartones y otros materiales publicitarios son herencia del principio de los años treinta.

http://www.estucerveza.com/orval-  - 2,30
http://cerveza.uvinum.es/orval - 2,10
On opening, a real champagne like first pour that turns into a nice milky head. Tastes of coriander and fig. Its nice and not overwhelming.

Still the best head in the business-- it is second to none. Rich and thick foam, speckled with spice goblins, eventually settles into a solid meringue that doesnt leave your side. Outstanding.

Aroma is surprisingly a bit sweet and citrus, which is not all that common in belgium ales. The taste has grapefruit bite to it, with some bittery hops but which quickly dissipitates. Very creamy on the palate. Overall a delight to drink and a very good balance of flavor, texture, and appearance. Another fine trappist specimen.
Lovely Belgian ale. Tart, slightly sweet and very rich. One of the best Trappist.
Drank from a bottle. Nice, a bit strange taste. I cant really figure what it is. A bit citrusy.
11.2 FL OZ ($5.29) one of the best. has everything youre looking for in a belgian ale. these are always nice

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2017 Having been familiar with this trappist for so many years, I noticed I hadnt put it on this site yet, so its about time for a rating. I dug up a ten months old bottle from the cellar and pour it into a wine glass - the original glass, belonging to Belgiums most iconic glassware (no less so than the drop-shaped bottle), is perfectly fit for enjoying this in a pub or an outdoors café, but its shape seems too wide to capture enough of the aroma in an actual tasting session. Very thick, dense and moussy, crackling, yellowish white head over a deep orangey amber beer with strong fizz, clear at first but hazy with deposit - which, by the way, is often served separately in a small liquor glass as it contains the wild yeast which makes this brew so beloved among beer afficionados. Spritzy, appetizing aroma of great complexity: crabapple, sour berries, lemon zest, sourdough, leather, cava, wet hay, dry white wine, unripe plums, biscuit, sorrel, raw rhubarb, grapefruit, red wine vinegar, freshly cut grass, bitter honey, soap and - unexpectedly - a very remote hint of ammonia, which in this case does not even disturb too much. Very dry and utterly crisp taste with finely tingling, even further drying carbonation, almost a brut taste, sour and unripe fruits in high quantities, refreshing lemony acidity and even a slight hint of saltiness, nutty malt background, a tad toasted and only very faintly sweetish, becoming ever more yeasty and hoppy towards the end; the finish has residual nutty maltiness, the funky, powdery, dryly sherryish, sourish and leathery effect of Brettanomyces and a great, long lasting deal of leafy, earthy and peppery hop bitterness. You are left with a mouth and throat completely dried - but in a rewarding, appetizing, pleasant way which makes you long for more. This is a category by itself: it originated in the thirties as something completely different from what was (and still is) custom among trappist breweries and became not only one of the greatest classics on the Belgian beer map, but in beer culture in general. It has had a dedicated following for many a decade and though perhaps something of an acquired taste, those who fall in love with it, remain strikingly faithful to it. A beer this famous and old has of course undergone many changes, with quality discussions among its followers resulting from that. My personal impression is that the hoppiness, which originally made this ale famous (before the advent of American style IPAs, this was the hoppiest beer of the country), had declined a bit some two years ago along with the wild Brett character, but that since last year, both of these features have returned in full glory (which may, or may not, have to do with the arrival of a new - female - brewmaster). Finally, it is a well-known fact that Brettanomyces can digest bigger sugars than Saccharomyces but takes more time to do so, which makes this an ideal beer for cellaring; lots of pubs and even beer shops sell Orval at 2+ years of age nowadays and consider the matured version a different beer compared with a young bottle. I cannot but agree with this: thought the crisp hops will fade after a few years, the Brett does not cease to do its work, resulting in a beer less bitter but much more dry and funky. Waste products of the Brett fermentation include compounds that render the beer an aroma of exotic fruits after a couple of years and I vividly recall a 4-year old sample to be one of the most exciting Belgian beers I ever tasted. A 2-year old sample was somewhere in between: an almost citrussy, delicate, fresh cucumber- and passion fruit-like sourishness rose up from the glass, as well as a delicate rose petal perfume (a typical Brett effect after a certain amount of time), paired with a still vivid floral hoppiness; the sweet banana touch of the 4-year old was already in the making and the body had lost none of its effervescence and crispness.  The taste too stunningly balanced all these features, a real treat and a taste profile of marvellous complexity.  Patience and perseverance are key in the appreciation of this great beer - not in the least because it has become a lot harder to find in the past years as well. Though opinions differ concerning the amount of ageing it needs (for me personally, anything between 2 and 5 years gives the best results), it is a world classic in its youth, in its middle age and in its aftermath, everyone into beer should taste this both young and old to decide for themselves which age they prefer.  I take the more mature vintages into account for this rating - and frankly, I do not understand why this does not score higher...  As for me: I can drink this all night and have been known to do so, I just never get tired of it.  World class - and in the modern beer world dominated by creativity and more extreme flavours, I have the impression that this is among those very few old Belgian classics that keep standing strong, even among young beer geeks who are practically born in the international IPA and imperial stout tendencies of our age.
0.33l Hazy brown, off-white head. Aroma is fruity, acohol, caramel. Taste is sour, ight sweetness, bit of bitter. Sth annoying. Dont understand why so highly rated.

@ Cafe Karpershoek in Amsterdam. This is one of my favorite beers, although it is better with age. Pours hazy copper with a creamy white head. Aroma is floral, and citrus. Complex beer with some funk if aged. Finishes dry and hoppy. Great beer!

Bottled about four month ago. Drank at room temperature in winter. Abundant mist upon opening the bottle. Aroma of baking yeast. Abundant lively foam receding quickly. Important carbonation. Impressive mouthfeel. Slight taste of aniseed and bubble gum. Overall positive. Elegant beer.
Bottle 0,33l. Thin white head. Aroma caramel, sweet, malty. Taste sweet, malty, yeast. Not the best.
Bottle @ De Tolly Joogipood. Pours hazy golden with huge foamy-sticky white head.Aroma is sweet, malty, alcohol, caramel, raisins. Taste is sweet, braed, malty, yeasty.I think this beer is overrated.

Pours a wonderful light amber with foamy off white head which lasts the entirety of the drink. Aroma is rich, the taste is a perfect balance of flowery hops and candy sugar sweetness. A very good and unique Trappist.

Incredible pillow head that sticks around forever. Super svelte fruity clove aroma that is intoxicating in itself. Deep amber body that has the typical unfiltered sediment floating around. Has a subtle fruit and bitter taste that quickly finished on the dry side. A real treat.

Bottle into trappist glass. Pours a hazy light brownish amber colour with a big fluffy white head. Aroma is lemon a bit of leather and some white wine. Taste is dry white wine. Really nice beer.

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10

Fizzily, pours a dark, cloudy, golden body with a long-lasting, bubbly, white head. Noticeable lacing. Banana, strawberry and tart apple aromas abound. Cloves and spice notes come through, along with scents of yeast and a bit of funky sourness. Crisp white grapes intermingled with sour green apple flavors. Finishes dry, with tastes of tarragon and a hint of anise. Carbonation is lovely, yet somehow reminiscent of a semi-flat champagne. Occasional streams of upward bubbles indicate the effervescence in this complex beauty.
Delectably refreshing trappist ale that I will indefinitely enjoy again.

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2015 The Orval Trappist brewery makes only one beer, but that beer is the best beer in the world. Excellent and unusual perversion. It smells like a barn, as some veined cheese. Biggest and glorious rich foamy pale beige head from the bottle ever. You can eat it and cut it with the knife. Intense distinctive and noble aroma, slightly cloudy, amber orange nuance. It is not possible not to remember forever and ever this divine beer. Alcohol just above six is probably the best choice for this product. Incredible carbonation, not possible to explain. Simple and complex, world classics! This is a noble category by itself. The most exciting beer ever. Hallelujah!
It pours medium cloudy orange, immaculate head, maybe the best Ive seen. The aroma is subtle citrus, sweet, follows through with the taste, very smooth, not very bitter, quite dry.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2016 Bottle 33cl bought at Schaliënhuis Temse. Pours hazy amber with a big creamy dark white head. Nose: brett aroma, malts, vanilla notes, orange zeste and hops. Taste: strong carbonation. Brett fflavour with hints of vanilla, orange zeste and a strong malty feeling in combination with also a stronger hoppy bitterness followed by a warm alcoholic feeling in the back of my throat. The aftertaste is strong dry with hoppy and malty touches. Very good trappist indeed :)

Subtle fraguant nose and a nice dark golden coat. Pour it slowly to prevent excess foaming because it has a massive coat that will be more enjoyable. Very balanced ale with an amazing balance between acidic, bitterness and dryness that really got me addicted. A nice crisp taste followed by a very little after taste that gives it a nice boost. Very nice product that I strongly recommend!
Recht herb für einen Belgier. Karamellig, fruchtig, hefige Noten. Sehr komplex, würzig, süffig, herber Abgang.
Deliciosa cerveja trapista, leve dulçor com aspecto muito interessante, cor âmbar, espumante não persistente, cerveja não indicada para ser ingerida em grandes quantidades.

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2015 In its Trappist glass reveals an intense amber color, coppery liquid Cloudy with some residue suspended. It has a creamy white foam with fine bubbles and medium, medium volume, but with a perennial persistence in the cup. Form beautiful ties on the walls of glass that last throughout the tasting.

Very plain, Middle Body to Take.

It shows a beautiful and intriguing Trappist by the further gasification, and how not to mention its beautiful bottle that alludes to the curved shape of a dolphin. I wonder why?

The aroma has beautiful Floral notes as well, and nice Citrus fruits. Lactic Yeast is present and pleasant woody notes mingle. Emerged also the odor of walnuts, a certain toffee malt and carnations.

The first place to Sabor shown very dry on the palate, bitter herbaceous notes with a striking hops, and somewhat salty. Just like its aroma, the taste brought me a sweet on a beautiful touch of honey, dried apricot, malt and spices.

A Very long, bitter and complex. Marked by bitter citrus and herbaceous presence, alternating with a faint sweetness that goes almost by magic to dry with hints of spices.

Alcohol appears both at the beginning and at the end of the drink that is very hot.

It is certainly the most hopped the Trappist beers and having peculiar characteristics. Very complex beer, unique, that every time I drink gives me new sensations.

A great Trappist.

Bottle
Aroma-grass, dark fruits
Appearance-amber, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, light sweetness, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, lively, bitter finish
Ocierał-very good
Fles 33cl. Een straf biertje met een hoge schuimkraag die lang blijft staan. Een hoppig biertje, droog dwz weinig zoet en een lange bittere nasmaak.
This beer is well made, i just hate if for how bitter it is.Drunk it 4 times,same bitternes.not my cup of...beer
0.33 flaske. Gave fra venn. Uklar gyllen med et flott hvit skum som varer. Aroma av gjær banan krydder syrlig. Smak av gjær citrus tørr antydning til humle. Middels co2.
Typical example of belgian ale... Thats my country. And Im proud of it!!!

non molto bella da vedere....ma una birra di gran livello! Tra le trappiste una delle migliori. Ottima se accompagnata con carni rosse per il suo gusto amaro e vinoso!! Da provare a bere dopo un paio danni dal suo imbottigliamento perché la fermentazione in bottiglia le da un sapore nuovo tutto suo!!!! da provare....

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2015 Malgré une bouteille peu esthétique à mon goût, une bière amère sèche à excellent équilibre, sous un fruité, et superbe tenue en longueur. En fait, plus jen bois, plus jai envie den boire.

Butelka - 3 miesięczne; barwa bursztynowa, zmętniona. Piana bujna, ładnie zdobi szkło. Aromat owocowy, słodowy, kwaśny, winny, cytrynowy, dziki., przyprawowy. Smak dziki, lekko kwaśny, owocowy, przyprawowy, cukru. Goryczka średnia, alkoholowa.

Dégustation de deux bouteilles une du 9 janvier 2013 et l'autre du 7 octobre 2014
 sur la première on va trouver des arômes de fruits rouges, fruits confits, pâtes de fruits, sucré. 
Em bouche on va sentir des saveurs de marron est toujours une présence de fruits rouges une amertume assez légère. 
Sur la deuxième va sentir des arômes de marrons, noisettes, crème de marrons.
Em bouche on va sentir des saveurs de noix, noisettes; Elle va être assez sèche.
Au niveau de la mousse elles seront toutes les deux une couleur blanc cassé la mousse de la plus vieille va tenir mieux. Elle va être plus long en bouche.
 elles vont être toutes les deux trouble d'une couleur caramel. 
Une Orval au bout de deux ans c'est quand même meilleur!!

Bottle from local SAQ. Aroma: Belgian yeast, banana, red fruits, spices. App: dark copper with huge white frothy head. Sparkling, Taste and Palate: medium body, light sweetness with medium dry sour finish. Carbonation is lively. Overall: Really enjoy this beer, good balance between spices and Belgian yeast. Tip: Pour really slowly and make sure to tilt your glass or youll end up with 1 inch of liquid and the rest will be the head ;)
From my night market :-) Unique! I find this beer to be unique! Very nice aroma and dry like it doesnt scatter in your mouth! Love it more every time I drink!

Very good. Nice deep orange with a creamy white head and lively carbonation. At 6.2% not very strong but still has a lot of flavor. Typical Belgian with lot of yeast some citruss and spices. Nice balance in moderate malt sweetness and floral hop bitterness. Very acessible and still original.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2015 33cl flesje via Gouders, Vaals Alcoholpercentage van 6,2% Uitgeschonken in Leffe glas Uiterlijk: goudoranje, troebel en mooie luchtige witte schuimkraag Aroma en smaak: fruitig als sinaasappel, kandijsuiker, straffe bitterheid in de nasmaak, gistig Conclusie: bekende trappist, erg lekker op zân tijd
0,33L bottle. Cloudy amber color with large persisting white head. Tastes yeasty with some citrus, and hoppy bitterness at the end. Different than other trappists.... not bad, but not my favourite.

Bonne bière sèche,draft de prune , levure,bananes et un petit coté épicé lové dune belle acidité.En bouche bien amère un peut acidulé dans les tannins,goût de prune,levure avec un petit coté de bananes,final sèche avec un arrière goût épicé qui reste longtemps.Petite chaleur qui colle Bien meilleur température pièce. une bonne bière.
Very well know beer and not the worst one. However, for its 6.2 tastes like its IPA with 10 - this is not a good thing
33 cl bottle. Pours orange, white huge fluffy head. Yeast, fruits, spices aroma. Sweetish malt flavour, oily hoppiness. Hoppy bitterness in the end. What a beer!

Bottle while watching the Iron Bowl. Pours hazy gold with frothy white head. Aroma of citrus, funk and yeast. Tastes yeasty and sour. Very dry. Different from other Trappist ales Ive had. Quite good and unexpected
Bière assez amère. Forte en bouche. Palais Très agréable. Bien équilibré. Larrière goût est un peu faible. Bière très bonne

Flesje tht jul 2019 op 12°C. Aroma heeft veel animale tonen zoals een stevige Bordeaux. Ook wat zuur waarneembaar. Lichttroebel goudgeel met mooi schuim dat lang blijft. De smaak is heftig en vol, maar totaal anders dan andere Trappisten. De zure tonen spelen in het begin de hoofdrol, daarna veel hoppige bitterheid en gist.

330cc bottle. Lovely cloudy amber colour with foamy and persistent head. Sour and yeast. Tastes yeasty and a bit hoppy with some citrus notes.
Nice beer overall.
Amber, cloudy with a lot of foam. Sour, yeasty and dry. Interesting flavor. Not my favorite Belgian. Different than most other Trappists Ive had...a change of pace
Interesting beer, deep golden with medium head. Aromas of citrus, belgian wild yeast. Lightly sour taste.

Aroma: stable, wild yeast, grass, alcohol
Taste: sour, yeasty
A bit too fizzy in the mouthfeel

Butelka 0.33L.
Wygląd: Bursztynowe, klarowne. Piana bardzo obfita, średnio pęcherzykowa, jasno kremowa. Pomimo tego, że dziurawi się, to utrzymuje się długo i ładnie znaczy szkło.
Aromat: Zdecydowanie dziki, stajnia, końska derka, kwaśny, cytrynowy.
Odczucie: Wysokie wysycenie, faktura pudrowa, ciało niskie.
Smak: Lekko dzikie ale dość słodkie. Bardzo wyraźnie czuć alkohol , co jak na 6.2% alk obj. to bardzo dziwne. Przyprawowe, słodowe. Posmak albedo pomarańczy. Goryczka niska ziemisto-alkoholowa.
Całość: Spodziewałem się czegoś więcej. Aromat bardzo przyjemny, dziki ale w smaku przeciętne, mocno alkoholowe.

Bottle @ home. Pours amber color and a huge white head with some nice lacing. Dry and balanced sour aroma with notes of yeast, fruits and citrus zest, spices integrated with hints of thinner (in a nice way), hay. Dry thin bodied mouth feel with medium but sharp carbonation. Balanced taste of fruits, lemon zest, oranges,, yeast, wet hay, spices , leather and some horse blanket. Long lasting bitterness and sourness in the aftertaste.

This is a legendary beer, and a great starting point for trappist beers. It plays close with medium sourness - without being too sour - and theres lovely aromas of licorice and bubblegum. Its red, cloudy, and has a full head.
Its lively - pops in your mouth with a slightly sour carbonation.
Not a fan. Sour yeasty is a good way to describe this beer. Slightly sourish fruity yeast aroma. Flavor matches....kind of tart too. Just not really refreshing.

Pours hazy amber with a medium white head. Nose is citrusy (orange peel) and spicy. Complex aromas of citrus, lemon, herbs, hay, bitter cocoa, spices and Belgian yeast. Fizzy carbonation, thin texture. The mouthfeeling is unique, dry, spicy, sour and bitter. Long bitter and dry finish. Not my favorite type of beer, but something really exceptionnal here, a unique beer experience !

Bottle from Ridgewood Wine. 

Aroma: complex mix of spices, yeast, malt, citrus, a little hay, very earthy. Reminds me a bit of a refined saison mixed with an IPA and a light Belgian. Also, a bit like some dry white wines, unique and fantastic.

Appearance: Brown/copper colored, white head that took a very long time to disappear. The head tasted similar to the nose, but with a bit more citrus.

Flavor is similar to the head, maybe a bit more citrus than the nose.

Palate: Little bit of spice, 0 alcohol. Very well done.

Amber color with haze and white and long head. 
Fruity, lemon and spicy notes and also the characteristic leather an cider aromas. Bitter taste, full body and high carbonation. Dry and long finish. High quality and different Trappist beer

Trocken und sehr intensiv im Geschmack, mit schöner Hopfennote und einer Geschmacksexplosion nach dem Schlucken. Top!

Bottle. Deep amber pour with a thick head, tons of lacing. Aroma of citrus, orange, lots of malt, spice. Taste is excellent, Belgian yeast, caramel malt too. Just grand.

Aroma: Medium lemon, sherbet, Light spicy.
Appearance: Body: Hazy, amber. Head: large, tan, rocky. Good retention, lacing.
Flavour: Medium-high bitterness. Medium lemon, sherbet. Light barnyard. Very dry finish. Lingering bitterness 
Mouthfeel: Medium body. Medium-high carbonation.

330 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Andre!
16E. Belgian Specialty Ale

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2015 Birra giovane, meno di un anno di vita, per una che in cantina ci starebbe anche anni. Premesso ciò, nel bicchiere si mostra con un bel dorato carico, tendente allarancio, molto limpida, con riflessi dorati e con una schiuma abbondante, fine, bianca e lungamente persistente. La naso le sue note molto fruttate vengono subito fuori: troviamo un sentore di vinaccia, quasi di grappa barricata, e sotto sotto anche qualche nota di mela verde. Al palato ritroviamo però una carbonazione molto spinta, quasi al limite, quasi ad allappare il palato. Il corpo è tendente al leggero, con lievi note di pane. Lamaro finale è molto morbido e si accompagna ancora a note fruttate (bacca rossa). Il sorso è molto rotondo con una buona complessità totale.

Une magnifique robe dorée. La mousse tient plutôt bien.
Arômes fruités (plutôt prune, raisin, banane et mirabelle). Goût de levure prononcé.
Une bière particulière, à essayer au moins 1 fois dans sa vie !

DAA; Bottle 330ml. Opens like a champagne in celebration of my 800 rating. Pours hazy amber with a huge, creamy, lasting and lots of lacings, off-white head. Nose is moderate magic, malt, sweet citrus, oranges, yeast, herbal and spice. Taste is moderate sweet, citric and light bitter with a sweet lasting, spiced bitter orange, warming finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2016 Bottle from BrewHaus lincoln. Great beer. A classic. Deep dark Amber colour with a tight head. The aroma has that Belgian yeast which is typical. The taste has this too. With lots of fruit and a bitter sweet finish.

UPDATED: NOV 14, 2015 Servie dans son verre. Couleur dorée intense, parfum de fruit jaune (mirabelle), amertume très présente en la humant comme en la buvant. Une bière exigeante. / Intense golden colour, smell of yellow prune, strong bitterness smelling as drinking. A demanding beer.
Version "vieille" (plus dun an et demi après son acquisition à labbaye) : parfum très volatile dalcool, embaume les fruits jaunes, gourmande; très belle mousse abondante et vive, ressemblant à de la crème fouettée ou du blanc doeuf en neige; couleur ambre doré. Saveurs dherbe, de clou de girofle; amertume finale après une certaine légèreté pour commencer; savon, acidité fine. Sacrément grisante... le d° dalcool augment eeffectivement avec lâge [08/11/2014]
Version "jeune" (quelques mois de mise en bouteille) : corps couleur ambrée claire, trouble, fines bulles, surmonté dune mousse blanc cassé fine, aérienne mais consistante (comme des blancs en neige), qui chante, présente tout au long de la dégustation. Aromes dorange douce, levure, coriandre, clou de girofle, pâte à biroche crue, herbe coupée, noix fraîche, et houblon bien sûr. On retrouve tout cela dans les saveurs à quoi sajoute la muscade et une légère acidité; lamertume est prononcée sans être agressive; elle apporte une grande longueur; elle est très expressive avec un met très ton sur ton comme un croque-monsieur au fromage dOrval (vieux dans le cas de cette dégustation); un peu de salinité sur la fin; la carbo est importante sans être excessive. Au final, une gourmandise qui contrebalance une certaine austérité. Et un étalon en matère de bière à mon sens. [14/11/2015]
Bottle at St. Veronus. Huge foamy white head over a a! very light amber body. Huge yeast presence, some funk. Alcohol is very pronounced. Soft and sessionable, very nice texture.

Very delicious beer. Highly recommended. It is a very strong beer. Great for strong flavored foods. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, o.33l. The bottle looks beautiful. Hazy cooper colour with massive beige head which leaves nice lacing. Spicy and herbal aroma. Taste is a bit sweet at the beginning, then sour and herbal and bitter at the end. Overall interesting and complex beer but Im not as impressed as most of the raters. Not my style of beer.

2,5 years after bottling date. Golden copper, amber color, hazy, beige head. Aromas of flowers, lemon, hay, barnyard. Taste is really complex, with sour and funky flavors at first, followed by lemon, flowers, some citrus and lemon. Very dry. Medium body with medium to high carbonation.
Simply, great!!! One of the first Trappist I got many years ago. Since then it has never dissapointed me!! This one is a 6,2% ABV. Sorry, my computer is dead. Tasting notes are coming soon!!

Probada en botella . De color naranja nublado y olor picante persistente. Al principio el sabor ácido cítrico combinado con algo de pimienta y ligeramente amarga . Cuerpo medio y baja percepción del alcohol . Cerveza para disfrutar

I had the one year aged version. Very fruity aromas and flavors of peaches, plums, grapes and spices. Slightly bitter/tart finish and the body is not quite spritzy but not creamy either; somewhere in between I guess. This beer certainly lived up to the hype.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2015 Une bière unique, aussi belle à regarder que bonne à déguster! Mousse délicate, fine et douce, des arômes complexes, houblon doucement citronné, herbe sèche, mie de pain blanc...33 cl de bonheur!

in contrast to all the other reviews i was a bit unimpressed with this to be honest, anyway heres my review: 
smells of seaweed, hazy golden amber colour, no head, very yeasty and malty. have heard this is better after being laid down a couple of years.

Hazy brown color with a HUGE off-white head. Beautiful aroma of brettanomyces, wild flowers, asphalt and mango. Mild sour flavour with a surprisingly bitter finish. Very complex on the palate, wonderful bretty accents, notes of coriander, citrus fruits, chocolate, white bread. Truly one of the best beers Ive ever had!!
Top trappist. Donker. Uitgekiende smaak, Heeft veel karakter ondanks lage alc %. Staat op zelfde hoogte als Westvleteren, Westmalle, Rochefort

Hazy orange body with a thick white head that lasts. Aroma is citrus, hops, some bret character. Taste is sweet with some spice and a light hoppy bitterness. Bitter finish, medium body. Good but not as good as I expected.

Bottle from Stockmann in Tallinn ( 4,45). My first Orval - not sure why Ive restrained myself from trying it before... Bottled 7 months ago on 31.03.2014; BB 31.03.2019. Pours... all foam! Massive, white with a creamy hue, frothy, thick, leaving very dense lacing... and beneath that a liquid starts to show thats hazy dark orange amber. Nose is bubblegum, cinnamon biscuits and earthy hops, pickled autumn fruits, cidery acidity. If I let it sit still for a few minutes, the acidity will burn my nostrils. Taste is surprisingly bitter with lemon zest and earthy notes most apparent, also moderately sour, and malty with low sweetness, yet caramelly, and has that British cinnamon biscuit note to it. It thickens as it warms, acquiring more dense, autumny flavours including plums or dark cherries. Finish is sharp bitterness somewhere way back in the throat, whereas in the mouth its more grainy and malty with a white wine acidic character. Light to medium, almost watery body (though thickening as it warms) is accompanied by flat carbonation and a cidery, slightly grainy dry palate. 

Im not being original by saying this is an exeptional brew - probably the most complex beer Ive tasted yet - even if I cannot consider myself a fan of some of its aspects considering the palate, especially the finish. Will definitely try more and less fresh versions to give it a better verdict.
Bone dry with huge carbonated head, lovely tan to orange colour. Flavour is Brett followed with Belgian yeast spice. The final is a slight bitter follow through. Nice summer ale.
Bottle. Pours hazy orange with thick foamy white head. Aroma is very Brett, tropical fruits, mango, sweet oranges, citrus. Taste is a touch wild, very carbonated, dry, crisp. Pretty good.

Sinceramente sono sempre stato poco attratto da questa birra, la vedevo come una sorella "minore" rispetto alle sorelle trappiste. Dopo averla bevuta posso dire felicemente di essermi sbagliato. Colore ambrato carico con un cappello di schiuma fine e persistente, aroma di malto, frutta candita e lieviti, al palato è fantastica parte con malto seguita da frutta per finire poi con un amaro non fastidioso, la carbonazione bassa la fa scendere che è un piacere. Fantastica

Splendida birra, ambrato scuro con schiuma beige pannosa e persistentissima. Odore di frutta, miele e spezie. In bocca frutta, una dolcezza data dal miele ed un finale tra lacidulo ed il salato. Buono il retrogusto, poco etilico ma caldo. Splendida birra.

"great aroma, flavor was not quite as good. a solid beer, but theres too many beers I like better than this one to go back to it for the price. better than average, though, and worth trying. 2010-a little more bretty funk than i remember bumps the flavor score up slightly...still think its over rated but a solid brew nonetheless."
2010 bottle, Aroma is apple lambic sort of. Clear copper colour. Hops gone from the taste , pleasant taste but not really anything special. Nice beer

Bottle. Aroma of citrus with a hint of herbs. Appearance is cloudy amber with significant white head. Light bitter taste. Medium to light body, with a texture that is hard to pin down, and a dry finish. Very complex beer.
Nie wiem dlaczego, ale nic nie urzek?o mnie w tym piwie. Smak ci??ki do zdefiniowania, w niesko?czono?? oczekiwanie na wybijajacy si? smak. Barwa i prezencja w porz?dku, ale nic poza tym.

One of the best things I have tried recently, theres an explosion of flavours and aromas involved with this one! It is very lively so care must be took when pouring, otherwise the head will end up all over your newly washed carpet. The aroma is funky brett. Taste is a herby, slightly spicy and characteristically brett! Could drink several of these throughout the course of a day.

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2015 Spicy herbal aroma, with a bread yeast kick. Flavour is so complex for its abv, , sweet, sour, dry hops . World class beer .
Re rate, this bottle was 15 months old, even more complex, and even more delicious now. Need to buy more for the cupboard, and leave longer

Etant donné la modicité de la production, chaque brassin est différent de tous les autres, mais toujours il y a ce nez puisamment végétal, coulis de fougères et de lime mélées, cette première bouche ronde, douce, cette seconde sure comme une Gueuze, épicée comme une IPA et puis il y a cette interminable longueur amère, si longue quon se réveille parfois avec en bouche lOrval de la veille. Ma cave en regorge, ce qui explique quelle soit si rare.

Bottle from Beer Gonzo, Coventry. Aroma of some citrus, banana, raisins. Hoppy aroma for a Belgian ale. Taste is clean, fresh citrus with some banana, orange. Decent bitter finish. Very nice stuff this. Easy going stuff for the strength.
Rich and filling beer with lots of flavors. The bitter tartness on the finish takes over too much and the mouthfeel is a bit too foamy. A classic brew but not for all tastes.

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2015 330ml bottle served in a chalice. A: Beautiful bottle and art. Pours a hazy amber to chestnut color, forming a huge light yellow to beige head that dissipates slowly leaving lots of lacings around. A small layer persists and some particles can be seen floating around. S: Slightly sweet upfront. Very malty and fruity. Strong notes of pears, apples and grapefruit. Sour and peppery notes. Fresh and grassy hops and the traditional Belgium yeasts at the end. T: Distinct and complex as the nose. Sweet caramel upfront but very dry, in overall, slightly sour with a quite bitter finish. Caramel malts. White grapes, apples, pears and grapefruit. Notes of wood, nuts, yeasts and finally the hops. M: Medium body and high carbonation. Dry and bitter aftertaste. O: Excellent drinkability. Trappist masterpiece. Mandatory to any beer lover.[ BA Review @ 1/9/2010 ]
caramel, herbs, barnyard, brown, clear, frothy, light sweetness, lightly sour, medium body, lively,

330 ml bowling pin bottle. Cloudy amber orange color. Big rocky beige head.aroma is redolent of Brettanomyces yeast. Earthy barnyard notes, as expected. Flavor upfront is tart and bready with dry acidic notes. Finish is dry and light spicy hops. A world class ale. Very simple and wonderfully complex. Salt of the earth. This was the first Belgian beer I ever tasted back in the late 1970s. I remember that it was so uniquely different and intriguing. It started me on a journey to explore the many different beer styles that were so unfamiliar to me then. Orval holds a special place in my memory and heart. It still tastes the same now as I remember it did back then.
Tasted under suboptimal conditions, but contains notes of pickled cucumbers, mustard and lambic.
This beer is so special. Isnt my kind pf beers, but still being a must for me. Spicy, swett, dry... Extremly well balanced, good body, nice head...

11.2 oz. bottle from Bottleworks poured into an Orval chalice.  Solid amount of head, thick, which lasts a long time.   Golden hue, slightly cloudy.  Fruity aroma, some leather and mustiness from the Brett yeast.  Spice, apple and a little citrus.  Hits with tartness and some sweet in the front, with some hops bitterness, then finishes with sweet malt still with a little bitterness.  Light to medium on the tongue, medium carbonation, finishes fairly medium and fairly dry.   I am going to try cellaring a couple of these bottles for a few years and see what changes.
Aroma, thickness, smell, I just love it. Only thing is it might be a bit to strong 6% alcohol...

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2014 Bottle of 33cl, in a Trappist glass; room temperature.

The second best "Trappiste" beer. Really loud aroma and taste, with a nice but lightly smoky palate. Beautifull color of bière trappiste !

A beer for real tasters only...
Cheers !

Beer from bottle. Cloudy orange colour and persistent spicy smell. At first acid citrus taste, then strong pepper and slightly bitter. Very low alcohol perception. Absolutely satisfying.
Highly over carbonated off white head. Peppery and slightly sour aroma. Musty sweet funky yeast flavor. There are many Belgium beers I really like. This is just not one of them.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours amber with a white head. Taste Belgian yeast, fruity, tart. I thought this was good. I would drink this again.
