0,3l Flasche. Orangebraunes Bier mit heftiger Schaumkrone. Riecht nach Orange und Gewürzen (Zimt). Schmeckt malzig, sehr Hopfenbetont und leicht herb.

From a bottle. Pours hazy orange copper with a thick foamy beige head. Tastes light, dry, line sour grapes, grassy, cracker malt. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like sweet red grapes, raisin, musky grains, and a little earthy. Very solid.

Bottle. Pours hazy amber with thick, frothy off-white head. Aroma is toasted malts, light toffee, light barnyard esters, light citrus, and some spice. Flavor is dry malt profile, light spicy hops, Belgian yeast esters, and faint sour fruit notes; crisp, dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2014 Zurig aroma dat waar het fruit diep in verborgen zit, niet aangenaam. Prachtige schuimkraag die mooi schuimt, lijkt wel wolkachtig. Prachtig licht bruin getinde kleur, met dunne maar vrij veel carbonatie. Smaak doet kruidig aan in het begin en wordt fruitiger na een tijd in de afdronk met hinten van caramel. Droog in afdronk.
Pours golden brown with thick white head from the bottle. Smells spicy with some wheat. Fruity, spicy, bubbly on the drink. Fnishes smooth. Light on the palate.
Bottle in Delirium, Brussels. Good belgian beer but strange dusty, spicy, citrussy flavours that didnt grab me and make me think this is an outstanding beer despite its trappist status.

Lovely golden orange beer with a big creamy, fluffy, off-white head. Very intense and fruity aroma - both sweet and tart - of yeast/brettanomyces, sweet citrus, fruit, hops, dried herbs, grape juice and sour yogurt. Tart taste of yeast, fresh and ripe fruit, white wine, dry shery, malt and a very pleasant hop presence. The warmer it gets the more complex, vinous and interesting it becomes and the tartness becomes much more distinct. Medium body, dy finish, long aftertaste.

Belíssima formação de creme! Espesso e levemente amarelado.

Líquido turvo com uma bela coloração âmbar. Vale admirar por alguns instantes antes e durante a degustação.

O aroma é intenso. Tenho dado muita sorte com as cervejas que venho bebendo neste quesito, mas esta se superou! Doce, noz moscada, muito bom mesmo.

Muito amarga! Mesmo!!! E seca. Lembra um pouco uma schwartzbier, porém com algo mais no sabor, muito mais rica. Dá pra sentir um pouco de frutas secas, doce porém sem o açúcar. O Beltrameli falou em mel... realmente pode ser que a "doçura" que existe lembre um pouco a mel.

O retrogosto é bastante intenso, porém tem duração limitada. Não foi o que mais me agradou nesta cerveja.
Starts off carbonated with a fruity, dry and slightly sweet taste and has noticable hops. The aroma is really powerfull on this one so better take some time to fully enjoy it.
UPDATED: JAN 23, 2017 Rich in flavour and extremely aromatic, but not sickeningly sweet. Heres hoping a few more converts show up at the monastery. Unbelievably good.

Uniek in zijn soort. Echt een fantastisch biertje. Heb hier standaard enkele bakken van staan. Mijn persoonlijke favoriet onder alle trappisten en waarschijnlijk ook alle bieren daarbuiten.

Fantastisch biertje om te laten agen in de kelder. Cafés die dit biertje op hun kaart hebben staan, zullen altijd mijn voorkeur genieten.

Van dit bier zijn er veel tegenstanders, maar ook veel voorstanders. Echte bierliefhebbers zullen een biertje als het deze altijd weten te appreciëren.

Bottle in Serbia. It pours a very hazy coppery colour, huge and consistent off white foamy head. Nose: pungent herbal notes, lemon skin, grainy, sourness feel. Mouth: medium-high carbonation, medium dry palate. Notes of yeast, citrus, balanced sourness and bread. It is simply an Orval. Unique. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from bottle. Aroma of citrus with a hint of herbs. Appearance is cloudy amber with significant white head. Light bitter taste. Medium to light body, with a texture that is hard to pin down, and a dry finish. A very complex beer.
Talk about aromatic. Huge fruity esters, and wood, some slight herbs. Flavor of rich caramel and slight lemon tart. The finish is rich caramel and a well balanced bitterness.A+++++

Bottle. Pours dark orange, very hazy, with huge white head. Overcarbonated, bretts have eaten something inside the bottle. Very good aroma. Fruity, floral. Its dry, with some bitterness, really fruity, with some funky notes. Good.
First time I had it I thought it was not my type of beer, gave it a second chance and now i'm convinced, super!

Bottle, 6.2% ABV. Bottled on 3/4/14; BBE 3/4/19. Stewed apple, anise and general herby/floral aroma. Sherbet lemon, pepper. Cloudy amber appearance with a billowing bubbly (loose) head. Extensive lacing and good retention. Gentle sweetness that slowly dries to a very crisp bitterness. Bit of a blunt alcohol note that might dissipate with age. Some sourness there too. Very frothy texture, medium to full body, and a long bitter finish. Overall a highly complex, yet quaffable and refreshing beer.
Boa escolha. Sabor agradável e leve. Aroma delicado e apreciável. Cai muito bem se vc estiver na Bélgica.

11.2 oz. bottle from Wilburs. Appearance: 2 fingers white head, orange yellow color, cloudy, head lasts as a film, but no real lacing. Aroma: tart fruit, brett, wine, white grapes, light lemon-grass. Palate: light body, dry finish, average to lively carbonation, bitter finish, very dry. Taste: light fruity and winey sweetness that lasts just a second, then into a very slight tartness, that dissipates very quickly and turns to a malty sweet. This too dissipates, and the taste slowly transitions into a nice, dry bitterness. Overall, very unique, really like the way this beer is balanced and the uniqueness. Very impressive and enjoyable.

Really liked this one. The dryness is immediately apparent and pleasing. Nice finish and nose. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
De lichtste trappist die er is maar daarvoor niet de minste. Moet je zeker eens geproefd hebben. Smaakt fruitig is er om van te genieten

0,33 pullo@ St.Urho. samea, kauniin hunajan keltainen . Tuoksussa vahvasti banaania ja geneeristä hedelmäisyyttä, hitunen hiivaa. Maussa käynyttä hedelmää, banaania ja kirpeyttä. Maistamisen jälkeen haistan hieman sitrusta.

Tried this in a restaurant in Brussels and wasnt really impressed. Thought Id give it another go back in the states when I saw it at a local bottle shop. Didnt change my opinion. My least favorite of the trappists Ive tried, but probably not fair to compare as I usually stick with the tripels and quads.

11.2 oz into a tulip glass. Pours a hazy amber, with a huge white head that persists, leaving excellent lacing. Nose is Belgian yeast, cloves, bananas, etc. Taste is malt and caramel, but more subdued that the other Trappist ales, with a drier finish. Very tasty.
The worst Trappist beer I?ve never drunk. Tasting it you could think: "Are you sure this is a trappist one"?
330ml bottle at home. Ive had this before elsewhere. Hazy orange with a pillowy off white head. Wheat aroma, dry hoppy cereal flavours. Slight sourness, dry finish.
sour. Said to be complex but not my thing. vlajhhhhhhhhh. pale ale belgian.

Nez puissant de fruit florale épicé et de feuille. Belle couleur orangé avec une mousse consistante légèrement doré. Une attaque pétillante rafraichissante toute en équilibre dans les saveur amère, sucré et acide. Finale en douceur. Ça se boit tout seul. Tellement de complexité pour si peu dalcool, je ne pensais pas que cétait possible.

Pours an amber color with a lasting thick large white head, heavily carbonated. Aroma of yeast with hints of hops and spice. A balanced taste of spice and hops with a dry feel and a lasting spice finish.

This is the most perfect looking beer known. Orange, and just hazy enough that when you look into the glass you see the beer and not your cat, cast in orange, on the other side of it. The head is pillowy, collapsing seductively and structurally but barely reducing at all. The aroma and the flavour are not overtly extreme or aggressive, but have a combination of all the good things about beer, in the right amounts, to amount to the perfect beer-drinking experience. It would feel wrong to score this in any way other than perfectly. This is not the first time I have had this, each time I have wanted to remove myself from the grasp of this beer, but found myself only wound tighter into its grip (sounding like an alcoholic now).

I would like to be at a party, in the summer, outdoors, where everyone is dressed nicely but casually, with many beautiful women. We are all talking about the rivers of Slovenia, photography books, travel stories, and everyone is emptying chilled bottles of Orval into large glasses. One after the other. There is a wood fired oven where pissaladière comes out (im coming back to reality now, because thats what Im eating). Reality is not so bad though, because Im drinking Orval and eating pissaladière.
This is a beer for the ages.

Nice broad wheat-like nose. Reminiscent of traditional Japanese soy brewed with wheat, e.g. would be Kikkomans Tamari. Almost umami.The Orval was so yeasty when poured that if I closed my eyes, I could imagine a saucer of Tamari. Had a deep amber color and a deep amber flavor. Nutty body which turned fruity and actually almost citrusy and then had a brief finish of hops. Nice mouthfeel. Went down smoothly and setup the palate for another swig almost immediately. Drinkable and enjoyably so.

This one has always been one of my favourites, but for some reason I havent had one in years, untill now. A beautfiful amber coloured beer with a frothy off-white head. Very nice aroma, herbs, caramel, fruits. Taste is very well balanced, light caramel sweetness and fruits. Finishes medium bitter. Medium body, refreshing carbonation. I might make a habit of drinking Orval on a regular basis again.
A classic Belgian style Trappist. Hoppy and not too strong. Delicious aroma. A bit of an acquired taste probably. One of my all time favorites.
Aroma of caramel, herbs, earthy. Appearance: orange, hazy, frothy. Bitter taste. Palate: creamy, lively, bitter finish. A great trappist!

Reviewed from notes. 
This was poured into a chalice. 
The appearance was a nice hazy golden orange to light brown color with tints of yellow roaming around the sides of the glass. Theres a one finger white foamy head that dissipated within about a minute leaving some light lacing here and there. 
The smell had a nice blend of sweet citrus to spices of cinnamon, ginger, allspice and clove.
The taste was spicy sweet through the previously mentioned flavors. 
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a fairly decent sessionability about it. The carbonation was somewhat sharp but not overbearing. Nice spiciness rolled over my tongue. 
Overall, I say this was a pretty good Belgian pale ale worthy of having again.
Wild color and great taste. This beer is definitely worth trying and worth the price.

bottle. bottled 27/03/2014 from Raleigh Whole Foods. label says 6.9%. good aroma, sweet. fruity yeasty. get grapefruit and pear, with black pepper and cheese. cloudy orangy brown color, good head, that stays as a ring that clings on the way down. sweet flavor. Medium body, smooth creamy mouthfeel, dry sweet finish. its nice, aroma has range, jumping between the fruits and yeast. nice sweet flavor, nice dry sweetness on finish. gotta try to pick tis one up now and again....
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Bottled 01/02/2011, pours a dark amber with a retensive creamy head. Looks appetizing. Chocolate, cream, candi sirup, old apple; a soft but distinct aroma. Medium to full body (hey, this is a 6,2abv trappist) which is amazing. Soft and potent, aged in ideal situations, brings out an aging that rewards the patient with a creamy Orval from another - more tasteful - dimension.

Bottle. Cloudy amber liquid, big pale beige unsteady head. Medium body and carbonation. Taste of grapefruit, currant, black grapes, spices, a touch of honey. Wine aftertaste. Medium bitterness, light sweetness.
Amber colour beer with a huge white head that stays long. High carbonation. Smells fruity and sauer. Taste is also fruity, sauer, spice, citrus, hops very complex taste. Good trapist.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer & Beyond, Tel Aviv. Hazy amber with medium beige head. Aroma is yeasty, cheese, skunky and sweaty - but in a good way - banana, fruity. Flavor is as the nose - rich and complex, yeasty, skunky, light hoppy bitterness, notes of banana, spicy, light sourness. Full body, dry. Lively carbonation. Bitter aftertaste. Excellent.

Pours with a lot of head, smell is very strong, rosemary-like. Very pleasant smell, very carbonated, spikes the mouth a little too much and hides the full body. Slightly sour taste. Could be better bit not bad.
Uklar oransje farge med et hvit skum. Aroma av malt, frukt, gjær og sitrus. Smaken følger aroma, mye smak, sitrus og gjær fremhever seg. Høyt karbonert.

LOrval maximise livresse pour ses 6.2 pc dalcool  un contrat spécial entre les moines et Dieu ? Elle doit être apprivoisée car elle est austère et on ne laime pas nécessairement dès la première fois. Mais elle est le meilleur et plus réconfortant « retour à la maison » quand on a bu trop de choses diverses et quon sest un peu perdu en route. LOrval est avec les Gueuze la moins calorique du monde, et cest une bière dont on ne se fatigue jamais. Elle saméliore et devient plus forte pendant deux ans et ses amoureux ne veulent pas la boire âgée de moins de six mois. Chaque bouteille porte la date dembouteillage.
The Orval maximises drunkenness for his 6.2 pc of alcohol - a special contract between the monks and God? She must be tamed as she is severe and she is not necessarily loved from the first time. But she is the best and more comforting «return at home» when too many various things were drunk and we got a little lost under way. The Orval is with the Gueuze the least caloric of the world, and you never get tired of this beer. She becomes better and stronger during two years and her lovers do not want to drink the Orval whithin her six first months. Every bottle bears the date of bottling.

~1.5 year old bottle into Trappist glass, dirty rusty-amber color with fluffy light tan head. Aroma of white pepper, grass, spices (cinnamon, clove), citrus, light fruit (apricot, berries) and light brown sugar. Taste adds notes of caramel, wine, dried fruits (raisins, figs), green apple, slightest sour funkiness and bitter earthy hops. Light body, heavy carbonation, dry with slight earthy bitter finish. Very tasty Belgian Ale, light body and very flavorful. Excellent.
séche, équlibrée, complexe, particulière (fumier), addictive, je la conseille en fin de dégustation si plusieurs bières (sauf si une autre orval du même âge ou plus est disponible)

Drink cold (8-10°C)
Eye: copper brew with white to beige thick head with medium sized bubbles. Nose: Hops, citrus fruits and sweet yeast. spices as well.
Mouth: hoppy, spicey and some sort of dried fruits perhaps some sort of apple.
Palate: very complex long finish but dry at the same time... very complex.
Overall: very nice hoppy beer which ill drink again sometime.

Refreshing and easy to drink when very fresh, but the bretts take over the taste after a year +. I prefer it fresh. Amazing head. Its so good that they run out of this beer many times per year in Belgium. Even when aged, the alcohol stays discrete. My favorite trappist.Try it fresh at least once in your life.
Hou ouder de Orval hoe beter zei mijn vriend die een bierkenner is...En ik zal hem gelijk geven

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2014 Bottle from Magasin du Nord, Copenhagen, DK, 6.2% ABV. Bottled on 18/02/2014. Pours an off-white to beige head in a sound of popping bubbles. When it settles, it leaves a hazy amber liquid with medium to high carbonation, and still a large, irregular head with big bubbles. Aroma is intense, hoppy, slightly yeasty and fruity. Once past the head, it tends towards more spices, still with plenty of hops and some fruits, and a bit of sweetness too, although it is definitely on the dry side. There is a little more in the aroma that I cant identify, some sort of apple pie with cinnamon on it, but not exactly. Palate is fizzy, otherwise quite medium. Long bitter finish that turns sweet after some time.

I have never seen so much head in a beer before, despite pouring it carefully I got only head first. Probably due to a bad sample or batch, who knows? Anyway, this weights a lot in the final rating, I guess otherwise it would be a very good beer, with a very complex aroma. I will try to have an other sample at another time.

Bottle. Golden orange pour with a thick off-white head that lasts until the glass is empty. Delicious notes of sweet fruit, a little apricot and spices, plus the distinct brettanomyces yeast. A little bit of alcohol warmth with a medium body and a dry finish. Very nice, and different from most Belgian Trappist ales.

It is a superbeer, one of my all times favorite. The subtle funkiness caused by brettanomyces is the most interesting part of its complexity. The first time I had it I hated it, so if you do not Luke it, try again.

In some previous tastings this trappistes beer was enough better. But it continues yo have something special and taste. Very good appearance and ruch foam. Mild taste of caramel and maybe a sweet wine.

33cl bottle from Cora Mesancy, Belgium - served chilled well below the 12-14C as adviced by the brewery. Poors dark amber hazy with small white head. Lots of aromas: Belgian yeast, hops and earthy-spicy with nice bitternes that fades on the finsh.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2017 Oh, Orval, how shall I describe you? When someone asks me how Orval tastes, the only reasonable response is "It tastes like Orval." It has such a unique flavor, there is simply nothing comparable. This beer truly is one of the greatest drinks in the world.
 
Previous formulations of this rating:
Alright, I have to go for the 5 here. I have decided I should use the full scale if the experience is worth it. If I had to pick one beer to drink for the rest of my life, itd be Orval. Its always a surprise, always reliable and just amazing. Its got hops, its got bretts, its got a perfect soft foamy mouthfeel - "moussierend" as one would say in German. And its always awesome, and so unique. 

Nice hazy orange color. Some hoppy citrus fruits in the nose. Dry and fruity on the palate, proper bitterness, with a slightly sour finish. I usually go for the Quadrupels when drinking Trappist beers, but this is better for the summer, surprising and great!After having had this more often:This is a timeless classic. Every beer is a surprise and every bottle is different, depending on the age. One of my all-time favourites.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2014 Ambrée orangée, limpide, faible-moyenne carbonation. Magnifique petite mousse blanche persistante "effeverscente".
Arôme fruité et épicé. En bouche dabord aromatique agrumes, épices. Caractèrielle en arrivant en fin de bouche, forte amertume venant dun coup puis disparaissant peu à peu au même temps que le sècheresse arrive. Fin de bouche incroyable.

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Norway, on order- abv 6,9. Deep orange, hazy color, good foam. High aroma intensity, fruity, orange, very nice yeast influence and very light hops. Medium body & medium / high complexity. Good bitterness, some sourness, balances well. Very enjoyable

Bottled on Jan 23, 2013. Drank July 31, 2014. Huge rocky head that quickly collapsed. Light orange and very clear. Horse blanket, clove, bubble gum and apricot aroma. Floral bitterness with sour fruit taste. Subtle sweetness masked by high carbonation. Finish is very dry. Body is light to medium light towards the end of the bottle. The beer is a real tongue- lasher. Assertive and refreshing like club soda but with a complexity that beckons one back for another pull.

Bottle 033 L @ home, a year after bottling; pours dark orange with rich, creamy, good lacing and mostly lasting white head. Aroma is strong yeasty, fruity, pear, apricot, yellow/green grape. The flavor is sweet malty with a hint of brett funky sourness and moderate hop bitterness. Mouthfeel is a trippel like, dry at the finish and well carbonated beer. It is a quite simple, well balanced, enjoyable, refreshing and drinkable beer.

Couleur ambrée orangés avec une mince mousse blanche. Au nez un liquide complexe laissant ressortir des levures belges, des fruits et des épices. En bouche levure belge, agrumes, épices, un petit coté sauvage ressort ce qui nest pas désagréable. Un petit coté metallique aussi ressort ce qui enleve quelques points. Un liquide qui se boit très bien. Corps moyen et Carbonation moyenne.

Color: clear dark amber beer with small carbonation and high ivory foam. Smell: sweet candy notes, with brown sugar notes. Sour notes and nice malt presence. Taste: nice sour sweet taste. Brown sugar and candy presence. Good equilibrium! Nice beer but not easy drinkable. The complexity of sour sweet taste can be difficult to drink. Aftertaste: nice balance of malt and sour notes. Really amazing beer !!!
Yeasty smell. Pours a massive foam. Settles to a muddy amber color. Strange sour feel on the tongue. Pine taste, hints of honey.

@ Nedre Mölla 20/7-14. Bottle from Kihoskh, Copenhagen. Aroma: Yeast, fruity, clove. Taste: Yeast, fruity, touch of clove(?). Body is medium, the finish is very dry and rather bitter with notes of spices (touch of clove and cinnamon?).

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2016 27/02/2015: Bottle at home (bottled on 05/11/14). Beautiful slightly hazy, reddish orange colour, off-white creamy head. White wine-ish character in the nose and taste, dry, quite sour with some distinct fruity tones like white grapes and citrus, spicy and nutty yeast, light but sweet malty base. Textbook brett-ale. Dry finish, earthy too. High carbonation with prickly mouthfeel, good body. Most complex Trappist out there, great ale. 

05/02/2016: aged bottle at home (bottled 19/08/2014). Rounded in sourness, but still fruity; quite musty, earthy, dry, bitter in the finish. Lively carbonation.

19/07/14 - Aged bottle (2010) @ Kulmimator, Antwerp. Amber colour, just a little hazy (no particles), big off-white head. Taste and nose became rounded and soft, very much down on sourness, with a more earthy, spicy yeasty flavour emerging next to caramel sweet malty groundtones. Low carbonated, good body (though a bit watery), soft mouthfeel. Very interesting drink.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2015 33cl bottle served in a Trappist glass. Pours a wonderful light amber colour with a perfectly foamy and voluminous off white head which lasts the entirety of the drink. Aroma is somewhat subdued but faintly aromatic; the taste however is a perfect balance of flowery hops and candy sugar sweetness but somewhat overdone on the brett. A very unique Trappist.
Precioso color y espuma, maltosa pero amarga y con un ligero dulzor que no se empalagoso como en otras belgas.
Gros col, orange brumeux, sens le printemps (herbe mouillé), gout un peu sucrer et amer et pamplemousse mais pas du tout dans les extreme dune ipa, un peu sec. Bien équilibré.
És una bona cervesa, tot i així, de les trapenses és una de les més fluiexes en quant a sabors.
Wonderful Leafy aroma, dark orange pour. Great balance of dry citrus and leafy hops! Refreshing with zest and bold flavor
Bottle. Cloudy orange colour with white head. Brett, fruity, apple aroma. Sour, fruity, sweet, apple, citric taste. Medium body.
Very juicy and fruity beer! Smells like muscat grapefruit. Cute bubble and sweet tart!

Very nice pop from the bottle as uncapped, clumsy poor left fair bit of head but it appears to be a highly carbonated energetic beer so not all my fault I feel. Great look, big airy white head that laces the glass superbly all the way to the Finnish. Beer is a warm orangy colour. Aroma of lemon rind with a slight vinegar sour yeasty presence. Little hints of sour, lemon rind as the beer is sipped. Was expecting a big sour yeasty saison like punch in the mouth but was pleasantly surprised at how approachable and easy drinking the orval was to drink. Very nice.
Hazy amber. Full bodied, slight bitter taste with malt, spices and pepper. Great belgian trappist!
Aroma perceptible, espuma persistente, extremadamente seca y amarga, very nice!!

Bottle. Amber/orange color with huge fluffy head. Aroma is a little bit strange - notes of pepper, dry fruits and citrus with something like a smoke or rubber. Interesting, but not mine. Taste balanced, bitter-sweet, full-bodied. Aftertaste is long-lasting and bitter.

Appearance: Hazy amber with billowing beige head.
Aroma: Mineral, woody, hint of leather, prune, feint citrus notes, peppery and floral undertone.
Taste: Low sweetness, medium bitterness and low/medium sourness.
Palate: Thin coarse texture, light/medium airy body, average carbonation, lingering dry, peppery, slight citrus, slightly acetic, yeast finish, with light alcohol.
Comments: Tasty and glass lace.
Sandal wood and coffee on the nose - fantastically balanced aromatics. Full, long, classic Belgian trappist taste!
Bottle, pours a coppery color with an off white head, slight bitter taste with malt, citrus hops, and spices, has a dry alcohol finish to it, good beer
UPDATED: JUL 22, 2014 Bottle 33cl. Seraf. Pours hazy orange color with large white head. Aroma of licorice, bubblegum and toasted malt.

Bottle. Hazy dark amber with off-white spongy head, faint roasted malt aroma, smoky taste, medium carbonation, longish finish with an aftertaste of caramel residue. Finally rated one of the 6 greats after tasting it so $any years ago!

Cerveza de color naranja intenso. Resulta muy compleja tanto en aromas como en sabor. Destaca la malta con notas frutales que recuerdan a manzada ácida y hacen acto de presencia y es muy protagonista la levadura de bretanomices que le otorga notas rústicas que recuerdan a establo y animales. El lúpulo se hace presente sobre todo después del trago y es ligeramente persistente. En boca es ácida y agria y el retrogusto astringente. Excelente representante del estilo pale ale belga.

Bottle from the LCBO, 10 months old. Cloudy brownish orange colour with monstrous head. Really fizzy, active bubbles everywhere. Smells of citrus, herbs, yeast, bread, funk, molasses. Reminds me of prosecco a bit. Taste is the same with a nice hint of bitterness here. Somewhat tart, and a bit astringent. Flavour comes in waves.

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2014 ASPETTO: ambrato abbastanza limpido. Schiuma persistente (ne rimane sempre nel bicchiere) e abbondante, con grana non molto fine, dal colore giallognolo molto chiaro.
AROMA: bel connubio tra fruttato (frutta gialla) e floreale, con accenni di resinoso e luppolato. 
GUSTO: leggermente e abbastanza gradevolmente acidulo, con note erbacee e luppolate, ma si avverte anche una certa speziatura. Chiaro, persistente e gradevolissimo retrogusto di crosta di pane.
CONCLUSIONE: Birra di carattere, ma che non mi ha particolarmente stupito.
Pours clousy amber with frothy lightly tanned head. Aroma is slightly sour with pineapple. Taste is balanced, some sour balanced with sweetness from malts. There is also a roastiness. A complex beer.

Különleges jellege már a kitöltés során megnyilvánul, gyönyörű, dús hab koronázza a borostyánszínű testet. Illata nem kevésbé magával ragadó: citrusfélék, narancs aromája kényeztetik receptorainkat, melyek krémes jelleggel kiegészülve az ízlelés során is jelen vannak egészen addig, míg a komló el nem foglalja helyét, és a nyelvünk tövére nem ül. Ezek az ízjegyek aztán felvérteződnek némi karamelles-mézes aromával, mely csodás egyveleg az utolsó kortyig ellát minket ízélménnyel.

Farmhouse funk and wet dog pervade the nose and initial taste here. This is edging towards the sour end of the spectrum. The initial bottle pour unloads a vast foamy head that settles into a slightly cloudy, amber looking toned ale. A classic Belgian ale, which rewards you for your persistence. Could be daunting if you have not delved into the trappist world.

Bona cervesa, equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, equilibrada y sabrosa.
Spicy, metallic aroma. Lots of fluffy white head and a dark, cloudy amber colour. Smooth carbonation. Bitter, off fruity taste. Not my style of beer.

What can I say that hasnt been said about this beer? 
Its awesome! Try it!

Aroma: fruity hops, apples, cider. Appearance: dark gold, big white frothy head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: bitters turn to sours, cider notes again. Overall: OK Belgian Ale, not liking the palate too much though. Bottle at The Old Fountain, Old Street.

Probably my least favorite Trappist. Pungent smell. Cloudy tan color from bottle sediment. Sour, almost a Gueze. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle in Orval Glass. Pours a beautiful large creamy white (minimal beige reflex) head which thickens to a stable level; hazy quite dark orange colour, look like bright amber. Very nice and yeasty, pungent, biscuity, sour, cherry and fizzy aroma. Taste its initially a bit sweet/sour and fruity, followed with lots of yeast, biscuit and spices flavours. Adorable sour, spicy and refreshing finish, with a very small amount of bitternes. Medium body, quite creamy texture and quite lively carbonation. Sooo much Saison hints here. Beautifully characterized by the yeasts and the sourness, makes almost a genre of its own. Very nice
floral, cereal, pale, white foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, bitter,
Amber color with fluffy white foam. Fresh hops herbal aromas, medium body. Excellent balance. Long great hoppy aftertaste. Love the Brett.

Pours a little darker than a typical blonde with a thick, creamy head. Classical belgo blonde ale aromas with foam bananas, yeast, nice maltiness and a light bretty scent in addition. Flavour is fresh, malty and fruity with a light hoppiness. Refreshing and very tasty. With a little more body this would be quite close to perfection.

Aroma: A heavy nearly pungent smell. A fruity acidness. Much promising.Appearance: This trappist is orange/copper a bit hazy with yeast remains in the bottle. A very large head that recedes rather quickly leaving some lacing.Taste: The taste is full of bitter notes and a refreshing sour stamina. Goes very well with a fat cheese.Palate: A strong carbonation is also giving a refreshing feel.Overall: In all it has some resemblance to geuze (and that is not bad!)Note: bottle Reviewed 2010-01-09.

Aparência bem bonita. Creme grande, bem espumoso e de coloração bege.
Liquido de coloração marrom claro de leve carbonatação.
Gosto final com leve amargor.

Enorme capa de espuma blanca, persistente y deliciosa. Esta cerveza tiene complejidad aromática y de sabor como muy pocas. Ácida, agria, dulce y amarga a la vez. En el aroma se nota la levadura espontánea, ligeramente ácida con un toque afrutado. En el sabor tiene una entrada ligerísimamente dulce y final amargo y muy seco, se nota el lúpulo. Muchísima personalidad en una botella preciosa. No es para todos los públicos precisamente, a algunos le puede oler a calcetín.
11.2oz bottle. Amber color with thick white head. Sugar cane and fruity flavor. Slight alcohol. Lovely beer.

This hard-to-find brew tends to be a sweetheart among many in the craft beer scene. I can see why. The hazy yet effervescent amber shade and white foamy head are awesome. The aroma provides the first clue to the brews complexity. Bright yeast notes, sweet malt, hop aroma of grass, and a pungent hop aroma like the other kind of grass... The flavor is balanced quite nicely. The slightly sour yeast taste blends well with the smooth malts. The moderately bitter hop taste is clean and fresh but very dry. Suffice it to say, this Belgian gem lives up to the hype. Good thing, too, since its only getting more difficult to locate and more expensive to buy.

Bottle.

A- Citrus, funky, weed.

A- Dirty orange color, cloudy liquid, off white head.

T- Citrus, lemons, slight funk, spices, balanced.

P-Medium body, average texture, high carbonation, crisp finish.

O- Drank in tribute to Walt Powell Memorial day. Had about a year of age on it. Cant say it lived up to expectation for me, but it certainly wasnt bad. The aroma smelled like weed to me, which was surprising.
Amber color with dense white foam. Bitter and fruity aroma. Strong taste, with sweet malts and citrus. Dry, bitter and alcoholic finish, with caramel and hoppy notes.

Big pillowy head with great retention. Smell is yeasty but surprisingly light. Good mouth feel, dry, hoppy...it's good, but hoppier than I generally expect from trappists. yummy, and surprising.

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10

Flaske 0,33 liter fra Fakta. Dufter ok, lidt kraftig, men ok, ser flot ud i glasset med det høje hvide skum og den kobber farvet øl, smagen er god, sød og kraftig på samme tid, rammer bredt og god konsistens, eftersmagen kunne være bedre.

Very highly carbonated with a tall frothy head. Aroma is pretty light, all yeast. The flavor is very dry with some geuze and champagne character. The hops seem to just make it even more dry. It has some of the pepper and spice that you would find in a golden ale or saison. An interesting beer that combines a few different Belgian styles, while remaining very unique. Seems strong for the ABV. A tiny hint of lemon for tartness. Classic beer, cant wait to cellar a few bottles.

The aroma is fruits, wine, a little yeast; not very strong and not very lasting. Pours hazy, sparkling, slightly brownish orange with an enormous and extraordinarily durable head. The taste is barely bitter, a little bit sweet, a wee bit sour, and definitely spicy with a hint of some kind of je ne sais quoi  rancid? Light bodied, fizzy, bitter-tart-ish finish. Very Belgian, if one likes this kind of thing.

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2015 Bottle. Pours a dark brown / orange hazy color. Aromas are dried citrus fruits, oily fish (sardines), yeast, raisins. Taste: Fruity sourness, blood oranges, little creamy in between, aftertaste is slightly bitter. First tastes have a hint of copper. A little peppery as well. Quite refreshing.

330 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy orange colour with a huge, long lasting off-white head. Sweet flavour of citrus fruit, malt, yeast and cinnamon with a dry bitter finish. Medium body, oily texture and soft carbonation. A world class beer.

Couleur ambrée trouble, bonne mousse beige. Super nez fruité (jaunes et raisin), petit peu vinaigré, acidulé. Super gout (complexe) de malt, houblonné, fruité, note de levure, note de citron, bien balancée acide amère. Fin ronde en bouche de bonne levure, amertume legère et longue... note acidulée

Poured from an 11 oz bottle with a bottle on date of roughly 1.5 years ago. Hazy straw color with a pillowy head full of large bubbles that lingered for a long time. Aroma of funk and farm that is really enticing. Very high carbonation, maybe a bit higher than I prefer as there is a bit of a burn on the tongue. Taste has minor fruit notes and a bit more of that funk. Honestly, it's a bit understated. It's weird to 'review' such a famous beer. I really dig it but it still isn't my favorite Trappist.

I found that this Belgos rep is quite blown up. It isnt by any stretch a bad brew, or even just an okay one, it is alright. I just dont get it I suppose, and I have had it in Belgium from the tap as well as in Canada in a bottle. It looks like youre in for a big treaty when the murky dark orangey ochre with its frothy peak calls you forth. The somewhat sickly syrup festival ensues as you think "this aint gonna be no easy drinkin tonight". Basement mustiness, bananas, alcohol, couch drops, vanilla, rotting cherries, caramel, dark roasted malts and resin all hail your nose and tongue. This is not paradise youre in my friend, its purgatory, where the beer is not your favourite style and it is potent in both taste and alcohol.

Pours a cloudy amber with a root beer float head that lasts for days. Tons of carbonation. Nice aroma of fruit, hay and a touch of funk. Tastes of grapes, apples and yeast. The brett adds a lot. Medium light mouth with some crispness. Just a very flavorful and well-balanced beer.
Cherry, yeast, and rotten citrus aroma. Taste of honey and dusty cellar floor.

I personally didnt think this would be rated so high, but oh well. Had a nice dark roasty fruit smell to it. I wasnt a huge fan of the taste, kind of like molasses and bananas. The aftertaste made it hard to go back for more.

Slightly hazy amber pour with medium head slowly fading into thin layer. First impression for aroma....banana. Some spices too. Somewhat acidic first taste, fading to a nice bitter hoppy aftertase. Again banana is quite present. Thin to medium mouthfeel with medium to high carbo. For me, okay trappist. There are better out there.

Pours a golden orange color with a very thick off white head. Clove, banana, spice, yeast, fruit and malt aroma. Spice, banana, clove, apple, pear, yeast, citrus, funk and malt flavors. Medium body and lots of carbonation. Spice and fruit finish.

Uma cerveja única. Cor âmbar dourado, creme alta, fácil formação e duradouro. Aromas que remetem notas de couro, pinho, especiarias; no paladar trás um amargor suave equilibrado com a acidez, que forma um retrogosto persistente, vináceo, longo final seco.

Bottle, 330 ml. Pours cloudy deep orange with significant light tan soapy head, with good retention. Aroma of sweet biscuit malts and sweet fruits, some citrus and apple notes. No hop or alcohol presence. Much more hop presence in the taste, which provides some earthy, floral notes not present in the aroma and a satisfying level of bitterness on the finish, overtaking the sweeter notes of citrus also present. Fair bit of alcohol, surprising for a 6.2. Mouth feel is initially watery but seems to improve as the temperature rises a little. Overall more refreshing perhaps than other trappist beers Ive tried but flavour wise theres more notable brews in this style out there.

It pours a hazy orange/brown with a thick creamy head. Nice floral aroma with a funky yeast and citrus notes in the bouquet. The Belgian yeast imparts a wild and funky flavors. It is somewhat tart with a citrusy and floral hops. Flavorful and complex, refreshing and effervescent. Medium body and a smooth mouth feel. Tart dry finish that leaves you wanting more

Bottle. Mine said 6.9% ABV but I am under that impression that the ABV varies with this product. Dark yellow/orange with massive cloudiness. Head is in ATTACK mode. Jebus Kripes! It takes forever to die down and when it does it leaves a frothy lacing on the glass with a floating scoop of french vanilla ice cream on the brew. Impressive!! Aroma is perplexing and hard to describe: fruit? Liquor? Sugar plums? Anyway, its really nice! Flavor is simplex yet complex. Fruit, caramel, liquor, wine. A full minute after the swallow there were flavors I hadnt experienced yet exploding on my palate. Rarely is aftertaste felt on the front of the tongue instead of the back in the throat. Bitter hops and sour whatever in the front and back but not in the middle. Not a slammer nor a sipper, but this is all around fantastic! WOW!!!!!

330 ml bottled on 04/12/2012, 6.9% ABV. Wee gusher, hazed orange copper, impressive cumulus mountain of off-white foam settles slowly and does not inhibit the spicy yeasty earthy hoppy aroma. Taste is bitter and tart, lots of yeast, faintly fruity at times, some dirty farmyard funk, woody and dry. Lively carbonation, fuller bodied. moderately hopped. I saved this for my 1,100 rating as a treat, and must say was quite disapointed, IMHO its nowhere close to a Chimay or a Rochforte, I am vexed by the reverence held for this brew. DNFL (Definitely Not For Lagerboys)
Thin body, white grape, some citrus and white grape, apple notes. Slight bite, pleasant and well rounded. Simple but very enjoyable.
Hazy golden colour, dry finish with candied tartness on the palate, dried fruit sweetness
UPDATED: JUN 10, 2014 Cloudy amber with white head. Quite short. Vague honey on the nose. Not really my thing.
Golden / amber very cloudy with powerful white head. Aroma: vinegar, fruits, bitter, unique. Taste: vinegar and apples in the end. Bitter. One of the best trappistes belgians style.

Dark amber body with high frosty head, visible high carbonation. Aroma is so typical for Orval, that specific spicy yeast with tones of caramel and malt. Taste has caramel sweetness with toffee character, followed by high earthy spicy bitterness. Body is full, very high carbonation. This is a very interesting brew for aging.

(Drinking date: 3 May 2014) (I drink a bottle of Orval which is bottled on 6 November 2013, so 6 months ago). Sweet, fruity aroma (strawberry?), also with a sourness, and something like sweat and hay. Surprisingly a very lovely aroma! If the aroma was more intense, I would have given 8 out of 10. The beer looks hazy darker orange with a small layer of foam. The taste starts bitter and sour, and ends with a subtle sourness. All the way through the beer there is a subtle sweetness. Pretty nice but not outstanding. But, really lovely taste! The mouthfeel is good: not too watery body. Medium carbonation. It feels very dry in the mouth, which I less like. This beer leaves a long-lasting dryness in my mouth. Overall, this is a strange (or special) beer. This is not a one of a kind-beer, so thats good. It is a nice and special beer, and I like it! Strange aroma which is actually pretty nice, and a special, not common taste (the slight sourness). So overall this beer is pretty good! So I give it the total score of 3.8!

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2014 From a bottle. Dark amber with a medium off-white head. Aroma fairly mild, faintly citrusy. Distinctly bitter taste with hints of spices (cardamon?). One of the nicest Belgian Trappists. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a hazy orange. Aroma is slightly sour fruits. Taste is surprisingly bitter and sour for a Trappist beer.

White grape, wine aroma. Crisp, thin body. Woody, smokey flavor with some citrus and white grape, apple notes. Slight bite, pleasant and well rounded. Understated but confident. Deceptively simple. Extremely pleasant experience.

330ml bottle into a Trappist glass; served cool.

Aroma: Kind of a bubblegum-y, dried fruit. A little sour aroma coming off.

Appearance: This beer has a hazy, rust-colored body. This beer has a massive, billowy, white head. This beer leaves a thick lacing.

Taste: This beer has dry apricot notes, as well as a very mild sour touch. This beer has a bit of pale, bitter hop bite. This beer is boozy.

Palate: This beer has a medium+ body. This beer has a high amount of prickly carbonation. This beers finish is long and ends on bitterness.

Overall: Quite nice. A wide range in the flavor profile, and the bitter notes set it apart from other Belgians Ive had.
Bottled in Ibis bar in Gent. Yeasty spicy aroma. Dark cloudy caramel color. Some acid and bitterness in a few taste. Good trappist.

Really reach foam, at least in my glass. .. The aroma is quite specific but I dont know exactly how to describe. The taste is weak, much weaker than what I thought when I drank it for the first time. Quite citric as well in my opinion.
grass, leaves, mild aroma,amber, cloudy, frothy, white foam, medium body, creamy, fizzy, abrupt finish, this is an anymans belgium lacking true taste or flavor not bad but definitely not good

Bottle, 7 months after filling. Pours orange/amber with a huge white head that diminishes to a thin layer. Aroma: overripe white grapes, balsamico vinegar. Taste: figues, currants, apple, spices, pear, lots going on thats hard to identify. Little sweet, slight sour and nice bitter. Smooth mouthfeel, medium body. Long lingering finish. This just different, hard to identify, super balanced, and oh so lovely.
Mooie lichtbruine kleur, niet veel schuim. Aparte geur, hoppig, niet erg lekker. Smaakt goed, beetje zuur, droog en bitter. Smaakt ouder dan 6 maanden beter dan een jonge, maar ben er niet weg van.

Botella de 33 cl en barias ocasiones durante la época belga. La ultima en agosto de 2012. Después de todas ellas aun no se si me gusta o no esta cerveza. Cuerpo medio con 6.2 vol y color rubio cobrizo. Sabores ácidos y ligeramente amargos, junto con mas que aun no se si para mi mas o menos bien combinados. Necesario repetir de nuevo esta cerveza tan peculiar.
Impressive foaming, delicious taste and nice smell. It's especially good when you drink it in front of the lake in Orval monastery.

Nice Belgian Trappist Ale, with very dry palate and high hoppy influence. The strong flavor masquerades the alcohol.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle to a snifter. Pours a copper, amber gold with substantial frothy off white head and lacing. Aroma of Brett barnyard funk and dark fruit. Flavor is complex, dark fruit, toffee, toasted malt, dry tart finish. Very satisfying.

Toffee coloured, with huge soapy head, which sticks around to make it feel interesting in the mouth. Smells tart, and sour fruits continue with the taste. Overall dry and bitter, with lots going on; brown bread crusts and many more flavours that I couldnt identify.

Bouteille de 330 ml (6.9% alc.) achetée dans une SAQ. Embouteillée le 29 avril 2009, dégustée le 4 mars 2010. Bière orange brûlé voilée, tirant sur le caramel. Mousse énormément, col très très épais, genre meringue, très persistant. Très belle apparence, col spectaculaire. Extrêmement effervescente, bulles fines, Odeur dépices marquée, de fleurs parfumées. Très forte, un peu sucrée, peu amère. Goût assez âcre, sèche en finale. Saveur (pommes vertes?) un peu surette. Un peu décevante, plus belle à voir quà déguster. Très bonne mais pas comparable aux meilleures belges.

Pours hazy orange, huge thick, off white head. Aroma big brett character, horse blanket, leather, sweet malt, bubblegum in the background. Taste slight earthy bitterness, brett character as in the nose, tart, slight tropical fruity esters. Mouthfeel on the thin side, job l high levels of carbonation, tart, very dry finish. Overall a great experience, drinkable, yet complex, all flavors blend extremely well.
UPDATED: JUN 15, 2014 Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle at home. Dry, spicy, tart and tangy. Takes some getting used to but ultimately a satisfying tasty beer.

Pours a clear coppery amber with one frothy finger of persistent off-white head and heavy lacing. Nose is brett funk and sour, Belgian yeast and tart fruit against a malty background. Taste starts bitter, gradually giving way to dark fruit and malt, lingering citrusy hops. Mouth feel is light- to medium-bodied, with a dry finish.
Not quite perfect - the taste is initially on the thin side until both thermal and alcohol heating combine to bring out the flavour. Definitely not to be drunk cold.

Drank out of goblet.

Aroma: quite faint, would maybe be more noticeable in a tulip, smells a bit of rubbing alcohol and yeast

Appearance: huge amount of head, good lacing, apricot colour

Taste: kind of dissapointed by this one. Was expecting a big belgian fruity flavor but didnt get that. Notes of tart cherries and rubbing alcohol

Palate: highly carbonated and thin

Overall: not how I remembered this beer, just doesnt compare to the other belgian selections
Ottima birra trappista. Tripel atipica con punta acidula che la rende unica nel suo genere.
Highly carbonated, hazy orange color. Slightly bitter. Gets better as it warm up a little.

0,33 l bottle. Bottled exactly 13 months before. More foamy head than beer in the glass. Uncloudy light orange. Sour hopy on the nose. Starts bitter fruity. Later hopy bitter, with sourness. High carbonated. Don´t expected such a sour beer under the flag of Trappist.

Little hazy orange beer, medium head that stays a long time.
Aroma is spicy and cidery.
Tastes little like dry apple cider. Some earthy notes.

I find myself again at odds with a few people. This has a huge aroma on opening, but then I found that, for me, it was too sour and cider like, and thin on length, and not a lot of depth. BUT this does not make this a bad beer just one that I might not be in tune with

Pressie from Essie. Poured big head. Cloudy as I poured in the yeast.... Smells great. Tastes great. Not as out there as lots of Belgians. Really like this beer. Could drink lots in one sitting. TASTY!!! Tasted at 6.2%. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours cloudy orange with big head. Aroma: funky, fruits, some cherry, grass, wood. Generally quite pleasant. Taste is funky notes and nice herbal bitterness. Complex and interesting beer with good drinkability.

Bottled on 6/27/2013. 

Very loud hiss upon cracking the cap. Color is light amber and hazy. Head is composed mostly of large bubbles, but doesnt dissipate at all. 5 minutes in and the head is still as large as when it was poured. Aroma is reminiscent of a sour, with some funk, citrus, breadiness and apples. Taste is different from the other Belgian ales Ive tried. Slightly sweet and that barnyard funk is in the forefront. Some oakiness and bitterness, as well as some citrus and apples. Heavy carbonation cleans your palate, and mouthfeel is on the light side of medium. Very complex and enjoyable beer.

From 33 cl bottle, 6 months old. 
Sweet fruit aroma, like sweet summer fruits. 
Pours clear amber brown with slightly off-white foamy head. Lots lasting. 
Sour apple. Eathy malts. 
Light bitterness and light sweet. 
Watery texture, light carbonation.

Poured into Trappist glass. Cloudy, bronze colored with frothy 2 finger white head. Smells grassy and fruity. As the beer warmed, it tastes a slight sour fruit with malt and slight hop taste to it. Medium, low carbonated palate. Ok beer for me, could of been better.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0,33 l. nice, unique bottle. Extreme carbonation, hazy, light orange colour. Huge, white, fluffy head. Sophisticated aroma with hops, yeast, wine, ripe fruits some wood and barnyard. Pleasant, herbal bitterness, delicious mild aftertaste, present soft sweetness. Great body. This beer is complete and drinkable though.
UPDATED: APR 24, 2016 @ Röhällavägen. Flaska från Systembolaget (26:-). Syrlig och fruktig, jäst och kryddor, Brett-toner, rejält torr och ganska besk. Avslutningen är torr och besk.

Bottle from my local giant eagle. Can't believe I hadn't had this one before. I was pleasantly surprised. I normally don't like Trappist beers but this one is a bit different. Pours a cloudy golden orange with a full white head. Aroma of funk and grass. Taste has a slight tang and finishes dry. This one was 9 months old at the time of drinking. Very good.

Mycket oklar, brun-orange (sand färgad) med ett stort, lätt brun färgat skum. Doft: Funk, äppel källare, gräs, ute dass, söt trä doft. Smak: Funk, lite syrlig trä smak, gräs, torr franska, jord, citrus skals beska, brända frukt kärnor.
Bottle. Pours hazy orange color with large white head and nice lacing. Nose and taste is funky and sour.
This ale has so much carbonation it is actually hard to drink...at least the two I had did. The flavor, after the initial carbonation is great however

Bottle. Pours hazy dark orange/golden color, lightly beige head. Aroma is bit sourish, berries, yeasty and spicy. Taste is fruity sourish, berries, quite higher carbonated, medium bitter, yeasty, some cinnamon.

Beer has quite odd sourry smell, which caught me by surpirse. White had is thick and lasting. Nose gets filled as a result of high carbonisation. Nice fruity aroma. I wasnt a fan of these kind of beers, until I tried this one.

La confrérie des Tastebières de labbaye dAulps, assemblée en son chapitre de printemps le 5 avril 2014 a confronté lOrval, la Zundert, la Rince-Cochon et la Avec les bons voeux de la brasserie Dupont. 
La trappiste Orval a reçu la note totale de 2,95 décernée par les 17 confrères présents ce soir là. Ainsi soit-il.
Fresh sour smell. Quite well carbonated. Taste is sour, dry, some malt body and some hops though most of the hops dissappears in the sourness.
Bottle. Light amber colour and thick lasting white head. Nice aroma, floral and fruity. Taste is hoppy and druity. Very nice.
12oz bottle at CRBC. Pours a pale brown color with a lot of head. Dry and slight funk.

Bottle. Good, but not nearly as good as I had expected. Hazy dark blonde, fine solid head. Nose of yeast, peaches and honey. Quite tart to begin with, but mellowed nicely as it warmed. Flavours began to stretch their wings. Stone fruit, brown sugar. Fine and dry.

Aroma: Unusual aroma unlike any other beer, Fresh, Herbal, Wild Green fruits
Appearance: Clear Amber liquor, off white head, Nice Lacing, Medium-High Carbonation
Taste: Maltey, bitter, acidy, Hops, Earthy, Grimey
Alcoholic kick
Dry aftertaste
Reminds me of Chimay Red
First time tried tasted more malty.
Not a fan
UPDATED: APR 15, 2014 Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en La Birra. Color ambar. Sabor a levadura. Muy carbonatada.
Amber with nice head. Aroma yeast, hay, grass. Taste dry yeast, grass, hey. Body medium. Carb high, text carb. Finish dry. Reminds of a saison.

A sweet fragrance of sherbert, then a rich christmas pudding aroma. The colour is of dark marmalade. The taste is fairly weak but with a yeasty peak, a bitter aftertaste on the back of the tongue. Its texture is fairly slick, and the kick of alcohol is fairly strong. A reasonably pleasant beer but not my favourite Belgian brew.

UPDATED: SEP 4, 2015 smells slightly medicinal, like cloves and even camphor; fizzy, highly carbonated, fits nose and taste, which is clean, crisp, delicate cloves again, then a slight and dry bitterness, lingering on. Re-rate 9/15, bottled Christmas Eve 2012 (those monks!) and kindly shared by bartlebier. nose: sublime tartness, some woody cidery aspects, beautifully decomposing mirabelles on moist farmyard ground, and some first whiff of ripe fruit laden autumn air, distant silos where the summer grass is fermenting, balanced by clean clove and camphor; taste: nearly overripe wild strawberry on top, descending into mineral, muddy, nearly dusty earthy aspects; clean clove as solid counterpart; sublime honey/pollen near-aftertaste. Wow.

Pours an orange amber with an inch of perfectly even bubbled light tan head. Good lacing, head has staying power, thick collar at the edges. Aroma is of aged hops, earthy funk, citrus, and some dark cherry. Very effervescent and bubbly on the tongue. High carbonation, light to medium body. Fun to drink. Taste is grassy and earthy in a dry funky kind of way, with some floral and earthy hops.
A very pleasant and not too sweet beer that can help you when thirsty and enjoy you when you just want a quiet drink.
Off-white big head. Amber color. Smells of yeasts and hops. Yeasty taste, hints of cannabis, candi. Dry and bitter.
12oz bottle pours a bit of a hazy orange with a large white head. yeast and bannana aroma. taste is the same with a bit of a bitter finish.

Poured from bottle to glass. Not terribly big on certain Belgian offerings, but wanted to try this. I was plesantly surprised. Hazy amber color with big head (maybe I poured too fast) and nice lacing. Some earthy yeast noted in the smell along with citrus of some orange and lemon. Taste was yeasty with hints of the citrus. Nice and dry and a hint of bitter. Full body, thick, nicely carbed. Overall very solid beer that I would drink again.

Trappiste ambrée, 330ml, 6.9%. Un immense collet qui ne veut pas partir. Très effervescente, houblonné, âcre, acide, un peu sucré, alcool, florale, pamplemousse, orange. Sèche. Un punch d'effets en bouche.
Pours a hazy amber colour. Head holds its shape for a long time. Good aroms and easy to drink.
Bottle, pours dark and hazy orange, off white head. Spiced apple aroma, sweet and sour. Bursts of carbonation with each sip, nice tartness and semi dry finish.

bouteille de 330ml de brune. arôme très complexe de fruits tel pomme cerise, mélangé à des notes de bois. En bouche on a une bonne amertume, mais pas trop persistante balancé par une acidité moyenne.
très intéressant comme produit!

Cerveza trappista belga. La definiria como curiosa, la he tomado en Belgica i en Barcelona y lo curioso es que en una ocasion el sabor era mucho mas amargo que en otras. Quizas era mi paladar. Es una cerveza excelente pero hay que estar acostumbrado a cervezas amargas o en una primera cata puede hechar para atras. No aconsejable a bebedores de Corona
very nice spicy aroma... the taste is malty and dry... hoppy bitterness is rather noticeable... very dry aftertaste...

Pours light amber, hazy. Looks great in its own chalice. Has a thick aroma, yeast and fruits also there. Taste feels something like lambic at first - with some bitterness and apple juice. Apple juice that is still fermenting. Aftertaste is more on the dry and hoppy side. Very versatile, great example of the style.

botella 0.33cl espuma muy abundante que va desapareciendo, color ámbar oscuro cobrizo y turbio. aroma complejo, donde resaltan las levaduras, la malta, un toque de manzana, algún fruto seco.. en boca es rotunda destancando el amargor., según he leído puede variar mucho de una botella a otra. en concreto esta no es de mis trapenses favoritas

Bottle, 0.33l. Hazy orange amber color with large rocky white head and excellent lacing. Aroma of yeast, barnyard, wine, orange peel and lemon. Taste starts with moderate sweet and sour spicy malt, follows by yeasty and fruity acidity, while finish is moderate bitter. Full body, thick texture and lively natural carbonation in palate. I remember draft version a bit thicker and even better than bottled...

Troebele trappist. Is redelijk bitter met hoog koolzuurgehalte. Dit zorgt ervoor dat je de diepte in de smaak niet goed kunt waarnemen. Op zich lekker maar uiteindelijk toch beetje teleurstellend (thuis).

(Bottle 0,33l @ Picollo (Opava)) Bottled 07.01.2014 - Tasted 21.03.2014
Aroma : Sweet, some wood, spicy.
Appearance : Cloudy dark golden color. Huge, long lasting white head. 
Taste : Stone fruits, medium sweet, spicy, light sour.
Palate : Full body. Light fizzy. Long astringent finish. 
Overall : Interesting, distinctive, not for everyone.

At my place from a bottle (obviously). Pours florescent murky orange. Aroma is tart, Brett envelopes my face, it is has a big noes with subtle complexity to the Brett character. Taste is very smooth nice Belgium fruitiness that is not offputting at all, Brett bite with very minor tart notes. Finish is very long and stays even keel throughout. Very nice interesting lighter beer.
Kopparfärgad med stort vit skum! Riktigt grymt skum! Doftar jäst och kryddor. Mycket kolsyra fruktig smak körsbär och banan! Mycket god!

Het schoolvoorbeeld van een trappist. Best lekker maar met weinig inspiratie. De lange afdronk en enorm bittere nasmaak geven het bier echter wel karakter. De fruitigheid wordt overheersd door de enorme bitterheid.
33cl bottle from abbatia.pt, aroma is sweet, taste is medium bitterness, palate is hops with medium body, creamy, lively carb, bitter, with good finish. nice ale overall

11.2 oz bottle. It has the aroma of bread and spices with a funky barn yard smell. It pours a murky dark golden color with a massive and long lasting white head. It is very dry and malty with a strong hop bitterness. I taste some spice, maybe cinnamon and coriander along with a hay, resin and a earthy taste. This is really a phenomenal beer. Its a privilege and rare treat for me to drink something this good. The bottle was high quality and heavy so Ill be sure to reuse that for my home brewing.
High carbonation, light caramel colour, very dry slight earthy hoppy presence, no distinguishable malt, No rounded yeast flavors, lacks complexity, pretty boring, dry and disappointing

Spicy clove and some sharp citrus on the nose, big lasting head with large bubbles,dark gold in color. crystal clear. Light toasty malt, no noticeable hop flavor, firm bitterness. Theres a spicy clove phenolic flavor and some funky barnyard flavor. Medium to high carbonation, light body, there is a sharp acidic finish.
Uma trapista diferente de todas as outras. Excelente formação de espuma e ótima retenção. Sabor intenso, com notas que lembram oliva.

Slightly hazy orange brown with massive creamy off-white head. Slight funky, pine, lemon, fruity, herbs, light burnt sugar and a bit of brown bread. Taste is a great balance between tartness, sweetness and long bitter finish. Medium bodied with creamy feel, quite dry. Amazing balance And complexity. A personal favorite.
Une très bonne brune le houblon est dosé parfaitement quand cette dernière est bien fraiches cest juste parfait.

jasno-miedziany kolor, mętne, potężna biała, długo utrzymująca się piana. zapach słodki, lekko bananowy i drożdżowy, może lekko skórzany, po grzaniu ziemisty. bardzo mocno wysycone. smak z początku słodki, ale od razu przechodzi w chmielową goryczkę, również lekko alkoholowy. mocno wytrawny i lekko kwaskowy.
Een lekkere trappist, met een lichte bitter en een hint van fruit. De aanblik is schitterend in het ervoor bestemde glas.

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2016 Orval mixes frank aromas of ripe banana, gingerbread with lemon persistence in mouth, light but powerful. However I am a bit disappointed by the taste but this is only because I want a perfect beer. A must-drink beer !
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein leicht trübes bernsteinfarbenes Bier mit ordentlicher Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, malzig süß, leicht würzig. Geschmack leicht hefig, fruchtig malzig, Gewürze, blumig.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2017 Medium sour aroma, orange and lemon peel, lots of yeast, spicy, hoppy, even little bit grassy. Medium hazy golden color, huge white head. Lots of spices, fruity, sourness and sweetness are battling dominance, slightly wine-ish and cloves with dry finish. Heavy and sparkly carbonation, thin to medium body. Very enjoyable.
Roasty, sweet at first, long bitter aftertaste with exchanging tastes. White firm head, amber color.
A hazy amber beer with a big white head. The aroma is yeast, overripe banana, and bubblegum. The flavor is the same but with a dry, bitter, hoppy finish.
Bittersweet symphony. Caramel coloured body with nice white head. Little to medium carbonation.

Hazy amber body with a ridiculously huge head that leaves a lot of lacing on the glass. Quite unusual nose with peppery and spicy notes accompanied by an odd sour yeasty scent. Taste is quite bitter and spicy with a long strongly dry finish. Carbonation is very high with loads of bubbles forming on the tongue. The palate is medium. This is a rather unusual beer, might need a few more tries to really learn to appreciate it.
bottle dated 4/15/13 so 10 - 11mo. old which I would think would be right for me. it was ok and will try again to see what I am missing - yeasty aroma - many things in taste and it combined well

Color ambar anaranjado, translúcida pero homogénea. Espuma blanca ahuesada que forma una cabeza vigorosa de burbujas de tamaño medio. Aroma cítrico, a hierba y levadura. Seca, ácida y dulce con un moderado regusto amargo. Cuerpo medio-ligero, buena carbonatación sin resultar excesiva con una agradable permanencia en boca.

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2014 Cloudy orange color, big off white creamy and uneven, staying head. Medium body, soft carbonation. Aroma is spicy (coriander?), hops, citrus, grass, yeast, malts, banana. Medium sweet, light bitter with dry finish. Very nice. Unfortunately, little bit thin.

DATE TASTED: February 21, 2014... GLASSWARE: Chimay 125th Anniversary chalice... OCCASION: prepping for Wills 7th birthday party... APPEARANCE: dark cumulonimbus, Everest-like white climbing head--three-fingers edge out of the glass; medium amber body; hazy lacing continues throughout the drinking experience... AROMA: bright, sugary yeast wafts with slightly pungent, earthy grass and raison; grapefruit and pear are present...PALATE: light to medium-bodied; easily drinkable and lengthy aftertaste--one that is desirable...TASTE: sweet candied sweet hops pucker the mouth; pear and apple make for a perfumed blend, supported by a surprisingly hearty malt base--balanced and pleasing... OVERALL: alcohol adequately masked,, this Trappist deftly hits the bliss point---malty/hoppy/yeasty/fruity in equal turns; only regret is waiting nearly a decade to revisit and review the "pearl in the fish" labeled brew...
UPDATED: NOV 27, 2016 Bière d exception, grâce à son amertume de jeunesse et sa complexité au delà de 6 mois. De l arome au palais, tout est d une exquise maîtrise...

30cl bottle sampled in a trappist glass. Amber colored brew with a large head that you can get much higher than the glass if you pour it right. High retention and leaves much lacing. Aroma of caramel, yeast and spices. Tastes bitter and dry with fruit, caramel, hops. Dry mouthfeel with high carbonation. Lovely beer all year round which improves with age for a couple of years.

Pours an amber/copper with substantial head that does not dissipate. Smells fruity, funky, and spicy. Taste is nicely balanced between grainy malts, decent hops, and some brettanomyces funk. Finish is slightly sweet but the ultra high carbonation dries it out substantially. Mouthfeel is perfect. Overall a unique and impressive beer.
Quizás un poco carbonatada de más. .....pero gran cerveza. ...me ha encantado conocer su Abadía! !!!!!!
Nice amber color and good, long lasting white foam. Very pleasant aroma of leather, its very dry, bitter and a bit sour. One of our best.
UPDATED: NOV 5, 2014 Amber color, huge foamy white head. Very particular aromatic smell. Ultra dry beer, very hoppy for a trappist. High carbonation, long dry finish. Unique beer.

33cl bottle (With the typical Orval bowling pin appearance)
Appearance: Hazy amber with a huge allmost white head, leaving nice lacxing.
Aroma: Yeast, fruit, caramelised malts, slight sourness and a hint of bread
Taste:Sweet but dry caramelised taste, which goes over in a fruity finish with some bitter and sour notes. Nice and unique and it develops over time in a nice way.
High carbonation,medium body, oily texture

Pours hazy amber with a big, thick, slightly off-white head that fills up the entire glass and lasts forever. Aroma of sweet and yeasty malt, banana and mild roasted malt. Taste of dry maltiness, sourness and a bitterness towards the end. Probably the best beer Ive had.

Pours amber brown with a thick head. Smell yeasty and a bit leathery, small inputs of banana. Taste upfront of some banana and then a perfumy harsh bitterness which reminds me of an old washcloth or perfume, maybe even bad hop extract (?) very one toned, and the perfumy taste overtakes the yeasty banana instantly and makes this not very pleasent. Plus for mouthfeel.

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2014 Bottled 11/28/13. Hugely carbonated; the head fills up the glass within seconds of pouring. Dry, peppery aroma; red wine, tannins. Dry smooth flavor; malt, yeast with a hint of tang.

Good Belgian Ale, really good Trappist beer, dry, with good bitterness. Aroma is fruits, some sour and little alcohol. High carbonation, great, long and beautiful white head. Hoped it will be more wild and sour, but still it is a nice beer.

Absoluut één van de toppers uit de trappistenfamilie. Amberkleurig bier met rijkelijke schuimkraag, zeer romig en vol in de mond. Ietwat bitter maar zeker ook aromas van abrikoos, perzik en banaan. Niet te vergelijken met een ander bier, dit bier heeft zijn eigen karakter. Love it or hate it.

In my opinion the best Trappist beer. It has a hazy, goldenbrown color. With a broken white colored head that lasts forever. You can smell some fruit, caramel and a slight sourness. The taste is uncompareble with any other beer. It has a nice malty dry taste with a slightly sour after taste. Wahat makes this beer even better is that the taste really evolves during the months (or even years) youre keeping this in you personal cellar. A beer that should be on every mans bucket list.
