Hazy brown color, off-white head. Very interesting aroma of dark malts, caramel, flowers and cherry. You can also smell some sour notes. Taste is heading more into the malty direction, followed by spicy and fruity notes. Dry character compared to regular trappists, well-balanced bitterness.

I have to be really quickly!

I have heard about herds of Chinese buying this beer as much as they can. And they can I presume. Because what else do you need in a new world order. In my favourite café, they somtimes whine and argue the Orval is not on stock, and that is a little, little bit bad.
Because this is a beer you dont want to miss. It is one of my favourite ones, almost a champagne like beer, and if you keep it longer it will get better with time. Most of the Orval are served within one to twelve months after the production date, well here in Holland. But I think after the Chinese had a thought about it, that might be just six months maximal.
I wonder what the beer will cost in China, because here the prices are going up as well. For a Belgium Ale (Orval) I have to pay way more then 2 Euro 30 I think. Just crazy, and in the cafe more than 5 Euro and 70 cents something!!! I am in Belgium almost every week, and I know the production of Rochefort, Westfleteren and Orval is not that much aside, and I pay reasonable prices there. I know a café that only serves Orval from the tap, and the entire cafe smells because of that. But I leave that cafe with a Burgundy thought and my wallet still filled with my hard earned money!
About the beer; to the Chinese, thank you for unburgundy me! For the brewers, I still can get a hold of your beer, and I love it! In my top three togheter with Rochefort and a brewery the Chinese dont want to know about. Champagne like, dry aftertaste bla blah, hints of happy morrocans and dryed asfalt :P It is just a beer, but a darn good one!

Sour, floral, lite sweetness aroma. Hazy golden orange with a lot of head. Not sour but has a twang in the taste. Hops, bitterness, and it is on the dry side. Heavy carbonation. Had this years ago and do not remember liking it, but this time it taste pretty good.

Lighter than other Trappist. Pours hazy golden with nice head. Interesting aroma - flowery and orange. Has a fizzy citrus taste and dry. Almost champagne like. Very enjoyable and seemed to get better with each sip. Was bottled in July 13 which made less than year old. Hope to bottle a few to see how it ages. One of my top beers

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

One of the best Trappists, Orval provides a great balance between spices and fruitiness. With a light and complex aroma, this beer offers a unique taste that makes it stand out against similar style beers.

This beer is proof for Gods existence. There is no other beer like this in taste, aroma, or quality. I have no idea how it can be replicated let alone approximated. The aroma is a pleasant combination of funk and fish. The palate is dry, thirst quenching, and almost sandy. It is a most interesting beer. I struggle to describe it. It is its own style. Sui Generis. It continues to be excellent.

Bottle bier huis ossett. Hazy orange colour frothy white head slight lacing. Aroma is hoppy. Taste is. Some orange and peppery spice some sweet malts and good hoppy dry bitter finish well balanced. Good body great mouthfeel tingly carbonation. Really good this one so easy to drink could down pint after pint.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2014 Fruity and spicy with some real (non-us hop) bitterness to it. This is one of those beers you either love or hate, and i love it! Update (2014-03-22), bubble gum, pineapple, coriander, strong citrus. One of a kind. Still as good as ever.
Orval taste like orval ..you can notting compaire whit this beer.its a beer with a typical taste .

Jai goutté à Bruxelles et à Québec, et étrangement, à Québec jy ai trouvé une jolie touche acidulée, augmentant le plaisir gustatif. Collet crémeux, pétillant fin, robe dorée foncé, nez un peu floral, goût agençant dabord quelque chose dun peu caramel, sucré, suivi dune amertume, floral, léger, et terminé par un suret tirant la langue. Au final, cest une bière plutôt sèche, quelque peu arrondi par le sucré et le floral décrit plus haut.
Bonne bière! Devenue trop peu disponible malheureusement mais reste un plaisir à la dégustation! Encore une bière victime de son succès!

Pours a hazy honey-brown color with a big fluffy off white head. Good lacing and retention.Aroma is sweet with caramel, toffee. There is also some biscuty aromas with floral notes. Also there is some green apple in there. Taste is of caramel apples and some spicy molasses. Medium mouthfeel, quite rich and creamy, with a lighter bitterness on the back end and lingering flavors. Very good!
Creamy white head. Dark copper color. Medium body. Dry. Bitterness. Not that sweet.
Bottle pours amber with big head and carb. Aroma is light spice and piney hops with a slight funk. Taste is dominated by the Belgian spice and funk with a dry bitter finish.

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2014 Diverse Flaschen (33 cl). - Darjeelingfarben-rotbraun, leicht trüb; reichlich sahniger beigefarbener Schaum, der bis zuletzt hält. Unbeschreibliche, typische Orval-Nase: etwas muffig-kellerig aber dabei frisch und frech, Pfeffer, zarte Olivennote. Im Antrunk scharfe, trockene Hopfenbittere, die an keine bekannte Hopfensorte erinnert, ohne versöhnliche Süße oder Fruchtigkeit. Erst später nimmt man die leichte, keksartige Malzigkeit wahr. Mild rezent, weich und schlank. Kräftig hopfenaromatischer Abgang, langer Nachtrunk. - Enorm hopfenaromatisches und -bitteres, schlankes Bier, eher untypisch für ein belgisches Trappistenbier. Unterliegt stärkeren Schwankungen je nach Abfüllung und Lagerzeit - manche Exemplare fand ich recht mild, manche fast zu extrem gehopft.

There is perhaps no more uniquely distinguished beer than Orval. The brett aroma and flavor mixed with the deceptively light body and the champaign like effervescence end with a very dry finish. just an amazing beer

0,33L bottle, bottled on 30.07.13. Pours hazy amber with nice white head. The head stays. Aroma is intense fruits, sourness, citrus, yeast, grapes. Taste: fruity, sour and sweet, some nice bitterness thrown in, a lot of grapes, malt in the background, alcohol is little bit too noticeable. Finish has decent bitter kick and nice alcohol burn. Overall: nice complex beer, but tastes little bit too "fresh". I would really like to try aged version.
UPDATED: MAR 26, 2014 Spicy sweetish aroma. A head that just doesn?t disappear and a smooth slightly acidic taste, a bit sour but quite pleasant. Slightly toasty malt flavour.

Bottle dated September 18th 2013. Pours an amber/copper with substantial head that does not dissipate. Smells fruity, funky, and spicy. Taste is nicely balanced between grainy malts, decent hops, and some brettanomyces funk. Finish is slightly sweet but the ultra high carbonation dries it out substantially. Mouthfeel is perfect. Overall a unique and impressive beer.

Bottle 33 cl.
Beautiful amber, with a tan, long lasting head. Fresh and delightful nose, with nice citrus. Very good and full mouth feel, with well balanced carbonation. Medium sweet taste, with some nice bitters in the finish. Truly a love at first sip. Definitely one Ill drink again, and soon. This must be re-rated to confirm that I wasnt hallucinating. 

Music:Radka Toneff  Before Love Went Out of Style
Pours a slightly hazy golden amber with a thick white foam. Has the aroma of yeast, bubblegum, and hops, Has a bold flavor of Belgian yeast, hops, and yields a very dry but robust flavor.

February 5, 2014. Bottle from LCBO. This is probably my favourite beer overall. Lovely funkiness every time I drink this beer. Interesting beer that can have a completely different character after several months in the bottle, or longer. Biscuit, straw, citrus in the aroma and flavour. Lovely golden colour with a huge white head. This is a very lively beer and requires a bit of skill to pour without having the head dominate the glass. Thanks to Dave at beerbistro many years ago for introducing us to this beer, it quickly became a favourite!

poured from bottle into a Belgian glass.

Aroma: mouth watering sent, the resin hop aroma lifts the fruity sent and earthy tone from the yeast, amazing, so much here.
Appearance: a cloudy cidery color, about a 27 on the SRM is my guess with a gorgeous half inch white head, yummy AND NOW!!!!!
taste: A medium bitter beer, slightly salty with a good earthy tone. Im trying to find the sweet fruity flavors that Ive came to enjoy in most Belgian trappist ale, but I think its just to young. Im noting to look into tannic with beer? It is still very delightful though.
Ugami: Well there is that sweet apple like taste that lights up your mouth and makes the beer slightly sour. perfect finish and what I was looking for in the taste, well done!!!!
Just took my first overall sit back drink, wow!!!! well put together beer.... bitter at the beginning, but over the top and then the sour apple finish that lingers slightly in your mouth. Nice
33cl bottle. I was at first surprised by its fruitiness. Its full of flavour and it has quite a kick! Not the beer I expected, which in this case was a good thing! Great one!

Bottle. Pours hazy amber with huge off-white head. Aroma of citrus friuts, barnyard, white grapes, grapefruit with great funky notes. Medium sourness with nice medium bitterness in finish. Medium body, high carbonation. A bit creamy on palate. Great beer.
aromas of honey , citrus, and flora. appear cloudy golden with a frothy head. light sweet and medium bitter taste. oily texture, and a medium bitter aftertaste.

LOrval est une bière trappiste belge de fermentation haute, brassée à labbaye dOrval dans lancienne commune de Villers-devant-Orval en province de Luxembourg (Belgique), à teneur unique en alcool (5,2%). Si on laisse reposer la bière un an en cave, le volume dalcool peut monter jusquà 7,2%. Ainsi, sur létiquette de la bouteille, le volume dalcool indiqué est de 6,2%, la valeur intermédiaire. Elle se caractérise par une amertume assez forte (45 à 50 unités IBU); elle gagne en complexité après maturation en cave pendant quelques années, debout, à labri de la lumière à une température stable comprise entre 10 et 15°c. La température de service idéale est comprise entre 10 et 12°c. Je la déguste volontier dans sa 4ème année de cave. Santé!

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2014 Out of the bottle, which was 10 months old when I bought it. Huge thick white head, dark coppery color. The aroma is heavenly, orange citrus and yeast are easily detectable. The flavor is clean, dry and leaves very little after taste. Hoppy, but perfectly balanced. It is overall, one of the most delicious and well crafted beers I?ve ever had. It is a perfect example of the style. The monks who made Orval were clearly showing off.
als je het twee jaar in de kelder laat rijpen, is dit het beste bier dat er is, dan komt er een heel lichte toetd van banaan in voor

Bottle at GCB. pours cloudy yellow in a trappist chalice with a 2cm white head that stays the whole while. Aroma is grain, sour-dough bread and yeast. Flavor is grass, grain, mineral dust finish. Lightly tart. Dry. Light on palate and thin with fine, moderate-heavy carbonation. A delight to drink. This grew on me as a drank, and was much more enjoyable than when I last had it three years ago. Delicate and complex.
Poured from bottle. Faded copper in appearance. Nose is funky, with hints of human sweat. Taste is dry and flat. Not a lot going on. Thin

Trying to slay the classics available locally. Massive off white head with a golden brown body. Aroma is rich... Dark fruits, white wine, grapes, toffee. Taste is toffee, caramel, definite fruitiness to it but I cant put my finger on it. Complex and rich, yet super dry. Great beer!

8 mois : robe ambrée avec des reflets roux, haut col de mousse persistente et cremeuse. Nez dherbes, de candy et de de citron. En attaque légère acidté, amertume assez sèche moyenne. goût épicé et herbal. Forte carbonation. 8/5/7/4/14

A: Dark amber, lively Belgian carbonation cloudy. S: Lactic acid, some funk, light barnyard. T: Sweetish start, some hop bitterness. Almost no funk in taste, hints of acid. Bitter Finish. M: Medium highly carbonated. O: Very nice.

Bottle. Nose is floral, herbal, lemon, candy floss and belgian yeast. Taste is herbal, clove, bread, slight lemon balm a little mint with a dry hoppy finish with very slight sour tones. Mouthfeel is slick.
Best beer ever. Wait until the beer is 10months old because then its perfect. More taste.

Poured from a 330 mL bottle. Colour is hazy apricot-brown. Huge beige head that lingers. Generous lacing. Aroma is hoppy with pungent grapefruit notes and hints of lemon and pine. The mouthfeel is crisp. The flavour is brimming with dry hops with subtle sweet malt in the background. It is pleasantly bitter from start to finish, but especially on the finish. This was not what I was expecting from a Trappist beer but yet I was a nice surprise.

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2016 06/22/2015. Bottle, 33cL. 1.5 years old. Opening : bang !! A sparkling brown orange beer with a huge white foamy "omelet-like" head ; great retention. Fruity aroma (citrus), herbs, acid, wood, pancake. Light to medium sweet  ; light to medium bitter ; light sour lasting. Medium body, silky texture, average good carbonation, sweetsour finish, light herbal. Overall, a fantastic beer which changes through the time. 

01/26/14 33cL, (beautiful) bottle. 8-10°C. Bottled on 04/09/2013. 4-5 months old. A brown earthy hazy beer. Large light beige foam, very persistant. When the white crown is finally sinking, its not homogeneous so you can see a messy landscape. I love this ! Aroma is intense with resin, herbs and fruits (more acid than sugar ones). Great balance between bitter (heavy), sweet (medium), and sour (medium). Medium body and texture. Bitter floral finish with sour notes. Overall, an excellent beer. Taste is amazing. Please wait 10 minutes or more if this beer comes from the fridge. 8-5-10-4-19.
 
1/31/2015. Bottle,33cL. Home. 4 months old. Same appearance. Brett aroma, cider, apple, herbs, resin, fruit. Medium sour, medium to heavy bitter, light to medium sweet. Medium body, silky texture, good carbonation, sour bittersweet  finish. Overall, I enjoyed it a lot but more like a sour wild ale than a saison. Interesting. I will have to taste it again ! : 5-8-8-4-17

Large off-white head, holding, over nearly clear bronze amber beer. Medium plus aroma intensity of mature fruit, honey, yeast, bread, dried flowers and herbs, spices, something vinous. Medium bodied on the palate, maybe medium plus carbonation but fine-bubbled. The far distant sweetness stays very dry, the bitterness is medium plus but dominant in a rounded way. There is citric acidity and the smooth carbonation which makes the palate more tactile than flavourful, low maltiness only a backdrop. The finish has great length, with the bass bitterness holding until the end. It is great.

Citrusy, herby, ginger aroma (my wife disagrees and thinks it smells like wet leaves). Cloudy but bright appearance. White lacey head. Grapefruity taste. Full bodied. Refreshing. Overall a great beer.
UPDATED: FEB 1, 2016 Fresh bottle. Hazy amber, stable airy offwhite head. Yeasty, slightly funky aroma. Fruity, yeasty flavour. Orange with light funk and a mild hop bite. Long dry finish. Good.
Frisk och syrlig. Den drar åt ciderhållet snarare än vad de flesta tänker på som öl. En upplevelse.

11.2 oz (bottled over 9 months ago) from the Argonaut, poured into my stemmed Funkwerks glass, 6.9%. A bit of foam oozed up and lingered (didnt spill) over the rim of the bottle before I even poured it. Dark orange, amber appearance with a huge off-white head that slowly diminishes and leaves some lacing. Great aroma, tart tropical fruits, Belgian yeast, herbs, banana, earthy, zesty, barnyard, spicy hops, grapefruit, citrus, floral notes. Similar flavor, wow, simply incredible. Medium body, crisp and tingly with carbonation, smooth and pleasing with a lightly tart, lingering dry finish. Incredibly drinkable and still complex. Unfuckingbelievable!

Bottle 23/01/13. One year old today. Dark yellow pour with a huge foamy head. Aroma is Belgian ale. Strong spicy yeasty. Taste is the same. Belgian spice lots of it. Yeast. Has the clove and banana but really harsh yeast kinda covers it up. I know this is one of the classics but I am not enjoying it.
Very good trappist beer. Kind of orange color. Hoppy aroma. Drank in a trappist glass
A singular, exceptional brew. Definitely one of the best of its style and possibly the best Trappist. Dark and rich with a surprising hop character.

Pours hazy amber with substantial head. Very complex on the nose, extremely aromatic. Notes of lemon, spices, nutmeg, basil, licorice. Taste is complex as well. Licorice , anise, peppercorn, fennel, lemongrass, fruity, floral hops, Brett tartness, super dry, touch of bitterness on the back end. The most complex beer I've had. Goes really well with chèvre. Amazing.

A few bottles over the years. Theres a lot of dryness and a bit of bitter here. Has to be one of the better Belgians.

One of the kind, the most hoppy trappist beer and also the most intresting one because of its hard carbonisation. It has one of the greatest bitter finishes i have tasted in my life, not the bitterest one but the different one. In my top 10

Gran birra trappista! Provata con il suo bicchiere. Color rosa-arancione.Aroma di frutta matura.Schiuma cremosa e persistente.In bocca risulta essere veramente morbida.Gusto di frutta matura,liquirizia,spezie varie. Finale fresco e persistente. Tra le migliori del suo genere!!!

Bottle from Hop City in Atlanta. Poured into a pint glass (no snifter chalice at my Marriott.) Bottle about exploded when I opened it! Love it! Pours a slightly hazy golden amber with a thick white head. Most head lasts and some decent lacing. Aroma is both fruity (bananas?) and funk. I think one of the yeast strains is making it almost have a banana aroma. The taste is more like a saison style funk bag versus a traditional Belgian ale. Bread, cereal, funky yeasts, and a little fruit with a hoppy finish. Very tingling on the palette. VERY DRY!

Una delle trappiste più buone, è sempre un piacere trovarsela nel bicchiere. Equilibrata e molto ricca, trovo molto piacevole il sentore acidulo che connette limpatto dolce al finale lievemente luppolato, arricchendolo con note citriche molto invitanti.

Rating #913 - January 14, 2014. Trappist bottle from Co-op. Clear golden pour with a bubbly white foam that dissipates slowly. Aroma is a slam dunk of funk, great yeasty sourness and a lemony-pine sweetness from the hops. Palate is more of the same, great funky sour character, not lacking in sweetness and hop depth. Light on the malt character, but oozing with so many other interesting things. Fantastic trappist.
Was a little disappointed with this beer. I like belgian ales but this one is quite different. All yeast and hops from nose to taste. Dry finish. Not for me.

Aroma is bread, raisin, licorice. The body is a cloudy gold, with a thick off-white head. The taste is dry and lightly fruity. Lots of natural carbonation. My first Trappist beer, looking forward to having another!
Bottle, from Tolkiens, Zagreb. Just a bit sweet and fruity aroma. I could taste a hint of alcohol and didnt like that. Other than that nice one.

Pours a copper color with a distinct plum and raisin aroma. Taste is simple and dry. A dry grape flavor that dissipates quickly. The alcohol content is very well hidden. A slight bread yeast content in the aftertaste.
Bottle. Hops, citrus and lemon athe taste, with beautyful aftertaste. Easy drinking but too complex aroma! Yes...Its the aroma I loved.

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2015 Bij Arjan. Dik schuim. Heel klein beetje zurige lucht. Troebel donkerblond. Niet heel sterk van smaak maar wel erg lekker.

Herzien, omlaag van 4.0

Bottle into Orval glass. Amber appearance with a 1 and a half finger thick, foamy head which persists. Smells citrusy, tangy, lemony, hoppy. The taste is quite bitter, some carbonation, complex with pine and citrus notes. Every bottle of this is different! Overall, a really really nice ale.

Hazy dark orange with a massive head that won't go away before you finish drinking it--beautiful. Aroma is sour apples, barnyard, sour funk, noble hops. Velvety, spicy, and bubbly in the mouth. Carbonation really enhances the diverse flavors. Spicy, fruity hop bitterness. Tart and funky. Fruity and spicy (hints of black pepper). Orange and lemon. I could keep rambling but... a zillion contrasting flavors balanced perfectly. Perfect--yep, that's the word I'm looking for. Perfect.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

a beautiful foamy heads pops floral, sour and spice aromas with fantastic lacing .With complex aroma (I took a good couple of sniffs on this one) comes a surprisingly smooth and easy drinking. smooth carmel malt taste is balanced with hints of citrus and hops, leaving a fantastic aftertaste. a beautiful amber beer never to disappoint.
UPDATED: FEB 10, 2014 Moet dit bier beschreven worden? Na 6 maanden kelder is dit een referentie van wat goed bier moet zijn. De hardheid is verdwenen. De fruitigheid is toegenomen. Hemels

poured into a tulip glass

A - has a beautiful hazy copper colour that passes medium light and a big fluffy head that lasts forever! there is tonnes of lacing on the glass by the time im finished with it. great looking beer overall.

S - for me, this is the strong point of the beer. i am absolutely drawn in by the smell on this one. its hard to even put my finger on what im smelling because its all seems to mix so well together into its own smell. has a nice citrusy and floral hint off the top but its prime character is almost that of fresh wood. it smells sweet and savoury at the same time. definitely pineapple and fresh bread coming through. maybe some banana, cloves or coriander as well? all my favourites ;)

T -the taste leaves a bit to be desired after the incredible smell off the top, and also for a beer thats rated so highly in the belgian pale ale category. with that being said i did enjoy the taste of this beer as it seemed to have a good balance of hops and malt and didnt have any overpowering alcohol taste like ive found from a few other belgian pale ales. it is definitely a unique beer.

M - i was dissapointed with the amount of carbonation in this beer. i feel like if they toned that down slightly the flavours would come out a lot more (maybe why the head was so long lasting). however, the carbonation did make me burp quite a bit :p bringing out some flavours i may have missed (hopefully not yesterdays lunch) at the same time it goes down pretty easy once the carbonation dies down a bit

O - well i finally got to try the trappist beer ive been waiting so long for. i feel like the anticipation of trying it may have ruined it a little for me, but i still enjoyed the beer a lot. i picked up a few bottles so ill be getting a couple more tries at this one. not my favourite trappist, but hey, its better than a lot of whats available in my area so i wont complain. a trip to the monastery in belgium might help me enjoy this one a little more ;) great beer!

Hmm.. quite a disappointment. Ofc its decent and quality made, but.. I had so high expectations..
Nose starts with first surprise, its promising hoppy red/sour ale. Thou I get some mixture of malts, yeast, spices and hops. Usually I would say "wow.. what a nice bouquet". Now I wouldnt say that its poorly balanced or what.
dunno.. its maybe just one of the cases that I dont like that brew and thats all. Sweetish with hints of sour and bit bitter, quite dry finish. Not bad, but definitely I prefer other Belgian brews

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2014 Wow this is great! Smell is of sour apples, yeast and a bit of spice. Taste is a lot less sweet than I was expecting, quite sour and bitter and long lasting! I really like this beer, it is fantastic!

Foamy thick white head with strong aroma. Pours in the Orval glass with copper top and gold bottom. Body is thick. Taste also displays spices and lemon. Refreshing. Better at 8-10degC and my favorite Trappist in warm summer time.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

11.2 oz. bottle, that was bottled on 20/05/2011. Pours amber-orange with an incredibly frothy, white head that dissipates very slowly. Aroma is sweet with hints of orange and something flowery (lavender??). Taste is way more bitter than I would have guessed, based on the aroma. Medium body with a thin texture. Carbonation is average. Finish is dry and bitter with a bit of astringency. I had pretty high hopes for this beer, but overall I am disappointed. Perhaps I would find a "fresher" bottle to be better. Then again, the bottle says best before 20/05/2016, which is still 2.5 years away. So Im well within the sweet-spot age.
Really specific aroma, bit like old socks. Doesnt like the aroma. Spicy and bit fruity but harsh. Not fan of this beer, too specific for my taste buds.
aromats: paduse, zekje, beljgjis. garsha nav pietiekami izteiksmiga un niekals ka ir nohaltureets labs alus.

Pours a cloudy amber brew with a huge white head with very good retention, aroma is moderate sweet and moderate acidic with clove, guava, peach and yeast, medium bodied, flavor is moderate sweet, light to moderate bitter and moderate acidic.

Bottle from Hostel Uppelink (Ghent). Has a deep orange color, and a perfect white head, which doenst want to vanish at all.

Strong refreshing aroma of vanilla, some lime, yeast and spices.

Tastes bitter, has a refreshing touch, yeast, with a sweeter finish. Carbonation is pretty high, but not too present. Has a warm pleasant finish, gets into balance in the end (less bitterness).
Smells much sweeter than it actually tastes. Bitterness is very present at the beginning, sweet yeast and spices add complexity which results in a very adorable mouthfeel.

Bottle. Nose is floral, herbal, lemon, candy floss and belgian yeast. Taste is herbal, clove, bread, slight lemon balm a little mint with a dry hoppy finish with very slight sour tones. Mouthfeel is slick. A delicious summer beer that has something of the Saison to it.

Poured cloud amber brown. Really fizzy. Big bittnerness from the hops coming out of the massive foamy head. Malty aromas, high and rich. Brett notes from the yeast work with the hops to make a unique bittnerness and the mouth fills with bubbles.

Bottle. Pours hazy orange with a large off-white head. Sweet aroma with notes of fruit, citrus and spices. Moderately sweet flavor with notes of citrus, fruits, yeasty esters and light spices. A nice hop bitterness in the finish.
Orval vielli deux ans en cave offrant un goût des plus agréable. Meilleure viellie que fraîchement brassée.

Ble bare ett lite glass av denne da det meste havnet på bord og skjorte etter en fontene ut av flasken ved åpning. 
Uklar lys brun med lite hvitt skum. Fruktig banan, hvete, honning litt sur lukt. Smaker litt søtt og syrlig, gjær. Medium kullsyre, kort bitter litt syrlig ettersmak
From a bottle into duvel tulip. Tastes like dark fruit and a bit of black licorice. Color is great. Very satisfied with this wonderful beer. One of the best I have had.

Ive had this beer a few times and every time its slightly different and yet better. Love this beer. Smells of fruit and hops maybe some orange peel or grass. Poured into Trappist glass. Nice foamy, lingering head with lots of lacing. Orange amber color with some haziness. Nice light to medium taste with nice carbonation and a somewhat heavy bitter aftertaste. Kind of refreshing to me. Probably my favorite beer.

Dark amber color, lightly hazy. Thick and stable white head. Nose and taste are a bit challenging: strong forestal, earthy notes with some dark berry flavour (reminds me of strong red wine). Quite strong carbonation, very intense hop bitterness, lightly sour and metallic taste. Dark grapes again and a hint of cheese notes.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2014 One year round bottle. 


Look: Pours with big bubbly, billowy off-white foam, very sparkly (you can hear it). Slow retention, thick layer stays on top for the whole ride. Leaves some lacing. Cloudy dirty orange/brown with huge amounts of carbonation. A few yeast float around. Why not. 


Smell: It fills the room. Dried dark fruit - raisins, figs, slightly brandy-ish. Lots of funk, brett notes. Spice, cloves and sour. Fattening and complex.


Taste: Complex. Heavy farmhouse brett funk, leather but not off-putting. Spicy. Caramel sweetness, but hard to appreciate with all that excessive carbonation. Some metallic aftertaste, but not too much - comes and goes. Also moderate sour and hop bitterness in the aftertaste. Complex and interesting as fuck - not sure its my cup of tea - but it does get better every sip. 


Mouthfeel: Lots of crisp, aggressive carbonation - kinda hinders the overall taste. Medium body, leaves some coating.


Overall: A tough one. I do like the progressive complexity, the not too in-your-face brett character with sour notes, but the carbonation is silly and gets in the way. Still a massive beer, definitely a must try - some old-school shit.
Not much to say that hasnt been said about, Orval. It really is a wonderful beer, great aroma good head retention and a lovely taste with a lovely hint of apple in the aftertaste

Pours a hazy deep amber colour. Aroma and flavour of fruit cake. Also there are some vinous notes with apple and toast. Personally I find this a little thin tasting despite the full mouthfeel from the caronation.

Pretty yeast, charming bottle, extreme trappist flavor.
Fast stunnig effect, equate this with Rochefort 6.
Perfect fermentation.
But the yeast... ual! Divine!
I feel alcohol in all, but little quantity.

Belle bouteille de 33cl, en forme de bouteille de perrier, une fois dans le verre, une extraordinaire mousse, aérée et dense à la fois. Pour le goût, tout aussi aérée, je ne serais déterminé l arôme, en tout cas elle est extrêmement bonne et goutue. Une des meilleure que j ai goûté à ce jour.. Attention !! Il faut la botte pas trop fraîche....... 14 degres environ...

Bottle. Poured a hazy pale gold with a huge, billowing white head that leaves lots of scuzzy lacing. Aroma is tropical fruit, light funk. Flavor is apricot, maybe light apple, tropical fruit, quite dry, moderate bitterness, moderate funk, crackers and light malt. Amazingly integrated and balanced. No flavors out of whack. As good as the billing.
UPDATED: APR 25, 2015 Blonde pour with a huge frothy head. Fruity aroma. Taste of some light fruits and floral hops with a pleasantly restrained malt element. An excellent beer

33cl. Fles. Donker oranje kleur
 Witte schuimkraag en erg dik en langdurig! Eerste smaakimpressie : wauw! Koffie, koolzuur, bitterje. Lekker biertje!
Op fles van 33 cl. Donkere caramel kleur. Volle schuim kraag. Mooie afstemming van de smaak kortom een goed biertje

Massive head, cloudy orange and aroma of funky, bretty, and fruity beer. The flavour is much the same. Its a nice beer but not as grand as id thought before. Quite dry and a classic beer to try for Belgian style.

Aroma: Orange (peel), slight hoppy, bit of cheese, smells well balanced Appearance: Yellow, orange (glow), little hazy, clear white staying head, head was rapidly building while pouring, dense deck, big bubble frothy head, full lace Taste: Slight bitter, cheese, some little sweetness, grassy slight bitter aftertaste, good balance
Pours a gigantic head, light amber, typical belgian aromas but with added brett, slight aniseed and fruit, really nice beer!
Pours a golden amber with a giant off white pillowing head. Citrus, bretty aroma. Unable to describe, but just Delicious!
UPDATED: MAR 6, 2014 Une bière culte qui titre à un petit degré d'alcool. Belle couleur, arôme plutôt fade légèrement citronné. Bon équilibre en bouche. Un must à essayer encore et encore.

Bottle, poured into tulip glass. Hazy orange, with a vast, smooth just-off-whitehead. Aroma is earthy, leathery, subtly spicy, and citric. Taste matches this. Finish is complex and lengthy, and only a little bitter. Very dry. Soft carbonation. I can see why this is popular - its complex without being a monster.

Bottle into mug. Huge frothy head. Cloudy dark amber color. Aroma of licorice, bubblegum, toasted malt, lime, earthy yeast. Definitely one of the most complex and wonderful aromas in my experience. Taste of sour malt that quickly finishes a light bitter. Mouthfeel is fizzy, and lightly alcoholic. Overall, my first Belgian Ale, I like it.

Aroma: Traditional Belgian malt, Yeasty, Fruity
Appearance: Opaque dark amber in colour, beautiful 2 finger of foamy white head. Exceptional head retention. Great lacing. 
Taste: Lively carbonation. Citrusy start with a dry hoppy finish.

330ml bottle (bottled Dec 2012) into a Belgian chalice. Held onto this one for a little while, and found no better day than a ghastly blizzard and gale to open it. Pours a hazy amber with a fluffy, lasting white head. Earthy, farmyard aroma with citrus and hoppy notes. Light sour flavour with dry bitterness. Smooth, medium body with a bit of a bitter finish. Gorgeous.

Bottle from York Beer and Wine. Bottled April 2013, so 8 months old. Beautifully aromatic, with sweet, caramelised oranges to the fore. Theres a herbal, slightly medicinal edge too. Tastes dry, initially, and has more bitterness than I expected, before an almost minty sweetness trundles along. Im going to stick some in the cellar and see how they alter with age. Thats the plan. It may not work...
Very sharp dry and even a bit medicinal. Still pleasant though. Totally different from all others. Citrusy and actually hard to describe.

Hazy amber color with huge off-white head. Aroma is citrus , floral, some yeasty. Taste is hoppy bitter in start , floral and citrus too, dry with spices notes. Dry , bitter aftertaste. Very good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Orval var den enda trappistöl som jag hörde talas om som tonåring. Det som stod ut var den dåtida höga alkoholhalten. Idag uppskattas den för sin unikt strama beska toppat med de belgiska ölens breda arom, smak & eftersmak. Inte min favoritbelgare, men väl värd sin kost.
Brett funk, barnyard, oranges, citrus, pepper, woody, dry and grass. An amazing beer deserving all the accolades.

Cerveza trapense de color anaranjado. Espuma ligeramente cremosa. Gasificación media-alta. En boca el sabor es cítrico, con toque anaranjado. Se aprecian matices de sabor espaciado. El final es bastante seco.

Cloudy orange beer with massive fluffy head on top and lots of lacing. Aroma offers citrus and other fruits as well as zesty sour apples. Taste is sour and dry with peppery spiciness from the yeast and sour flavors, not fresh to me at all. High carbonation and medium body makes this easy to drink but still an disappointment.
Cerveza con aroma a pasas. Apariencia a ambar. Dos dedos de cabeza. El sabor es lijero y solo se siente al final. Amarga.

Cerveza con olor a pasas.
Muy amarga para mi gusto, color ambar 
Espumosa y deja el paladar amargo
trappiste très différente des autres, très sèche, citronnée, florale, amère, un côté biscuit. Un classique, qui vieillit bien en plus.

Pours hazy amber with a thick, fluffy head that retains structure and leaves tons of lacing. Aroma of cider, caramel, lemon, funk, slightly earthy, slight lactic acid. Taste is bone dry up front, almost immediate herbal hop flavour with a crisp finish. Long, spicy-herbal hop aftertaste.

330ml bottle bottled on 22/8/2013.
Pours a murky caramel with a two finger, slightly off-white head that is very bubbly but has huge retention. Moderate amount of carbonation rising from the bottom of the Trappist glass. 
Aroma is noticeable. Notes of candy sugar, yeast, some tropical/floral hops, and a touch of spice.
Taste starts out intensely hoppy with a touch of candy sugar then mellows into some bready/caramelness and citrus notes at the end.
Medium body with a medium-high effervescent carbonation. A but slick in the mouth but still refreshing. 
Overall nice. A lot hoppier than the other Trappist beers Ive had but still nice. Would try again but it isnt what I think of when I think Trappist. Interested in letting some bottles age for a few years to taste the difference.
Pours with a huge frothy head. Cloudy amber colour. Fruity notes with a bit of lemon and spice.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2014 Bottle @ home. Pours with an orange, hazy colour; very large, frothy, mostly lasting, white head. One of the best heads I have ever seen. Aroma is moderate malty, with notes of bread, moderate hoppy, with some notes of citrus, and moderate yeasty, notes of leather and light notes of barnyard. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter, light sour, light salty. Medium to full body, creamy texture, average carbonation.

Appearance: Hazy, golden radiance with pillowy, white foam -thick enough for angels to rest their heads. Aroma: vinous, earthy, lemon zest, damp wood, pepper. Taste: As dry as champagne. Acidic. Long, bitter finish. Spicy, Belgian yeast. Slightly sour orange. Palate: Very high carbonation - explodes into foam on the tongue. Overall: Funky angelic.

Láhev 330 ml. Aroma je znát po exotickém ovoci, připomíná mango. Pěna je bílá, s lehkými odstíny hnědé, jemná, mohutná a drící. Barva samotného piva je opálová a lehce kalná. Chuť má silný říz, ve středu silný ovocný nádech, koření a to ve končí ve středně hořkém, příjemném, drícím finii. Jedná se o vskutku excelentní pivo s jedinečnou lahodnou chutí, vynikající pitelností a krásným aroma.
Bottle in Belgium ... A nice beer but nothing particularly amazing to make it a 99. Rich flavour and smooth palate makes this a definite winner... History of this beer does add

Cerveja trapista diferente todas as outras trapistas. No copo espuma presente grossa e persistente até o final. Coloração alaranjada e bonita. Aroma de frutas secas, lembrando um prosseco. No primeiro gole o choque, uma trapista seca, lembrando muito um prosseco com notas de frutas e o ácido de frutas cítricas bem de leve. Cerveja surpreendente.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pouring produced a huge fluffy head that lingered. Appearance was a beautiful dark honey colour that was hazy. It is a very hop forward beer when compared to other Trappist offerings Ive sampled but as the beer opens up it becomes more balanced with a hint of bitterness. Very good.

0,33l bottle from Csakajósör, Budapest. Cloudy, amber colored beer with big, slack, white head. Sour, fruity odor. A little green aplle appears too. Its like sour ales odor. Light, fruity aroma, like figs and dates. Light, silky one. Its a bit tart. Light sweet taste with a tart feeling. Light body, slick texture, soft carbonation. Light tart finish. Amazing odor, but the taste is light. Very light, silky one. Easily drinkable, and the alcohol is hidden.

De color ambarino anaranjado, posee una espuma muy blanca, cremosa y persistente que servida en su copa recomendada de servicio, corona de forma sublime dicho acto como si de la guinda de un perfecto pastel se tratase.
Tengo entendido que la fermentación espontánea que se produce en la botella, acaba transformando los azúcares aportando fuerza y consistencia a su espuma.

Su aroma es uno de los puntos fuertes de esta compleja cerveza, puesto que desde el primer instante, nos deleita con unos tonos florales, especiados y cítricos acompañando a unas notas lupulizadas en perfecta armonía.
Una amplia gama que nos maravilla e invita a repetir el proceso para captar hasta el mas mínimo detalle ofrecido.

El sabor de esta cerveza es el "punto de inflexión" donde suelen ocurrir por norma dos opciones muy simples: o encanta y fascina esta espumosa o no gusta nada en lo absoluto.
Puedo realizar esta afirmación puesto que he vivido dicha situación en primera persona en muchas ocasiones y siempre ha sido el mismo resultado, que ya como dije anteriormente, se trata de una cerveza muy muy compleja.
En lo que a servidor respecta, me incluyo en el grupo a quienes les encanta y fascina.

Cuando saboreamos esta trapense, nos inunda el paladar con unas notas oscilantes intensas entre dulce y amargo recordando a cítricos, lúpulo, especias, malta y un fondo muy sutil acaramelado (seguramente por el azúcar empleado en su elaboración).
Deja en boca un regusto seco y amargo dando paso al tono afrutado y por último dejando un tono dulce pasando de puntillas.

Fuente: http://www.encopasabemejor.com/2013/01/orval.html

A perfect Orval is a perfect ale, period. I could describe the caress of the fresh hops and wild yeast, the elegant but easy sip of this splendid Belgian miracle; one of the best one can always rely on. So happy it returned (2013), as the last years batch was a true disappointment.

Copper, slightly hazy, with a huge rocky off-white head. Aroma of dry, cracker-like malt, earthy spice, lemons, Brett. Flavor: soft, bready maltiness, light fruity notes, a little lemony acidity and very light sourness, earthy spice, finishes dry and crisp. Very well balanced, delicate and drinkable.

This is probably the most distinctive bottle out there, but it pours out orange with a durable tan head like a hoppy American beer. Probably the most immortal head Ive ever seen on a beer, lasted pretty much as long as the liquid. Fruity yeast aromas, little bits of banana and apple. Fairly sweet drinking with continuing fruit notes, plus a little bit of funkiness that increases into the aftertaste along with a little sourness. Some underlying alcohol character as well. From the bottle into a tulip glass, drank at just over five months after bottling date (7/03/2013)
Pours a dark golden with a massive, white, rocky head. Aromas of sweet banana and clove, nuts, and bread. Flavors are herbs, biscuit, citrus with a dry nutty finish.

Bue 5 mois après son embouteillage. Belle bière rousse, trouble, sans dépôt et couronnée dun immense col mousseux laissant au verre une opulente dentelle. Des arômes floraux où on note un peu de résine et de poivre noir frais. Elle est moyennement amère et apparemment sans aucun sucre. Elle est lisse, de corps moyen, extrêmement effervescente et se termine en deux temps: dabord très rapidement les arômes et lamertume sestompent à 90% et nous laisse avec un petit 10% qui perdure très longtemps... Impressionnant.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2013 aroma: strong, very strong coriander, smells a bit like perfume, exotic, orange, citrus, i cant really determine the aromas, but it certainly smells extraordinary: foam is white and stays on top of the head; colour is amber-brown, quite dark and cloudy; taste: coriander, fruity, bitter in the aftertaste and there is an aroma which i cant describe (is this the typical brett-taste?), its easily something i havent known before and it is delicious. A good and refreshing beer, surprisingly drinkable for what ive heared of the mighty Orval.

Dark orange with big, foamy head. Some spice, tropical fruit and honey aroma. Bitter and spicy taste. Medium to light palate with a lingering bittrer aftetaste, which feels quite good. Very nonobtrusive.

Uklar oransje farge. Lukter karamell, banan, malt og humle.
Smaker sødme og bitterhet, ettersmaken er lang med bitterpreg.
Liker denne godt.

bottle 3 y.o. at Kulminator
One of my favourite beer.
Its very hoppy and peppery when fresh and very complex and tricky beer when aged. Slightly hoppy and funky and very dry. Slightly bitter. High carbonated, very large head.

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2016 rerate Jan. 16th 2016: 330 ml bottle from Merkur Hoher Markt, bottled 09/07/2015.
Deep amber, cloudy body, with a massive, frothy, rocky, lacing, off-white head.
Aroma of green apples, lemongrass, citrus, orange, barnyard, dough, candy.
Tastes of sweet and sour apples, pears, bitter citrus, orange zest, lemongrass, dough, barnyard, some citrus candy.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes bone dry, medium bitter, yeasty, zesty, with citrus, pears, some apples, quite long-lasting piney hops.

Tasty. Interesting how this has grown on me. Now that Im much more into Brett beers than two years ago, I like this much better. Perfectly balanced, complex Brett ale example, that also drinks pretty easy. Overall not my very favourite style example, the taste is slightly underwhelming compared to the really lovely nose maybe, but still a lovely, one-of-a-kind-beer.

inital rating Nov. 21st 2013: Bottle from Merkur Hoher Markt, Vienna. Beautiful appearance! Amber-red glowing hazy body with big, long-lasting, bubbly, rocky, white head, that leaves a lot of lacing on the glass. Uncommon aroma of lemongrass, green apple, yeast, some banana. Taste starts sweet, with green apple, grass, some malt and merges into a hop bitterness and strong dryness, almost like a white wine. Medium body and strong carbonation. Well, I dont know how to take this. Surely a unique, complex, well balanced and also refreshing brew, but just not my style. To exaggerate it a bit, this is more like drinking cider, but I can understand that some will love this beer. 7/4/7/3/15
330 ml bottle. hazy orange color with great head. aroma is sweet with citrus and banana. taste is sweet and fruity with hops. dry finish. medium to high carbonation.

Orange reddish beer with a long lasting white head. Aroma is berries and grapes, ripe fruits and yeast, brown sugar. Taste is a bit dry and fizzy, yeasty, bananas and fruits. A hint of alcohol. Medium palate. Nice smooth long finish with ok bitterness. Glad I still got a few of these stocked :)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured three inch head with fruity dry aroma. Taste of light citrus overwhelmed with funk . Great bubbly feel on the mouth .

Orval. trapist ale. 6,2% tappet den 15.4.13 så en okay frisk øl. købt i salling 35 kr. denne øl er en trapsit type. der er tilsat brettanomyce ved tapningen. dom er en gærkultur som arbejder i øller og giver smag. så der for er der forskel på en ung og gammel øl i smag. skum: stort skum som vare ved i meget lang tid. duft: fugt, lidt malt, smag: frisk. lidt syre i starten på tungen. lidt peber eftersmag. citrus. lidt jorbær

A: Amber/Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, Bubbly White Head, Some Lacing

S: Belgian Yeast, Mild Belgian Sugars

T: Champagne Yeast, Mild Belgian Sugars

M: Decent Carbonation, Light to Medium Bodied, Bubbly

Overall, this beer tastes like a soda water ale...it is over carbonated and lacks any real character or redeeming flavor.

Will need to rerate. Bottled 7/3/13. Poured 11/15/13. Freshest bottle I have seen in the states. Exploded upon opening. Pours all head. So far, this beer is frustrating. Fluffy white head with very little golden liquid beneath. Aroma is fruity, farmyard funk, Belgian yeast, crisp, fresh, grass. Incredibly difficult to drink, as there appears to be no actual beer but merely a bottle of bubbles. The beer that settles is flat but not without flavor; grass, citrus, mild hop bitterness, alcohol, Belgian yeast, some bubblegum. Carbonation is very high to obscene. Mouthfeel is watery. Lacing is present but highly resented. I PRAY that this was a bad bottle. This is easily in my bottom 5 beer drinking experiences, joining Sam Adams Blackberry Wit, Sam Adams Light, an infected bottle of Adam and the onion notes of BA Frogs Hollow. Will rerate at some point after !

Une couleur cuivrée teintée dorange se dessine devant nos yeux au fil du versage pour laisser place à une épaisse mousse blanche qui prend la poudre descampette promptement. Une odeur prenante de citron et de levure laisse présager une acidité en bouche qui est finalement moindre quanticipée. Beaucoup moins sucrée que ses consoeurs trappistes, cette bière est très rafraîchissante et a juste assez de punch pour vouloir y revenir plus dune fois.

hazy copper-orange, large rocky white head, a lot of lacing; malty bready nose, barnyard, aroma full of honey, hay, floral hops, hint of citrus; dry but mild medium bitter taste, light sweetness, grassy and earthy notes; lively carbonation, medium body, creamy mouthfeel; smooth dry finish, spicy notes. Probably one of the best beers around.

Bought a bottle at the Emté in Leerdam. The beer has a golden color and rich white head, CO2 level is perfect. The aroma is complex with tones of flowers and lemon, shortly said its perfect. Floral and grassy aromas which reminds me of some tea with herbs. Also in the medium bitter taste tones of apples with cinnamon. The finish is fresh and a little dry with a medium bitter. A very good trappist, not the best one, but definitely worth repeating.
UPDATED: DEC 22, 2013 nice persistent foam. dry beer taste almost like geuze but more much more easy drinking my girl likes.that ?s enough

Clear light copper, rocky white head
A hint of sour, freshness, cereals, pink grapefruit or similar, very mature orange tarocco
Sweet, bitter, sweet....after taste bitter, lightly astringent (pleasent)
Cerals, bread, mature sweet orange, hop
A particular beer, you can love it or hate it
It pours a nice straw color with a gorgeous huge white head. It smells weird and its so harsh and bitter...but I cant stop loving it. Its just unique. A masterpiece.
Bananas all the way. Smell of bananas. Taste of that too, but not as much as the smell. Bitter aftertaste. High carbination.
Bottle at todd english ..aria..vegas... dark red pour with CRAZY huge head.. aroma is like a sweet tart and alcohol with some malts...good shiz
~This review was made some time ago via another application, and thus the specific details (beyond numerical scores) are no longer available~

Appearance with reddish / amber color, cloudy liquid and very tall and dense head.
Fruity flavor (grape and citrus) and aged wood.
The palate is quite acidic, bitter and dry finish.
Unlike most Belgian, it isnt sweet.
A trappist different, I still cant tell if I recommend it or not, I need to drink it more.

Time to revisit this one. 
Bottled October 2012, drank 29JUL13

Standard lightly hazed honey colored ale with a huge foam cap that falls to a central dome in about ten minutes. The bubbles almost look like a perfectly toasted marshmallow. Smells of grain, hay, grass, pineapple, pear, and a little clay yeast. Flavor is bitter with a solid biscuity malt profile, some nice corn character and a hint of english cucumber muddled in there someplace. Medium on thin with nearly flat carbonation at this point and a refreshing finish. Im torn on this beer, as I move toward more delicate beers with nuance and what I currently consider maturity in the beer - I feel like this is a good beer and understand how its considered world class. I cannot see, however, how this manages to be a approachable beer for me, but leaves me simply empty at the end. I dont long for more, I dont take a sip and immediately want another. For these reasons I continue to steer clear of this one. 

From notes verbatim on 10/28/10
A: Pale apricot ale with massive head that just keeps growing. Maybe overly carbonated? Dull clarity.
S: Lots of bretty funk. Sharp, strong, herbal. Im fairly neutral to this one.
T: This beer is soooo bitter to me. I cant tell why. I may need to revisit this beer to make sure Im not having an off night.
M: Very carbonated. Medium body ale. 
D: I struggled to finish this beer. This makes me wonder if I simply got a bad bottle, or maybe I just am having an off night. But this is horrible.
3.5/3/1/2/1.5=1.72
Bottle sampled at a tasting event. From notes. Oaky and earthy with a bit of funk. How the heck have I not rated this yet?

UPDATED: NOV 2, 2013 Bottle 330ml @ home. Pours hazy golden with gigantic head that lasts pretty long. Aroma is crisp, hoppy, fruity and yeast. Taste is very dry, quite sweet as well, especially in the aftertaste. Didn?t love it.

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2015 Updating an old listing as I have come to really enjoy this beer. Smell has pale malt character, hay, brett funk, slight cherry. Taste opens sweet but dries out nicely with a funked finish. Very complex but approachable. Classic.

Slightly hazy honey color with a huge foamy head. Aroma oaky and funky with strong cidery note. Taste bitter and dry, not at all what youd expect from a "Belgian Ale". Very funky taste with precedes into palate
UPDATED: OCT 30, 2013 Bottle @ home. Nice orange color with a small head. Nice dry taste with a fruity finish. Very nice beer!
defintely one of my all time favorites. very authentic taste, dark dark blond color, beautiful

Aroma - caramel, bread, herbs, noble hops, dough, leather, alcohol, banana, bubblegum

Appearance - amber, orange, cloudy. Head rocky head, tan foam, good lacing

Taste - heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, so many good but contrasting flavours

Palate - full body, thick feel, fizzy, long finish

Overall - one of the finest beers in the World and one of my desert island beers. Complex and challenging but so moreish,

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2013 About time i rate this one. Bottled. Pours beautifully hazy orange with a perfect long lasting of white head. Aroma is citrus, yeast, barnyard, bready, some cereal and floral. Medium bitter and light sweet. Very dry. Smooth mouthfeel. Quite fizzy and a medium body. Dry bitter finish. Always good
9 months old bottle. Explosive head. Orange/golden color. Fruity/funky aroma. Bitter, some sweetness. Quite thin body, creeps slowly backwards in the mouth. Dry.

Clássica. Cor laranja escuro. Abundante e persistente espuma. Amora um pouco doce, com bastante aroma de lúpulo. Aroma cítrico de casca de laranja, tangerina. Especiarias ao fundo. Sabor com pouco dulçor, amargo (lúpulo), cítrico. Sabor bem amargo no inicio, reduzindo ao passar do tempo. Amargor persistente na boca. Excelente! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2014 Bottle: Rustic amber, mostly opaque body with a huge, cream colored cap that remains thick and lasts for days, leaving huge sheets of lacing behind. Aroma contains a quick & sharp tartness hinting at orange & lemon zest. Mild tropical pineapple, musty & sweaty hay from the Brett, and some notable hops in the tail end; grass, leaves, light citrus. Taste is full of orange peel, lemon zest, sweaty & funky pineapple, moderately bitter, leaves, grass, citrus finish. Brett is all over, giving mild musty cellar and stale cork flavors. Yeasty finish, faint citrus with extreme carbonation. Nice & unique Trappist ale.
Pours a reddish brown with a massive pillow of head that never goes away. Smell is typical Trappist with a lot of spice and malt character. Flavor is surprisingly bland. Carbonated mouthfeel. Good
Dry and sour in comparition with the rest of abbey beer, and a strange aftertaste.

Gold/orange, weisser cremiger schaum, leicht säuerliches, fruchtiges aroma, gehaltvoll, angenehme bittere, ausgewogen malz/hopfen, gute rezenz, trocken im abgang

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a murky chestnut with a lovely white head. Lovely sweet smell, hints of banana. Slightly bitter start and then a lovely sweetness. Only bad thing to say is it is a tad watery.

33cl bottle into tulip.

Lille, France

Appearance: cloudy orange/brown liquid with ample head. Okay retention. Some lacing on glass

Aroma: fairly fragrant: floral hops, cellar/yeasty, citrus.

Taste: dry and bitter. Maybe even a little sour in the finish. Very different from Trappist counterparts.

Palate: medium body, frothy texture, plenty if carbonation. Medium finish 

Overall: I remember liking this more in the past. The beer is meant to be dry and hoppy by Trappist standards, but this is more so than I remember. Its a very well made beer, but my least favorite of the Trappists. its just not my taste. I have a bottle with 1.5 years on it at home that will be iterating to compare.

Bottle in Urban Tap House, Cardiff. Pours hazy amber, extremely lively. Three fingers of rocky white head despite very slow and careful pour. This bottle may have been bashed around a little... Still, the nose is quite floral and theres funky yeast, with citrus and a little pepperiness. Its nice and citrus in the mouth, with a grassy and bready touch. The yeast is very present. Its quite dry and a tad sour, which wasnt exactly what I expected. But the taste is well balanced and the finish is light bitter, not strong at all. Very pleasant. Light-medium bodied and lively dry mouthfeel. Glad to have ticked this one off, was very nice.

Finally taking the time to rate the single, seminal product of this trappist brewery. Bottled 8/30/12. Warmed to roughly 60 degrees and poured into a Firestone Walker snifter. The bottle gushed upon opening and I lost about an ounce of liquid. The first pour fills the glass with a sticky, frothy head that dissipates enough to continue pouring. After filling the snifter, the white, frothy head remains, on average, a finger high and leaves mountainous lacing about the glass. My first smell is memorable. Beautiful complexity that doesnt overwhelm. Brettanomyces is prominent, bringing out a very earthy and funky nose. Wet hay, green apple, mango, ripe orange comprise the diverse aroma. Appearance is striking; a wonderful amber-orange capped by that cloud-like head. Taste is elegant and delicious. Most of the hoppiness has faded in this bottle, but there is lingering spiciness and light bitterness that I attribute to the dry hopping used to make this beer. Flavor has notes of bread, red apple, apricot, and a nice bit of funk. Palate is also enjoyable. The beer isnt too heavy, nor is it too light. Finishes dry on the tongue as though someone just wiped my tongue with a paper towel.

Overall, an exquisite beer. I dont like the nearly $6/bottle price, but its certainly worth paying occasionally as this beer is just awesome.

Tart funky aroma with some cherry fruitness. 
Cloudy orange with very fluffy foam. 
Starts of tarty and en bitter in the taste. 
Lively carbonation, a bit to much for my taste, hard to fully get a grip of the taste and mouthfeel with that much carbonation in the way. 
Im not really sure about this beer. Im not sure I really know the style well enough to give a good judgement.
Bottle 33 cl from systembolaget. Cloudy orange with a fluffy head. Funk, coriander, citrus, cherries, slight raspberry. Medium body, medium carbonation. Nice!

330ml bottle. Pours hazy orange with a huge everlasting white foamy head. Funky, spicy, floral aroma. Brett, leather, orange, apple. Taste is slightly sour, earthy, orange, vanilla. Creamy texture. Smooth bitterness finish. Lively carbonation. Delicious.
Colore ambrato, gusto fruttato con un retrogusto amaro, tosta, sa dare grandi soddisfazioni. Oramai si trova facilmente anche nella grande distribuzione. Un must !

Cloudy darkish-amber appearance with a foamy head, quite generic but not bad. Smells fresh, citrusy. Enters heavy, with a overwhelming aroma of bitter grapefruits, interesting yeast and hop. The beer starts with a sour fresh but ends very long and bitter, leaving dry. Carbonisation is nice and lively, not holding back. A very unique kind of beer!

Nice citrus tang aroma. Foamed the fuck outta my glass. Its been a long travel I guess. Darker amber color with overwhelming frothy head. Pleasant refreshing zing at the start followed with a smooth light fruit finish. Great beer!

Tart sour aroma... Light caramel orange color with light foamy head... Slightly sour flavor with a dry slightly bitter finish on the palate... Almost fruity flavor.... Decent beer, but I prefer a lot of the other Trappists 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
(bottle 27 /09-2013) large beige head, unclear amber color, Orval yeast aroma, smooth taste, fit body, truly Belgium. Bottled 15/04-2013, BB date 15/04-2018.
Beautiful dark dolden pour. 6.9% abv. Very frothy, which wad surprising. Mildly bitter, maybe some pine hoppyness. Decent, but I was hoping for better.
Mooie donkeramber kleur en dik schuim. Haast bloemige geur en startsmaak maar wordt snel heel bitter en houd die nasmaak ook.

33cl bottle at Poechenellekelder. Pours hazy orange with a big, dense white head. Aroma is sweet, citrus, a bit sour. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet, bitter in the 2nd part. Need to try this again.

UPDATED: JAN 12, 2017 Finally a good one: bottle with expiry date 17.08.2021, so quite new. Rocky head that disappears after a while. Aroma is funky, grassy hops, some sauerkraut. Light bitterness, slightly sour, no sweetness. Fizzy carbonation. Very good.

Old rating from 24 Sep 2013: 2/2/2/2/8 = 1.6
Aroma: vinegar like in a lambic beer, maybe a bit of straw, a touch of herby hops. Frothy head, quickly diminishing. Amber colour, hazy. Medium sourness, medium bitterness, no sweetness. Fizzy carbonation. 33cl bottle, bottled on 23rd May 2013. Generally, it looks like there is something wrong with my bottle. This is the second bottled Orval I drink outside Belgium and second disappointing one.

Piwo nie do podrobienia. W zapachu po belgijsku, drożdże, ale w smaku już dzieją się cuda. Mocy praktycznie nie czuć, bo jest jej niewiele jak na belga. Lekka kwasowość przypominająca dobre białe wino doskonale skontrastowana ze słodową belgijską klasyką. I na dodatek goryczka na wiele wyższym poziomie niż w belgian strongach. Mówią: szampan wśród piw i coś w tym jest!
Tall lasting head. Very bitter taste with Toasty notes. Bitterness stay in mouth for a time.

Jadooore cette bière. Très belle couleur orange/doré et une odeur un peu fruité je trouve (je ne suis quun amateur en comnmentagr de bière). Un goût très doux au debut qui se finit sur une belle touche un peu amère. Une de mes préférées.

A one of a kind beer. Very aromatic, bitter, lots of hop and dry. Deep orange color and a bit fluffy foam. Very nice bottle + glass. 

It´s not a beer for me for ordering at a bar, but it is worth tasting.
0,33l bottle. Copper color with big head and nice lacing. Aroma is yeast, spices and hops. Taste is hops, caramel and citrus. Very tasty, easy drinkable and balanced beer.
