Both spicy and hoppy with a huge hop nose. Very dry on the finish.

Bottle from Total Wine Glendale. Pours turgidly brown with tons of white foam. Its like trying to drink the blob. Has some floral notes on the nose. Taste is hoppier than I expected. Finishes clean. Nice!
Meget god øl, rund, mye smak. Blir ett godt lokk når man heller fra flaske. Trapistøl som man må prøve.

Une belle mousse, une magnifique couleur ambrée, une richesse au nez rare.
Une de mes trappistes préférées, car pas très forte et riche avec des goûts caramélisées et chocolatées. Une tuerie dans ce Monde de brute, à vieillir.

Bottle at home, bought from Brussels, 18th September 2013. Just felt like a Belgian for a change. This delivered well, quite a substantial head, the beer tastes spicey, lots of yeast, some banana and some hops. This was an hour is so in the fridge, prior to cracking, more complex as it warmed. Nice, easy drinking Belgian ale
Amber kleurig Troebel bier. Made 2 fit in het glas, erg mooi! Perzik, sinaasappel in de geur. Smaak is zuur maar ook beetje bitter.mooi biertje.
Piepschuim op dit troebel Amber kleurig bier. In de geur sinaasappelschil en perzik. Smaak houdt het midden tussen Palm en geuze. Bijzonder biertje, niet helemaal mijn smaak maar wel een mooie body
Bottle thanks to adnielsen. Pours a hazy orange with a tall white head. Aroma is funky and sour. Flavor is tart, green apples, yeasty, really nice.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2015 Orval

The fruity but slightly musty aroma is the weak spot for this fine beer. 
Exceptional feel with a nice dry finish: the true "Champagne of bottled beer".

Tart, dry almost gueuze-like flavor. Sweet, floral aroma belies a complex 'natural' flavor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(Embouteillée le 04/12/2012, 6.9 % dalcool) Dorée et trouble, mousse très épaisse et blanchâtre, proche du crème. Nez de levure, bananes et épices. Goût de bananes et herbacé, cest surtout lamertume qui ressort en bouche et un petit pétillement sûr qui me dérange un peu.

No surprise this is an excellent beer and a great example of why the Belgians are considered masters of the craft. Brilliantly complex and balanced brew that makes a great contrast/complement to the usual APA/IPA.

Golden color, large white head, minimizes into a wide compact film. Aroma is spicy, with fruits, orange, herbs and little of licorice and toffee. Sticky palate, alcohol present but nicely integrated, bitter finish. Taste is unique, smoky, spicy and bitter.

(Bottle): Pours a hazy dark amber with a big white head. Aroma of belgian yeast, banana, spice and a touch of spirit character. Taste was slightly sweet, belgian yeast, banana, spice, slight hops and berries. Beautiful beer, especially for the abv.

330ml Bottle. Opens with a real fizz and pours a thick off white head over a cloudy dark amber body. Its aroma is very fruity, orange, some hops and malts and a spiciness. Its taste is very dry - burnt caramel and hops that soon dissovles into a bitter but short lasting finish. Not a bad beer this and I would have it again in a heartbeat. But its so well balanced it just misses a bit of character.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2016 Pours a huge head that means business! A good start. Then a unique smell that reminds me of certain French cheeses. The complex aroma is fruity and hoppy, with some brett. Somewhat sour. Lively yeast, modest bitterness. Bitter finish, depending on the age of the bottle. Very dry mouthfeel. Ive really enjoyed drinking this and will drink Orval again when the opportunity arrives. *note: Rating reflects Orval at its peak in the aging process.

Poured a yellow-orange color with a HUGE head. Granted, I dont have a trappist glass (which has a larger surface area to spread the head out), a 4 fingered head on a half pint glass. Quite floral on the nose, like walking through a fruit orchard in bloom. It was like a Belgan Wheat ale, but with quite a bit of citrus and yeast on the palate

-General
awesome, so incredibly unique! wellbalanced sour bitter sweetness, very dry very rough and very drinkable... complex aroma full of ripe fruits, spices, and yeast, (some caramel?)... great!

-Young
Lovely hops! the dry-hopping really shines

-Old
some mandarin, some port, but most of the fresh fruity hops have disappeared

330ml bottle from a German supermarket. Huge, frothy head which lasts a pretty long time. Light orange, slightly cloudy body. Sharp aroma of bread, herbs, floral hops, leather. Gentle in the mouth, becomes a bit boring throughout the bottle.
Light golden brown color. Banana nose, hint of spice and vegetables. Sweet, fruity taste, sour end. Tasty, will definitely drink again.
Plum, grape hops, cereal aromas. Rich malt, apple, raisin, pine, dry sour finish. Nice and complex trappist brew, a great classic!

Cloudy dark orange color, huge white head. Dry aroma of malt, hops, yeast and some spices. Taste is dry too with nice bitterness, with hops, malt, yeast, citrus, pine, spices. Medium body and average carbonation. Quite different from other Trappist beer I have tried, but very good too.
UPDATED: JAN 31, 2015 If you want to smell & taste hop pellets/grass/bitter/fruit & vegetable shop/banana, this is your beer. Such a nice dry mouthfeel. Utterly balanced. Best beer in the world.

Doesnt fit into the Trappist category except for production reasons only. Aroma is of citrus with a very fizzy head and light hay appearance. Taste is very carbonated. Received as a gift from a friend with 5 other Trappist beers and by far this was the most disappointing of the lot.

Orval has an exceptionally huge, spongy, off-white head, extremely thick lacing left behind, and a brilliant, orange appearance, with numerous, tight bubble streams. After swishing the bottom contents and pouring it in, one will notice a thick, descending orange-gray cloud. The aroma is of funky, sweet, pungent yeast, with an overriding horse stall smell. Taste is of some grain husk, sugar, hard candy, caramel, yeast funk, fruit, salt water taffy, and mild hops. Mouthfeel is light, prickly, and somewhat slimy, and Orval finishes sweet, rich, dry, and delicious. Overall, this is an outstanding beer, and all beer enthusiasts should try it! RJT

Pours blonde-amber with a medium high frothhead that collapsed fairly quickly, though the remainder lasted very long. The characteristic hoppiness of this beer is present right from the start, fairly bitter. This flavor is accentuated even more during the finish and in the aftertaste, which lasts very long. The arome is great, but the palate and the heavy bitterness made my experience less pleasant. Overall its a decent beer, that deserves some cedit, but it does not belong to my favorites.

bottle, screw you guys, Im not giving in, this is not the best beer ever. Okay okay okay so its got some light bretty characteristics, some light hop notes and some lively belgian yeast and complexity to match, a giant foamy white head and is tasty to drink but not something I yearn for.

(09/08/12 - 22/08/13)


Bottle. Hazy amber with a huge, frothy, mostly lasting off-white head. Aroma is citrus (especially orange), candy, fruity (apricot, dates, plum), biscuit, wood, spicy. Very complex. Flavor is light heavy sweet and moderate bitter, wine-like - astringent. Well balanced. Finish is very dry and moderate bitter. Amazing Belgian Ale, one of my favorite trappist beers.

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2013 330ml bottle poured into a beautiful Orval goblet. Hazy orange with a very large tan foam head that lingers. Aroma is complex like in a greenhouse full of fruits, vegetables and herbs. Taste is just as intricate, there is a lot of going on here, I could detect herbs, apricot, orange and bread. Sour and dry but very pleasant, one of my favorite Trappist beers. Its a love it or hate it kind of beer, I would recommend everyone to taste it at least once. Personally Orval is one of my favorite Trappist beers. Also it appears to even get better with a few months of age, the bottle I had this time was about 5 months old.

Reddish-orange beer with huge head.
Sour meets syrupy aroma on this beer. spicy and very fresh. In fact, the fruitiness is like supermarkets fruit counter during the summer.
The taste has lambic like acidity, spices, apples and hops.
After taste a bit of citrus and grass, with a small hint of malt. Very complex taste that is pure plus.
Mouthfeel is a medium-full-bodied and rich, between the aftertaste is long and dry. Carbonation is moderate and a little bubbly.
This is a devout event. Orval is able to please everytime. Extremely versatile beer that fit quietly enjoying the small hours of the night taking place for philosophizing.

Bottle from Systembolaget, 1 year old.
Pours hazy orange with a really big, fluffy white head.
Aroma has lemon, tangerin, orange and a lot of earthy herbal notes
Taste has citrus, yeast, slight funk, bitterness, herbal notes and a slight warming feeling.
Mouth feel is dry, medium body, medium carbonation.
Dry bitter after taste.
Well...first Belgian beer (besides sours) that Ive enjoyed in years. This is really something special.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2013 Bottle 0.33l from P&M Bonn. Pours hazy orange with a large white head and strong carbonation. Looks really great. Aroma is slightly sour. Taste is dry and hoppy with a touch of sour. No sweetness. Great beer. In total contrast to all other trappist beers I know. I

Had this beer here and there a few times, but this is the first time I've really given it its own time and space. 

Huge head which dissipates quickly and a deep, golden brown colour. Beautiful. 

Sugary fruit aroma, apples, candi sugar, grassy, a touch of lemon (?) truly Belgian yeast. 

Sweet upfront, but quickly moves down the tongue to more hoppy bitterness. Apple, banana, bubblegum. Rapidly turns dry and a touch sour mid-palate. Bitter at the back. Overall a highly carbonated body, yet quite 'thin' throughout. Carries the grassy notes to the back of the mouth nicely. Sweet and crisp around the mouth without diacetyl. 

Overall, very different from other Trappist beers. A good 8pm post-dinner dessert beer on a hot day. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Large head immediately upon pouring into goblet, fades to thin but solid layer which never completely dissipates. Hazy golden brown color. Slightly sour aroma. Mouthfeel is highly carbonated, lively. Taste is maple, caramel, fruity, faintest trace of tartness if you really look for it. Nice light brett funk adds a layer to the taste. Complex, smokey, lingering finish. Aftertaste takes some work to decipher. Interesting on each sip, more approachable than some of the darker Trappist ales. Pleasant, enjoyable beer.

Beautiful copper colour with huge foam. Aroma is Brett, fruit,some oak and floral. Wonderful medium mouthfeel and lively carbonation.Very nice dry, complex aftertaste. Overall: One of the most unique trappist beers.
Good bitter aftertaste. The aroma is weaker than expected. Foam is strong and sexy. The taste is complex, but not of my favorite range. The brand glass is very pretty.

Bottle. Strong hoppy aroma with alot of spices. Color cloudy dark amber with a thin lacy head. Flavor was very complex of hop with a long finish with a small bite of alcohol. Very bretty. A killer with moule en Frites. On e of my personal sipping favorites.

Poured into a Chalice glass from a 330 ml bottle


App  colour amber/orange but very cloudy ; a 4-finger dense beige/off-white head long lasting.

Aroma  Bread and barley with a touch of wet ground

Taste  Balanced sweetness with alcohol presencedriving to a moderate bitterness into the finish.

Mouthfeel  Medium bodied. Medium/soft carbonation.

Overall - a wonderful trappist ale. To revisit again and again. Nuff said.

Paid $5.00 for a .33 CL bottle at the Beverage King. Bottle date of 07/18/ 2012. Best Before 07/ 2017. With 6.9 % ABV. Trappist glass displays orange/ amber with a huge foamy off-white head that diminishes very slowly. Spider web lacing all the way down. The yeast aroma is fruity with floral hops and a herbal element. Very complex taste. Very hoppy floral notes followed by dried fruit and hints of pine. Some light tartness follow by what I can only describe as Brett. This doesnt use Brett, does it?? The brett flavor just maybe a result of the unique yeast profile. The texture is very dry with a lingering bitterness. I will purchase this on draft and compare notes.This is a wonderful brew!

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2015 Bottle->Trappist glass. Cloudy orange with huge frothy white head. A: citrus, barnyard funk, yeast, herbs. T: citrus, yeast, light barnyard, bread, spice. High carbonation. Finish has slightly metallic quality. Aroma is amazing, taste is good.

My favorite. A well balanced easy drinking yet complex Trappist. Cost aside, I would drink this every week if I could 

The Derricks 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cerveza tostada, aromas suave, sabor intenso con ligero amargor, esta buena para tomar una pero tampoco es una cerveza espectacular
Beautiful cloudy copper color with lots of foam. Powerful hops and dry, which is good but it has a somewhat thin taste relative to other Trappist beers.

Bottle 33cl. Bought at t Hemelryck @ Ypres, Belgium. Pours a giant off-white head that slowly shrinks until a thin layer and then just stops shrinking, wow! Dark orange-golden and very hazy appearance. At first hoppy flavor, rather unusual for a trappist, then it turns more fruity and yeasty. I smell citrus, banana, spices, orange and many other things, altogether very dry. Taste is spectacularly complex for a beer that is only 6,4 ABV. More hops and fruits and now also yeast and hints of wood. Long dry bitter aftertaste. Oily texture. Amazing!
Deep hazy amber, big bubbly white head; aroma of resinous hops; taste is hoppy, bitter, a touch of orangey citrus and some spice; very well balanced; I can see what the fuss is about.

A hazy, caramel-orange pour with a rocky, off-white head that never completely disappears. The aroma has fruity merlot quality with some woody and earthy notes. It has a light body with thin texture and lively carbonation. The taste is lightly bitter with a very dry finish.

Pours dark amber, very effervescent. The nose is sweet, round, full of wheat.The palate is pretty sharp and bitter with aromas of citrus and hops. Overall a pretty classic trappist beer with a bitter sweet twist...
Cerveza llena de sabor y bien compensada. Aspecto amarillo translúcido. Con un toque lamb

Clear orange/amber colour with a massive white head. Aroma is yeasty, some hops, some citrus. Taste is light sweet and sour. Very dry texture, oily with light carbonation. OK, was expecting a bit more though.

Poured a dark copper with a huge fluffy head.... smells more hoppy that most trappist beers, also tastes the same, dry and citrusy also. Tastes more boozy than it is.... Mediocre when it comes to its style

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2013 Appearance is cloudy golden with a thick, creamy white foam cap. Aroma is citrus like peaches and apricot, giving way to more earthy, herbal, grasslike , and brett notes. Taste is equally complex that starts with sweet, bready malt that quickly turns earthy and spicy before finishing with a biting tartness of brett and hop bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium with high level of carbonation. Finish is extremely dry with a puckering tartness and bitterness that gradually fades

Bottle nice amber color with a large very long lasting head aroma is very special its like wine taste is also very special like wine with hops aftertaste ics like old champagner with some bitterness quite funny brew but it grows

Bottle - bottled 4/10/12. Pours a murky amber orange with massive, lasting beige head, and bubbly seafoam lace. Nose is strong horse blanket, lemon, wheat, dark fruit, funk. Medium mouthfeel. Some citrus, wheat, barn. Sweet up front with a moderately bitter finish. Slight tartness. Delicious beer either young or old.
Veldig mye skum. Grumset gulbrun farge. God litt syrlig duft av citrus. Frisk syrlig sittende smak.

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2014 Bière jaune orangée, voilée, extrêmement effervescente, et surmonté dune très abondante mousse de couleur blanc cassé, très dense, et qui descend tranquillement en traçant son chemin tout le long du verre. Arômes bien fruités (pêche, poire, pomme, cantaloup, mangue, banane) avec du malt mielleux, grain, foin, alcool évident, levures belge et sauvage, et houblon herbacé et poivré. Nez formidable, ça sent le paradis, complexité étonnante, il ne manque quun tout petit peu dintensité pour être parfait. En bouche, pétillement très élevé sur la langue, breuvage très mousseux, lonctuosité au palais est un peu faible cependant. Au goût, saveurs de fruits du verger et de fruits tropicaux (tous très mûrs!), un peu de malt mielleux, levures sauvages (saveur de cuir!), et un alcool encore plus présent en bouche quau nez (un peu trop même!). La finale est dominée par un houblon herbacé et poivré, voire légèrement résineux, qui apporte une amertume de modérée à élevée. Très belle intégration des différentes saveurs entre elles, excellente bière!

0,33 l, flaske, 6,2 %, gave fra søs, 24. juli 2013. 
Flot gylden, næsten orange øl med ca 1-2 cm hvid skumtop. 
Citrusnoter i næsen og gær-ditto. I munden en anelse sødme, men ellers bitterhed, bitterhed og bitterhed. Lettere dominerende kulsyreindhold. En legende blandt trappist-øl, men fås i min optik meget bedre hos andre klostre. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JUL 26, 2013 A trappist with a beautiful color. The aroma is very sweet and floral, with a slightly bitterness to it. The taste is dark roasted but it?s not as heavy like a stout.

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2015 Great, complex and truly unique beer. Aroma of brett, barnyard, caramel and surprising fruity hops. Taste of barnyard, old hop, brett, caramel biscuit and funky tart. The real wild thing. Allegedly, the brewers lost the special taste one time when they cleaned the brew tanks too well. I?m glad they invited their wild yeast back. Update. Had a bottle of 14 lontje old as well. Still very lively and funky, with a big foamy head. Still very bretty, but more bitter than the young version. Creamy mouthfeel and finish. Very rich and awesome.

Perhaps the only beer I can to which I can give a perfect score. Its astonishing what this beer does; I find something new about it every time I open a bottle. A unique and lively character is established by the yeast and hops intermingling in surprising ways. It can develop within the bottle for quite a long time, but its spectacular no matter how old or how young it is. Flawless.

Ive been waiting to try this. The appearance is beautiful. Hazy golden color and huge unending thick white head. One of the nicest heads Ive seen. The smell is sweet, apples, grapes, yeasty. The flavor is confusing for me. I just know I didnt really care for it. Its sweet and tart and yeasty at the same time, but didnt really jive for me. Great looking beer, but not really my style.

Bottle. Pours slightly cloudy amber with stable white head. Clear aroma of fruit and flowers with distinct malty touches. Mildly bitter onset, giving way to fruity (apricot?) notes, ending dry. Low carbonation. Slightly creamy mouthfeel. A very nice Belgian ale.
Stunning beer. Amber pour. Thick frothy off white head.Yeasty fruity aroma. Bananas, apricots and other well balanced fruit on the tongue. Medium bitterness, tart, hoppy Finnish. Amazing beer.
Brown with small white/bit yellow cap. "Flat" but at the same time rich taste with almost o sweetness, but blanced bitterness anf sourness.

Murky brown beer with a foamy beige head. A very unique aroma. Lemon combined with sweet bread and caramel. Very hard to explain but its good. Medium bodied. Slight crispiness. A bit sour. Yeasty, grassy bitter, some caramel sweetness yet its more dry than sweet. Quite wonderful. Drinkable yet complex and balanced.

From a 2 1/2 year old bottle. Field berries and cherry are introducing the aroma. we can also find a lot of alcohol; ether notes. caramel and earthy notes are also showing up. Aroma is very difficult to evaluate because of that ether presence.
Appearance: Clear amber, off white head, good thickness, rocky and from average to long lasting. Head doesnt stick and no apparent lacing.
Taste: Attack has a well felt bitterness that is lasting quite long. Again ether accents are dominant. We can well feel the bretts that are giving this beer a feel of lambic. The sparkling is perfect and supports the bitterness. Herbal hops are well dosed. Mouth feel is exceptional. The flavor palette is however restricted. A well brewed beer that is not necessarily my favorite. Being refractory to lambics, and this beer has some similarities to that style because of the type of yeast used, it does,t rank into my top favorites. But for some other people it might be great.

Bottle at home. Somehow I remembered that I didnt like this beer. Thats why I did not have this for years. Now that I actually tried it, I really do like it..
Hazy amber with a nice white head. Medium body with medium carbonation.
Great combination of bitter, sour and some sweetness. Hoppy and fruity.

Bottled in 2010. Pours a hazy reddish-orange with a giant head that dissipates slowly into a cap. Yeast is visible floating around in the beer. Dark fruits dominate the nose. Plumb, cherry, grape, its like holding a glass of brandy. Taste is sour more than anything. Sweet and yeasty, even has a bit of a hop bite. Big, slow sipper, even with the alcohol content being what it is. Unusual beer, more reminiscent of a lambic than other trappist beers Ive had.

Pour is cloudy orange with white fluffy head and lots of lacing. Aroma of brett with some sort of citrusy and floral notes, light malts. Taste is full on brett, earthy hops and crisp malts, yeast and spicy notes, dry finish. Low body and lively carbonation. A classic and something i could never be tired of.

Bottled in January 2010. Pours a murky orangish brown with a 3 finger white head. Smells just like a frozen cherry Coke you would get at the movies. Very sweet, sugary aroma. Taste is more muted and not too sweet. Kind of like a weak frozen cherry Coke. It is quite dry with a lot of carbonation. Not something I would probably buy again, but glad I tried it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a bottle into a tulip glass (probably not the correct glass.. im assuming a chalice is preferred??) Any way.. deep gold, almost amber color with a very thick white head. Aroma was bready and fruity. Tastes very nice. Nice balance of sweetness, dryness, spiciness etc. And very drinkable. One of the better Belgian ales Ive had.
Not my favorite style, but this one wasnt bad. Exceptionally dry. Excessive carbonation actually makes it harder to drink. But it was well-balanced and not overly fruity.

Pours an unbelievable amount of foamy, bubbly head that gives off patchy lacing. Has a pale golden appearance. Aromas of yeast, malts and herbal hops with hints of coriander. Flavours are mainly Belgian yeast, floral and citrus hops, orange peel. Nice smooth and creamy mouthfeel. Slight warming sensation. Quite excessive carbonation. Almost full bodied. Great stuff! My bottle shows 6.9% abv.

I have heard many good things about this brew. It is a formidable brew. Sweet, Amber notes. It doesnt wash down like a typical ale. Ultra smooth finish. Refreshing. Orval typifies the unique and complex Belgian Ale family.
Enormous head. Taste is extraordinarily bitter on the back of your tongue but very sweet otherwise. An interesting but overpriced trappist.

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2014 The appearance is an opaque brownish orange color with a large off-white head, and the aroma mixes sour fruit, Belgian yeast, light caramel malts, and flowers. The taste is mildly sour, mildly sweet, and a touch umami, and the aftertaste fades slowly but is still quite reminiscent of the initial flavor. The palate combines a lively carbonation, medium-light body, and a slick texture, which balances out the flavor nicely as the bubbles dance on the tongue.

Poured into Chimay glass. Was a cloudy amber color. Orval, to me, is a bit differant than other trappist brews. Not in a bad way, I think the local natural yeast used makes it stand out. A dry, hoppy, floral and enjoyable beer. Even the bottle is a stand out. My seller says it can be aged but I have not been able to keep it sitting for long. I wish my store had it in stock more than the "sorry sold out" sign.

This is a new favorite. What an amazing beer. Annoyed that it took over a decade of beer drinking to give it a try. Pours a hazy pear color with ample white head and great lacing. The smell is brilliant blend of spice and sweat. The taste is sweet and earthy. Medium body with great carbonation. Bottle - Brick Store Pub - Decatur, GA
Great beer. Great how it gets better with age. Can be a bit difficult to pour tho as it is a very lively beer!
Hazy orange amber, big foamy white head. Yeasty, wheaty, banana bread maltiness and pineapple aroma. Big foamy mouthfeel. Its fine. Tasty enough but no big deal. Good.
UPDATED: JAN 31, 2016 Good Trappist beer. A taste of hopsy beer very interessant. I drink it again with pleasure

2012 bottle. Light thick brown pour, the smell is a bit of honey, caramel. Taste is very dry, high carbonation, touch of lemon, very little sweetness and slightly bitter/sour finish.  Very interesting

This was OK. The aroma was faint and smelled Belgian but with a hop tint to it. The appearance was a cool copper color that appeared almost filtered. Not a whole lot of sediment with this one. Very carbonated, which I found distracting, and dry. There was a caramelized sweetness (not much) with a crisp hoppy finish. Almost a bite at the end that was funky. I found the dry-hopping to be an interesting touch. Better Belgian Pales out there.
Wow,you need a sledgehammer to get rid of this head :-) Lovely complex beer but quite bitter for a trappist. I will certainly add some bottles to my cellar for ageing.

Pours a hazy orange almost copper color with an uber active meringue like head that stays throughout and leaves all sorts of sticky lacing. If I didnt know any better I couldve sworn this was a hefeweizen. Banana and bubble gum bring out the hefe characteristics but the yeast kick at the end reminds you that this Belgian. Taste has so many level. Complex and very well put together. Calk me crazy, but this monks kinda know what theyre doing.

Bottle Sample. Copper colour, slight haziness. Tight, heavy collar with incredible lacing. Complex aroma of yeast, citrus zest, banana and herbal hops. Palate is rich and dry. Flavours of caramel malt, spice and hops with something slightly sour. Finishes clean and dry, lingers for a while. Really cool beer!

Poured from a bottle, San Diego, Aromatic, floral aroma. Tremendous foamy head, medium amber. A good, tasty beer, that is not tremendously flavorful or very special. Maybe I got a bad batch, Ill get another bottle sometime and re-rate.

Light hazy orangey/amber in colour with a massive frothy light tan/beige head. Noses of cinnamon, fruits, sugarcane, floral. Lively on the palate developping a sweet sourness, mouth watering and well balanced. Full bodied and a finish being all the way there without being predominant. Nice stuff!

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2016 Hazy and almost opaque dark orange beer with a huge cloudy head that leaves lacing on the glass and a permanent layer on top of the beer. At first the aroma is heavily vinegarish sour like a lambic. Then the sourness tames down and combines it with anisey spicy Belgian yeast, toffee sweetness and fruity apples. Flavor is yeasty tart and rich with appley fruitiness. Finish has a nice bite of bitterness, leaving a dry aftertaste with apple fruitiness. Palate is medium carbonated and medium full. The apple fruitiness and sourness reminds me of white wine. A complex, unique and unexpectable beer. Ive had 4-5 Orvals in my life and all have tasted different. 7+4+7+3+16=37
RERATE 2016-12-24: Fresh bottle, hoppy and saisony yeasty, really tasty. This beer is almost always different, but usually very enjoyable. 8+4+8+3+17=40
grass, banana, golden, a good complex flavor beer, smells like tomato. a little sour ,a little bitter .

A bittery, hoppy Trappist beer. Lovely in summer or winter. A great beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Den Tatoverede Enke, Copenhagen - Amber pour with a persistent white head. Lovely citrus aroma and taste, orange/lemon peel, cinnamon, soft yeast, sweet malt and a slight spicyness, Immense mouthfeel, very complex on the palate. Love it.

As soon as you poor the beer in the glass the aroma and the colour of Orval tells you that you are going to enjoy one special beer. Nice caramel colour , floral and citrus aroma. The taste is perfect balanced with the aroma .

330ml bottle. Perfect looking beer. Amber with tons of head that leaves a sexy uneven mountain and then collapses after an hour or two. Surprisingly bretty with lots of spice and apple and wood and an earthy edge. Funky wood on the palate with lots of spice and earthy notes, light fruit. Very dry. I find the mouthfeel a little offensive but overall very satisfying.
Pineapple, vineous dryness, straw, murky peach, wheat, farmyard vibes, rotten mango, complex, satisfying, rich, characterful.

Bottle. Pours a hazy orange with a huge white head that settles into a lacy cap. Complex aroma of yeast, caramel and funk. Earthy with a hint of hoppiness and some barnyard. Medium body with light carbonation starts and finishes bone dry. Super complex and superbly crafted, though I would expect nothing less from one of the worlds great beers!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Colour: Amber/orange with a thick foam head. A bit too much for me.

Nose: Very spicy and earthy, with some leather and herbs. Dry and crisp. Some fruits like citrus and apple. Very complex.

Flavours: Bitter, dry, fresh with some orange peel and (again) citrus. Additional dry-hopping is well noticeable. The bitterness slowly makes way for some yeasty flavours and some candy sugar.

Finish: Long and intense. Bitter-dry, fruity-fresh and malty-sweet. Complex finish.

Verdict: Unique among the Trappist beers. It takes some getting used to, but once you do, youll embrace it with open arms. Amazing beer.

bottle. Pours cloudy orange with sediment and huge head. Aroma of citrus, bubblegum, yeast. Taste is banana, earthy, bitter. Interesting, but a little watery and does not stand up to its trappist cousins.
From bottle. Floral in aroma, bitter flower on the tongue. Full bodied and complex. Superb representation of the style.

Big, off-white, frothy head. Citrus, earthy, basement aroma. Dry with a spicy, maybe pink peppercorn taste to it. Theres not much I can add that most dont already know. This is a great beer! Thank you, Walt for introducing me to this years ago.

Was excited to try this.  Pours amber with a huge head - looked very appetizing.  However, it seems to be lacking in flavor.  Maybe I had hyped this too much in my head, but I am somewhat disappointed now.  Glad I tried it but would not go out of my way to get this again.

Delicious, but not as special as Rochefort. Mild hops combine with wood and yeast flavors to make something very classic tasting and enjoyable. Truthfully, perhaps a little overpriced when compared to similar tasting beers but still very good.

Bottle from AV3, nice orange pour with a full glass of head, too much carbonation. Aroma is great, some tart fruit like a sour, grapes and other vinous notes. Taste is like a dry sweet wine with some earthiness, not bad. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

S: Earthy bret, stone fruits and grapes. P: Has a big thick white foam and a brown golden color. T: It strikes with bananas but quickly goes into spices, earthy musk, grassy hops, and just a bit of cloves. M: light to medium body, nice soft carbonation. O: Solid

Ambrée pratiquement opaque, forte pétillance, magnifique mousse crémeuse persistante. Huileuse au palais avec petite astringence sur la fin. Houblonnée à souhait, plutôt épicée, un rien surette, douceur fruitée. Une des meilleures trappistes qui soit !
October 2012 bottle.  Tons of head on this one.  Smells and tastes of a bit of sourness - but in a really good way.  This is like a better version of Damnation from Russian River.
UPDATED: JUN 3, 2014 Oranje bruine kleur met een volle kraag. Ruikt hop, kruiden, beetje orange, iets zoetig. Smaakt bitter, kruiden, iets zoetig.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2013  a) Bottled on 2nd May 2013 --> 6 weeks old. 
I like Orval fresh - here the sharp hops fit best with the fresh fruity citrus-aroma. The hop-aroma is intense, overwhelming. And the light sourness also fits great in!
The aftertaste is long, hoppy, great! 
 
 b) Older rating from 18. August 2010  Ich teste eine frische (Abgefüllt am 9.6.2010) gegen eine schon ein Jahr gelagerte (Abgefüllt am 3.8.2009) Variante gegeneinander. 

Im Glas schauen beide gleich orange-trüb aus, wobei die ältere Flasche deutlich mehr Schaum im Glas gebildet hat. 

Im Antrunk ist das frische Bier weich herb, die herbe Note setzt sich im Hauptteil fort und wird relativ sehr herb, fast schon penetrant. Dabei leicht säuerlich-spritzig. 

Bei dem älteren Bier hingegen überwiegt die säuerliche, schon fast im Vergleich saure Note und drängt den schwächer gewordenen Hopfen deutlich in den Hintergrund. Auch schmeckt es alkoholisch-vergorener, Aromen von dunklem Trockenobst erscheinen unter der sauren Decke. 
Diese sind bei dem jungen Bier noch überhaupt nicht zu finden. 
Dort überwiegt auch im Nachgeschmack der deutlich grasig-starke Hopfen. Erst zum letzten Teil, wo die Herbe abklingt, kommen mild-weich-fruchtige Aromen ganz leicht hervor. 
Bei der älteren Variante überwiegt im Nachgeschmack die Säure, mild-weiche und dunkle Fruchtaromen sind deutlich ausgeprägt, hinzu kommt eine leichte Hopfenherbe. Die säuerlich-fruchtig-dunkle Note hält sich sehr lange im Mund, das Bier ist mild-weich und zugleich sauer-herb. 

--> Bei genauem "Hinschmecken" zwei komplett verschiedene Biere. Auch der unterschiedliche Alkoholgehalt macht sich natürlich bemerkbar. 


Test vom 18.8.2010, Gebinde: Glasflasche	Noten: 12,13,11,13,12,13 - 12,55
Walt, I knew you only by reputation, but Im raising this glass in your honor.  You are, and will be, missed.

I never rated this beer and in honor of Walt Powell, I do so now. 2011 bottle from Wegmans. Pours slight burnt orange with some clarity. nose is beautiful fruty aldehydes, almost triple like but brown malty  notes are also present. finish is lingering tropical canned fruit and slight stone fruits.

Wow.... Al vaak een orval gehad. Altijd smakelijk fris met wat citrus. Maar hebben ze wat aan het recept aangepast? Ik weet dat er meer vraag dan aanbod naar orval is. Misschien dat ze het er wat sneller door duwen. Maar dit is totaal niet meer als vroeger. Heel onaangenaam met een scherpe peper geur.

Despite my high ratings, I did just have a bottle with the bottling date in the year 2011 (it is now June 2013).  I have had different vintages in Belgium and they tasted fine.  However, this one was shipped to California and it just did not hold up.  Thankfully, they place a bottling date on the label.  Just be wary when purchasing in the USA.
Bottle from Voldby Koebmandsgaard. Pours hazy orange/amber with a huge light tan head. Aroma is citrus, fruits and hops. Taste is hops, yeast, fruits, spices and citrus. Good bitter dry finish.
Pours brownish orange with one finger of light tan head. Smells of yeast. Tastes of yeast, pears, and grass. Is smooth and refreshing. Delicious trappist

Bottled on 12/30/2009
Served in an Orval chalice.

A - Pours a golden honey copper, with an off-white head that never breaks up.

S - Sweet and sour orchard apples, musty basement, old church pews, spicy, banana, peach, earthy hops, grassy hops. Wonderful aroma.

T - Fruity tartness upfront, golden apples, green grassy hops, spicy lemon citrus, dusty yeast adds some woody mustiness while wicking away any wetness on the palate.

M - Moderate smooth carbonation, medium body, dry finish.

The aroma alone is intoxicating. The layers transform flawlessly. I waited until I got my hands on an Orval chalice before I reviewed this. Its a hard one to age because you just want to drink it. In a league of its own.

Serving type: bottle

04-10-2012

It pours orange with copper highlights, it is translucent and very cloudy; the head is off-white and boisterously foamy. The aroma has notes of: hay, barnyard-funk, lemon-zest, sweet malts, and pungent yeast. The taste is light sour that finishes medium dry; there are notes of: lemon-zest, yeasty funkiness, black pepper, and alcohol. The palate is medium bodied, the carbonation is high (big mouth-feel; huge bubbles), and a short spicy finish. Overall, the yeasty characteristics are very enjoyable.

Mijn lievelingsbier ! Lang geleden met vrienden een hele krat gekocht. We waren op vakantie in de Ardennen. Ik vond de eerste paar biertjes lekker maar ook moeilijk. Eigenlijk heb ik dat nog steeds. Een wild biertje waar je op terug kan vallen maar het heeft iets van een worsteling. De lekkerste dingen bieden weerstand en dat maakt het juist boeiend. Dit bier drink ik heel graag. Het laat zich niet louter consumeren het ontwikkelt zich net als de drinker ervan.  Complex

Botella de 33 cl. Una de mis trapenses preferidas, si no la que más. Excelente color marrón, con una abundante y duradera espuma. Olor a malta y levadura. En boca, es todo un espectáculo. Mucho cuerpo, regusto amargo pero no mucho. Excelente

Head: light beige, giant, fluffy, avg. retention. Colour: copper, hazy or very cloudy (depends on how you pour). 

Aroma: flowers, tropical fruit, spice, leather/stale. Taste: dry with a slight sourness, spicy/peppery, quite some hop bitterness (quite serious for a belgian).  

A unique belgian and trappist beer: very aromatic, dry and a good dose of bitterness. rich and complex, but drinkable at the same time. Was a pleasure to discover.
super great beer. exelente aroma, mecla de lupulos y esteres frutales. bastante amarga, fondo alcoholico q le queda muy bien. especiada, compleja.
Bottle at Craigs house. Came with a very large head which dissipated quickly. Light brown and hazy.

Bouteille 33cl, embouteillée Février 2013. Finalement inscrire cette perle sur le site.
De couleur orangée-cuivrée, col blanc cassé épais et crémeux.
Arôme garde un bouquet très  subtile de levure laissant des effluves aigres modérées, le tout complété par un houblonnage à cru qui donne des composants rustiques  et nobles.
Palais reste belge avec ce côté très unique de lOrval qui est vraiment une bière à part. Note de fruits rouges, pointe de sucre candi, levure et fine aigreur rappelant le brett, malt crystal et ce côté houblonné sec, amer et fruité en toute fin de bouche. En fin de bouche, je retrouve des notes légères de malt fumé.

Poursa dark copper color with a big head that fades very slowly, with ample lacing. Aroma of citrus fruits, some spice and bit of grain. Taste of citrus and fruits with a bit of malt sweetness and spice. Good bitterness and a dry finish. Medium body, smooth with lots of character. Excellent balance. Very drinkable, Very enjoyable.

330 ml bottle with 20/05/2011 date.  Pours a murky, golden amber with a 4 inch off white head.  Taste is of wheat, yeast, bread, banana, citrus, spice and some hops .  Similar aroma.  Has a nice body and a dry finish.  Easy to drink and rather enjoyable.  Was expecting more, but is good nonetheless.

Pours an orange amber color  with a nice head. Nose is sweet with citrus and floral notes. Taste is subtle yeast with orange peel and floral spices. A well balanced Belgium that slips effortlessly down your palate, full of flavor and drinks easily. Not typical of the Belgian ales i have had, but than again it is not Orval. Finish is dry and short. Quaff Score 9 / 10

Pours a dark amber orange with a beige head and nice aroma of fruits, spices, citrus and hops. Taste is complex, of hops, yeast, fruits, spices, citrus, and some sweet malt with a dry finish.  Very drinkable, well balanced and smooth, great Belgain

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2013 330ml bottle. Pours a cloudy tanned brown/orange with a thick pillowy head that lasts forever.  A fruity beer with caramel notes in taste and aroma. Mildly viscous in consistency.  Poured a copper brown/ orange, very fizzy initially, but settled to be very drinkable.
Crazy 3.5 finger head. Nice aroma with banana yeast. Taste is odd. There is some sweet at the front but a not so pleasant bitterness in the back.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2013 0.33 bottle. Humungous, off-white head, leaves some proper lacing, quite hazy amber color. Aroma is so to say Belgian: banana, clove, vanilla, some caramel, perfume, spices and an unfortunate alcoholic note. Taste is mostly bittersweet, somewhat floral, liquorice alongside, with malty undertone. At first appears overly astringent but frankly it just takes some getting used to. Medium body, nice slick texture and a soft carbonation. Finish is longish, a tad off-balance and sourish at the end but otherwise good. All in all its a good beer but honestly I expected more from the famed Orval.

Bottiglia 33 cl
Chiara torbida, schiuma molto abbondante, fine e persistente.
La trappista più beverina, amarognola e di grande struttura, decisamente buona!
33cl bottle. Its a special beer. Its not like one of the other trappist beers. Its a little more bitter.
Lots of bubbles, caramel color.  Lively nose with sweetness.  Light taste with long lasting flavor.
Great taste, suttle but lasting. Dark amber color. Good head. Appearance of the bottle and beer are great.
Bread, cereal, floral, grass, citrus, herbs, dry character, only one kind of for general public, two fermentations wither dry hopping process, hoppy aroma

330ml bottle bought at Belgian Beer Intl. in Tsuen Wan.
Colour -  Cloudy hazy golden amber orange with dirt like yeast sediments.

Head - Explosive four-finger head with crumpety off-white foams which seems to last forever! Very thick and sticky lacing and very fizzy carbonation.

Aroma - Very fragrant and refreshing nice perfume, floral, honey, grapefruit, plum / dark fruit, vanilla, light caramel, light banana, malt, and spices. Grapefruit aroma becomes more intense as the beer warms.

Taste - Muted, light sweet malt, with caramel, burnt toffee, Belgian yeast, liquorices, dark fruit, strong cloves, spices, brett, pretty strong bitter lime, citrus, and herbal hops.

Body - Medium body, quite thin but slick palate.

Mouth Feel - Abbey Dubbel-based, dominated by very strong and herbal hoppiness. Sweetness is really low, fused with intense spiciness, brett, burnt toffee and dark-fruits. 

Hoppiness - this is THE headlines, great in refreshing floral aroma, touch of fresh grapefruit taste, and expressive dynamic bitterness. Wow! Astringency is a tad low, but good enough to leave a lingering nice finish.  

After Taste - Pretty dry, very easy and tempting to mouth.

Comments: With such a cocky bottle and only features one brew, I knew this monastery is up to something and I expect nothing less from its beer. Bang on! It really stands tall against other tasty Trappist beers all by its own - tastes like a fully hopped up Dubbel, hugely impressive visually with big lasting head and lacing; Its floral, perfumey and grapefruit aroma is so refreshing that is a good indication of a well-made and well-hopped beer. Its low sweetness - so subdued - a trait which I normally dont like for Trappists / Abbeys, is well complemented by good dose of clove and spiciness. An altogether unique and great tasting and sensory experience!

P.S. I am so glad I picked this one for my 200th RB review, and what a way to celebrate! # 300, here I come!

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2016 330ml bottle. Cloudy orange body with a huge orange tainted fluffy head. Aromas of hops, light bread, dough, and tropical fruits. Notes of yeast, bitter orange, pepper, ginger and citrus. Dry/bitter aftertaste. Fizzy carbonation.

330ml bottle. Amber goodness with frothy head and lacing. Aroma of Champagne, fresh-baked bread, mild fruits. Taste was moderately sweet with a strong malt grounding. Dry and warming with a nice, lingering bitter aftertaste. Excellent, but not as life-changing as some of my friends would have me believe.
Great color. Nice head. Cloves, orange rind, Belgian yeast, biscuit, mild sour. Medium dry finish, very nice!

Teak coloured body with creamy head, whiff of basement, yeast and malt, but there are some notes of hops to. Complex taste: besides the yeasty flavours, there are also bitter almonds, chocolate, some fruit, pepper, clove and cinnamon. I love the design of both the 330ml bottle and the glass the beer was served in. (Blå Rock, Tromsø- 5.Jul.2011)
A really very good beer. Aftertaste dry, witch combines with the rest of this great beer.
Been a Chimay red fan forever, love this. Smooth, simple and gimmickless. New favorite.

2008 in 2013  Purchased at a liquidation center.  Mold growing around bottle cap. Chunks of very dark yeast in the bottom of this one.  Smells of bananas wood, and swamp water.  Lasting frothy head.  Tastes of typical yeasty bananas.  Very nice dry finish slightly tart.  This was about as palatable as a basement taste beer gets for me.
August 2010. From bottle. Poured orange color with a white head. Aromas of citrus fruits, Belgian yeast, malts and hops. Balanced and complex.

11.2 oz bottle to gold rimmed Trappist glass. Hazy caramel color with a vigorous, huge off white head. Yeast, citrus, clove and mild banana aromas. Orangey citrus, clove, mild spices and a slightly bitter finish. Medium body with a smooth and refreshing mouthfeel.

Oranje-amberkleur, grote,dichte,plakkerige kraag, het ziet er goed uit. Aroma van gist,mout en wat fruit. Smaakt behoorlijk bitter,  vage sinaasappelschil, wat peper. Droge afdronk. Niet echt mijn ding deze orval.

Bottle bought at systembolaget. 4 months after bottelling. This is my new favourite. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This an amazing beer ! It has a very special taste, you love it or you hate it.
Bottle 0.33l at Kaunis Kampela, Helsinki. Colour is clear orange with large white head. Aromas and flavours: Sourness, berries, Belgian yeast, hops, spices, dryness and malts.
Bottle at 8C. Not very complex but nice aroma, color and head. I was expecting more, but still a great beer.

Bottle. Poured a hazy golden amber with a persistent and excessive white head. Scent is a nice hoppy aroma (noble?) with a twinge of Belgian sweetness. Taste is citrus/grapefruit, and light breadiness with a bitter finish that lingers just long enough. Solid beer overall. A very interesting Belgian as it is a blend of Belgian and IPA styles.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cloudy amber pour with white head. Spice, fruit and hops in the aroma. Spicy hop and fruit taste. Dry citrus hop finish.
toast, roasty, earthy, woody, golden, cloudy, minimal white head,slightly sour strong flavorfull body, sticky, creamy, long finish, long finish,

Bottle 0.33 L.
Hazy amber body with a huge, rocky, tan head, fully lasting with a very good lacing; high density of tiny particles.
Malty (some caramel) and hoppy aroma (bitter orange) with notes of alcohol, spices, fruits (cherry?) and wood.
Flavour is mainly sweet at the beginning, with a bitter character that becomes more evident in the long-lasting, dry finish.
Light-to-medium body with a dry texture; lively carbonation; light alcoholic warming in the finish.
Great "meditation" beer, as complex as a liquor...

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2014 Pours a beautiful orange beer. The smell is great too. Smells like gum, really sweet, strawberries. It tastes nice bitter and combines good with little sweetness. The palate is weaker. Watery and thin texture, the carbon is nice tho. - Arjan
A goldenorange pour with a beautiful head. Taste is orange/citrusfruit with some spices and a nice bitter ending. Nice balance.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2013 Its a slighly odd beer which gets only better the more you drink it. Its even a good beer to drink to get a neutral palate again. Has a fruity hoppy dry base with some saltiness to it. Spices, malts, dried fruits. Unique beer! Should be on your to drink list.

Pours a brownish red. Aroma of spicy syrup. Taste is malty with a peppery spice.  Not bad. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very Nice taste , a good aroma , amazing orange colour . A very good beer for everyday and every hour. And In these appreciaton days Even more special . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home. Has a orange amber colour with a heavy off-white whipped eggwhite-like head. Looks pretty carbonated. The aroma is sour with a touch of oak, heather, bubble gum, rowanberries and fruity cider vinegar. Some spices in the end. Malty and sour flavours with bread, marzipan and a berry vinous, and a bit dry, ending. Some peppery notes as well. Slick mouth feel, and has a medium bitterness. One of a kind beer with a nice oaky and sour touch.

Buena cerveza trapista, pero no me llega como el resto, quizás por su sabor floral excesivo. La apariencia es impresionante, no pierde la espuma en ningún momento, con un bonito color miel. Huele mucho desde él principio a campo, flores y frutas. En boca entra súper suave y se queda un rato el sabor, ideal para quienes les gusten estas cervezas florales. Puedo repetir sin problemas.
Gedronken bij dutchdrebus, bruin oranje van kleur, stevige schuimkraag, ruikt en smaakt fruitig, zoet, kruidig, kaneel

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2014 Color ámbar-dorado con espuma blanca persistente. Aroma lupulado, floral y cítrico. En boca muestra de inicio los matices cítricos, para pasar inmediatamente a un amargor intenso y que se extiende hasta el regusto. Bien carbonatada, es de textura media, si bien su intenso sabor no la hace fácil de beber. Excelente.

Easy to see why this is a favorite of so many beer drinkers. Nose is all fruits and sugary phenols with cloves and yeast and a bit of lemon zest. Flavor is all of that, amplified. The Belgian yeast is pronounced - more phenols and esters. A bit of a tropical fruit flavor to it - almost like pineapple, maybe. Not as sweet as expected. Finishes slightly sour and fizzy. Fantastic beer.

bottle @ Il Campiglio. La peggiore delle trappiste. Non datemi delleretico. é amara come una bitter ale. come pregio ha un buon aroma, intenso, quasi pungente, ma lascia da supito trasparire la luppolatura potente. manca di alcool e al gusto il luppolo sovrasta i malti, nascondendo quelli che probabilmente sarebbero sapori pregevoli. Non è equilibrata.

Bouteille 330ml. Couleur orangée foncée translucide, montagne de mousse blanche laissant une dentelle floconeuse. Arôme de brett, citron, levure, floral, légère note poivrée. Goût de brett, levure, zeste de citron, amertume en fin de bouche, cuir en arrière-goût, finale sèche. Carbonation moyenne-élevée, corps moyen.

Nose is spices, fresh, herbs. Looks very nice, wheat, perfect leyer of white foam. cloudy wheat is colour. Taste is very refreshing, easy to drink, subtile and elegant. Nothing dominating, maybe accept the brett flavour of the spices, but it blends in well. Palate is when you drink something and it gets bigger in your mouth, even though the palate is quite thin. Same feeling with many trappist beers. Quite nice beer
Everything beer should be, all time favorite readily available beer on the market. This would be the desert island, last meal and reason I could never stop drinking beer. Game over.

Medium-thick white foam over a copper-amber-honey color, some cloudiness. Very outspoken and good freshness, truly outstanding.  An excellent brew, let there be no doubt about that, different from the other  trappist beers I have tasted.

POurs hazy orange with a fluffy white head. Aroma: perfumy, light sout apples, tropical fruits, some funky notes, dust, hops. Taste: bitter, slightly sweet notes of fruits, berries, slightly tart funkiness, brett, citrus hops, ovverripe fruits. Complex and nice. Slightly overcarbonated ofr my taste. Awesome brew!

UPDATED: APR 2, 2013 #100 rating for this special beer.
33cl bottle.
Appearance: very nice and stable head, typical amber like color of the orval.
Nose: bitter, very fruity, some sourness noticeable.
Taste: very subtle sweetness, heavy pleasant bitterness, very soft carbonation. Amazing brew for its 6,2%

Bottle at Porterhouse Cork. Pours a hazy gold with a lasting pillowy white head. Aroma is strong banana, caramel and bread. An initial slightly artificial sweetness is followed by a lightly balanced combination of bitter, sour and spicy notes. Quite sour aftertaste, with a lively enough carbonation and a medium slightly buttery mouthfeel. Quite disappointed with this for a Trappist - its fine, but doesnt go down quite as smoothly or taste quite as natural as most others. Decent, and will have to try again before my mind is definitely made up on it.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Norway. Pour a hazy orange colour, with a huge foamy head that lasts the session out. Aroma is malty sweet, a rich variety of fruits and spices are present. Medium mouthfeel, with a sweet, fruity and spicy flavour. Nice Belgian, but not through the roof.

Poured a deep copper with a lovely foamy head that stuck around to the end.  Smells of citrus and grass.  Taste is floral, caramel, with a citrus finish and a hint of bitterness.  Officially one of the best beers I have ever sampled.
2011 bottle, 6.2%. Lovely fluffy foam that sticks around. Deep golden colour. Tase of all things good in the world - belgian yeast, brett, marzipan and caramel. Magic in a bottle.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2017 March 2013 - Bottle in Richmond, as Orval, Nov 2012 vintage.  Explosive upon opening.  Huge head.  Smells of lemon.  Flavour is really balanced - a soft medicinal lemon flavour with a light bitterness.  Spice is there but mild.  Good level of sweetness.  (4.0)
Feb 2015 - Bottle in Richmond, Nov 2014 vintage.  Hazy dark orange, sparkling, big foamy off-white head is permanent.  Aroma is musty, tangerine and lemon, mashed newspaper.  Body is medium, soft carbonation, slightly foamy.  Taste is light, dry and peppery, soft lemon and mixed citrus, Dettol, gluey, tangy finish with a light musty bitterness.  (3.6)
June 2015 - 2010 vintage shared at Pauls.  Thanks!  Aroma is bretty lemon and cola.  Taste is tangy lemon, light earth and flowers.  Has mellowed.  (3.8)
Feb 2016 - Bottle in Richmond, Oct 2012 vintage.  Brilliant orange, highly sparkling, massive foamy head.  From the skittle bottle to the glass, everything about this beer looks great.  Aroma is so sherbety, bretty, dirty-yet-clean, citrus.  Body is light, foamy.  Taste is citric, dry and medicinal, a touch metallic, some soap, powdered sherbet, a little salty.  Theres a lot to like here.   (4.0)
July 2016 -  Bottle at home.  18 months old to the day.   Aroma is muted dirty bretty funk.  Taste is semi-dry citrus and sherbet.  At this age it tastes great - a pretty unique balance between the hops and brett.  But from experience Id say it gets slightly better with an extra year.  (3.9)
August 2016 -  2006 vintage, now over 10 years old, shared at GBBF 2016.  Aroma is apple, bretty.  Carbonation has held up very well.  Taste is smooth, citrussy, a touch papery, dry and bretty, metallic.  Hasnt gone as sour as I thought it might.  Drier with a touch of papery oxidation.  (3.6)
Feb 2017 - This is just a few days over 5 years old.  Dark amber, clear, highly sparkling with an enduring beige head.  Aroma is apple cider vinegar and fabric plasters.  Body is light, tingly carbonation.  Taste is tangy apple, old dried citrus peel, some light sherry.  Quite malty with very little brett character.  A bit past its best this one but still very drinkable.  (3.2)
Apr 2017 - 18 month old bottle in Richmond - Oct 2015.  Highly sparkling, huge foamy head.  Aroma is like a caramel-infused gueuze.  Smells great.  Taste has some caramel sweetness with some mint and drying metallic spicy notes and a salty, lightly bitter linger.  Teresa likes this one.  Having tried this a few times now Ive come to the conclusion that it will never blow me away. But if you like spicy saison-like beers, this one is up there. (3.9)

Bottle, pours pristine copper with sparse, rocky, ivory head, aroma is asserive blend of funk, dank, some herbal esters, really incredible, flavor profile is crisp, round, and delicious, effervescent carbonation and just a bit of pithy bitterness. An absolutely outstanding beer.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2013 Bottle pours a murky blood-orange with a huge tan head. Took awhile to dissipate, good lacing. This batch was at 6.9% ABV. Aroma is sweet, malty, and a bit of fruit. Taste is rich malt with some pepper on the aftertaste.
UPDATED: JUN 12, 2017 Very nice beer, can taste notes of spiciness.  Tried again in 2017, notable funkiness.  Slightly ciderous.
330ml bottle. Pours a cloudy blood orange, with one finger fluffy white head. Aromas of wheat, orange, slight clove, and banana. Taste is clove, banana, wheat, orange, and grass.
UPDATED: AUG 22, 2015 Flaska från Systembolaget. Grumlig halmgul vätska med livligt högt skum. Doft av läder, stall och källartrapp. Sträv, söt och torr, på samma gång. Lång eftersmak. En höjdare!

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2013 Re-rate: Bottle that has aged more than a year. Definitely became better through ageing. Therefore I raised my rate score. - First rate:  Sexy bottle. Beautiful dark color. In the beginning served something too cold so that a part of its tones  remained hidden. Then fine.

11.2 ounce bottle poured and enjoyed at home.

Aroma - Bright sweet fruit smell, maybe a little grapefruit in there.
Appearance - Pours a murky dark orange color with TONS of frothy white head. Took a while to pour the entire bottle into a glass because of the amount of head and the fact that it wouldnt go down. Had to pour ounce by ounce and wait for head to slowly dissipate.
Taste - Taste is pretty good. Slight sour taste. Lots of fruit flavor and carbonation with a strong taste of alcohol even though the alcohol content is only 6.9%. 
Palate - Light. Lots of carbonation. No strong lingering flavors. 
Overall - Good Belgium for the price. Taste is pleasant, light and fruity. Lots of carbonation and goes down really smooth, very easy to drink. Enjoyable for sure.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2013 Bottle. Pours hazy amber with a huge fluffy white head. Aroma is really nice with hops. fruitiness, citric notes and brett. Taste is fruity, yeast, citric, some sweetness and a very nice and balanced sourish brett note. High carbonation which makes this a very drinkable and refreshing beer.
Pours a hazy gold with a wispy thin white head.  Earthy barnyard aroma.  Crisp refreshing flavor with barnyard and fruity notes.  Dry finish with a high level of carbonation.
