A 2011 bottle.  Partly hazy and bubbly orange with large off white head.  Aroma banana/esters, sugary malts, yeast.  Medium body, significantly carbonated.  Flavor is yeasty and malty.  Some cloves and is fruity yet quite dry.  Interesting and well made but one of those beers I found myself appreciating a little more than enjoying.

pours a hazy deep amber, healthy medium head in an orval glass. Smells..hoppy and yeasty..some sour fruity notes. Tastes..hoppy and malty with a dark fruity, yeasty slight funk. Is not the first and will not be the last time. sensational.
Poured amber with a frothy white head. Aroma of sweet spiced fruit and malt. Medium body, slightly lively, flavour is a bit cardboardy, mild spice and citrus and pretty dry.

La Orval est très effervescente et offre une mousse très généreuse, un peu comme le fait la Duvel. La couleur est blond ambré, légèrement orangée, voilée.. Nez acide dagrumes et de houblons. En bouche, lacidité est très évidente et cette bière est très sèche, amère, florale. Une astringeance semblable à celle de la lime est également remarquable. Pas mal, mais pas pour tout le monde. Je mattendais à un produit belge plus malté et sucré et à des levures plus fruitées, ce qui nest pas le cas. Résultat, bière très aromatique, acide et houblonnée.
UPDATED: JUL 26, 2013 Lyst øl med masse, masse skum. God lukt av sitrusfrukter og humle. God frisk smak av sitrus og bitter humle. Bittersøt avslutning.

d une couleur orange ambre avec cel blanc on sens tout de suite un cote floral melanger a une note fruite comme abricot .losque qu on la deguste on na gout de houblons floral et qui se melange un fruite sucre de abricot tres bonne bieres(rate 64 )

Bottle from mane liquor. Pours a hazy orange with a decent frothy white head. Lively carbonation! Nose packed full of yeast, banana, floral hops, apricots and sour warheads. Taste is quite lively with more yeast and banana coming through. Very mild bitterness makes this beer go down all too easy. Kinda reminds of a stronger version of feral white. Pretty happy with this one! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled November, 2010. Pours almost ruby red, off-white head. Nose is old musty basement, some more funk, banana bread , pool water, bandaid, smoke. In spite of the chlorine and band aid this is an incredibly smelling beer, calling it complex would be an understatement. Taste is chocolate, oak, spices, mild funk, a finish that is both tart and lightly hoppy. Lingering chalky banana. So complex. Ive had this fresh and this is a completely different (and much better) beer with some age on it.

Uploading old ratings that were missing comments. Unique for a Trapist beer thanks to how dry it is and a touch of funk. Really enjoyed it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours hazy pale orange with a huge creamy off white head. Hints of banana, yeast, hay aroma. Light body, medium bitterness and sour, very dry. Way too much carbonation and an abrupt dry hop finish. Not my favorite.
Bottle. Hazy orange beer with a offwhite creamy head. Fruity, yeasty, hoppy and floral aroma. Fruity, yeasty flavour with nice lemon notes.
Birra scura, corposa, poco frizzante.Schiuma abbondante, cremosa e persistente. Molto buona

A fine Belgian Ale, it always surprised me, considering the depth of flavour in this beer that is so weak in alcohol relative to other Belgian "big" beers. Its even weaker than Leffe Blonde. This is a compliment rather than a criticism. the ability to create such a dry full flavoured beer that doesnt send you to sleep after three bottles is greatly appreciated in my manor. The beautifully designed bottle and glassware add to the feeling that you are onto something very special here.  While still available in many bars it getting harder and harder to find, no longer available in. Belgian supermarkets only specialist beer shops seem to have a regular stock these days.

Bouteille 330ml. De couleur orangée foncée et voilée. Nez de levures fruitées aux notes sûres (pommes, léger dagrumes, cerises), légèrement épicées et aux notes sauvages, moyen de houblon floral et légèrement herbeux avec des effluves dalcool très doux. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement élevé-moyen ainsi quune texture aux faibles notes crémeuses. Goût de levures fruitées légèrement sauvages et aigres  (zeste dagrumes, moyen de pommes aux petites notes cidreuses, notes de cerises, faibles traces de pelures de bananes) et épicées (complexe) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute de faibles notes de céréales avec des notes salées. Parallèlement, lon retrouve une moyenne amertume sèche de houblon floral  aux notes herbeuses avec des notes épicées (poivrées). Post-goût moyen et sec, moyen-léger amer de houblon très floral et aux notes herbeuses avec un goût de levures fruitées aux notes acides (zeste dagrumes, pelures de pommes) et épicées (poivre doux).

Pours hazy light copper to orange with huge beige frothy top, mid lacing. Aroma - like old, matured drink, medium sour, hoppy quite, minimal malty almost no sweet, maybe some fruity notes, but very far away. No typical yeasty profile like Belgian ales, not so Belgian ale-y, weird. Taste is min sweet, light sour, meduim bitter, spicy a bit on tongue. Weird flavour of old granmaa. Body- middle, slick, average texture. Overall - one time sample, maybe after very ruined brews this could be very desireble.
Bottle. Dark orange w small white lacing. Really good aroma w the hops and yeast in good balance.some hints of barrel aging. Dry, fresh and sweet after a while and with rising temperature.

Derrière sa mousse généreuse et crémeuse se cachent des arômes de fruits rouge, de sherry.Très longue en bouche, elle commence par une attaque franche et légèrement piquante pour finir sur un retour sec et sucré.
Excellente balance entre amertume et sucre.

33cl bottle, poured into a trappist glass. Dark golden colour with substantial white froth, nice. Yeast, toasty notes, hops and sweetness in both aroma and taste. Sometimes looks like caramel. Classic and wonderful beer, just love it every time I drink it.

Pours a glowing, hazy, burnt orange, with a large, lacy, white-corn head. Smell is of light, floral strawberry, sharp white cheddar, and wheat cracker. Taste starts with light, fresh barley and subtle earthy hops. The finish is dry, and lightly bitter, leaving a tingling on the tongue. In my opinion, while I think this beer is "okay" on its own, this beer pairs phenomenally with a sharp cheddar, or blue cheese.

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2016 Orval... The beer that never stops evolving. I was a huge fan of this beer. Its aroma used to be amazing, Leather, grassy, brett all over the place, caramel, cereal,... A rustique amazing brew. Last few years Orval has become a beer thats rather unbalanced at every different batch. Im drinking a 10/05/16 (bottle date), and im getting a highly carbonated, dry, barnyard, bretted aroma, but nothing much like the Orval I drank 10 years ago. Taste is brett, alcohol and dryness, but then again very sticky... Btw, i tried that same bottledated orval in June (one month old) and it was yoghurt (lacto) all over the place. 
Unbalanced, uncontroled, unappreciated (on my behalf). "Less is more"

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2013 This beer is very dry with a slight spice.  Very light mouth feel and a large off white head. Not a fan at all..I think I may have had a skunked beer after reading others reviews

UPDATED: APR 18, 2014 Bottle. Hazy yellow orange with a thick, forever lasting, lacing, bubbly white head. Aroma is wood, apricot, lime, horse, light tart, fruit, light earthy, light bready, dusty. Taste is light/medium sweet and light/medium bitter. Medium body, oily texture, lively carbonation. Light bitter and dry finish. Complex but at the same time very easy to drink. Comes at a very reasonable price so why not keep a couple of these in the fridge at all times.

Abundante espuma blanca, de color naranja turbio. En nariz muy aromatica con notas citricas y mucho lupulo. Recuerda al champagne. Entrada dulce en boca con presencia de citricos y lupulo en el postgusto.
Mooi rood-amber bier met flinke witte schuimkraag, die lang aanwezig blijft. Complex aroma: hop, citrus (grapefruit), kruidig. Droog in de mond, maar niet vervelend. Vooral een lekker bittere smaak!

Bottle from the LCBO, this beer pours a majestic rustic red with a large frothy head. The aroma is beautiful, a complex mixture of spices, yeast, and subtle fruits. The taste is a balanced mixture of dryness, spicy, some citrus, dough, yeast, and bitterness perfection. This is what beer should taste like!

Bottle at spuyten duyvil. Really unique aroma. Extremely subtle smooth but interesting taste. Pours a regal red amber

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2013 One of my favourite beers. I didnt like it the first time but I grew fond of it. Pours amber hazy with oversized, cloudy head that seems to last forever. A lot of carbonation, bitterness, sourness, hoppy. Very well balanced. A beautifull beer!

Clássica. Cor laranja escuro. Abundante e persistente espuma. Amora um pouco doce, com bastante aroma de lúpulo. Aroma cítrico de casca de laranja, tangerina. Especiarias ao fundo. Sabor com pouco dulçor, amargo (lúpulo), cítrico. Sabor bem amargo no inicio, reduzindo ao passar do tempo. Amargor persistente na boca. Excelente! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled 2-29-12 (Leap day!) 6.9% ABV. Poured slowly, a nice looking hazy orange-golden with a larger bubbled off-white head that starts thick and then dissipates slowly to a thin cap leaving zero lace. Enjoyable nose with pear and pomegranate notes, some lemony citrus, floral notes, perhaps some hibiscus, touches of dust and hay, some tart cherries. Somewhat sweet, fairly bitter, and just a touch tart. Lighter bodied, effervescent, vibrant, with an earthy dry finish. A really cool beer with nice yeast and hop components. Its not always going to be worth the $5.50 for a bottle, but once in a while it will.

Grande e copiosa schiuma pannosa e lentissima a scendere, colore ambrato opalescente e torpido, aroma erbaceo primaverile e di etere fruttato, al palato buona carbonazione e grande percezione di amaro secco e sgrassante, seguito da una certa dolcezza agrumata e maltata, un classico tra le birre trappiste, unica nel suo genere.

Pale hazy orange colour
Huge white foamy head.
Aromas of banana, lemon, 
This stays at the front of the mouth, doesn't quite fill it out, and only last a second, I see where the "dryness" description comes from. 
Diff style than the other Belgians but not quite for me, lacks the body and structure you'd expect.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours cloudy golden with a white foamy head. Indescribable spice that hints at lemon. Very smooth, obviously a top-shelf beer.

UPDATED: SEP 22, 2014 Rating a legend is tricky. For people brought upon Michael Jacksons Pocket Beer Guide for Sainsburys, looking for decent beer amid a sea of Worthingtons Cream Flow, Orval was always something special. but does it still stand out now? The bottle is cool. The glass is cool. The beer pours with a monster head. It is still a law unti itself, dalways dry, part tart and sour, winey and fruity, malty and hoppy. Bottle conditioning still sends it off in random directions. I love this stuff.

Re-rate series! I bought a whole box of these little beauties, a June 2014 batch, and will try over several months and years to see how it ages. First sample in September 2014, so pretty young at three months. Amber gold, quite high carbonation, billowing head. Sour aromas. Fresh taste, lovely interplay of hops and funk, quite bitter, moreish. So good.

Appearance:  Explosive carbonation, massive frothy white head.  Semi opaque orange golden colour.
Aroma:  Gorgeous, grapefruity, spicy and peppery, with some aniseed or licorice notes.  After letting sit awhile, I got some candy cane/floss notes.
Flavour:  Juicy malty flavours on impact, leading into a fruity bone dry center and quick bitter finish.
Mouthfeel:  Zingy carbonation on impact, medium bodied, some alcohol warmth lingers.
Overall:  Very impressed, I am grabbing at least 6 of these to cellar and try one every 6 months.

Bottled June 14 of 2012, opened on February 23 of 2013.  6.9% alcohol.  Tried in both a standard pint glass and a Chimay goblet; the goblet was much better for discovering the full aroma.   Pours a hazy orange with a massive head.  Incredibly spicy and aromatic, distinctive Belgian yeast aromas and some banana.  Taste is s slightly sour and very dry.  Probably the driest beer that I have had.  Good body.  Long aftertaste.  Definitely not my style, but it is worth trying once.
A huge success!  VERY lively from the bottle, producing a thick never ending head. Spicy citrus with some coriander (?) and pepper. Then deeper more vinaceous in character. Ends clean and crisp.

bere una birra, gustare una leggenda, una storia, una religione. Le radici dellEuropa nella birra migliore che si possa bere. delle sapienti mani confezionano questa poesia liquida che dallarcadia belga porta in Paradiso. meditate gente, meditate! deponete la vanga, e bevetevi una Orval; scheda tecnica: il colore e di un biondo ambrato torbido. la schiuma, copiosissima, diventa pannosa e solida, e si aggrappa con passione al vetro del bicchiere. il profumo di erbe selvatiche luppolose si diffonde nellaria fin da subito il gusto e uno spettacolo che guida le pupille nelliperuranio. io la preferisco da giovane. ma e reliogione... e anche invecchiata e uno spettacolo! prendete e bevetene tutti!!!

Bottle at home. Pour is deep orange/copper with a huge, fluffy white head, that seems to get bigger by the minute. Big herbal, medicinal, and band-aid characteristics, light funk, somewhat tangy, bready, citrusy, tropical fruits, pineapple, and bretty aroma. Nice! Taste is fruity, herbal, big band-aid, biscuity, slightly tangy, bretty, mango, pineapple, light pear, spice, medicinal, and orange with a tangy, somewhat tart finish. Medium mouthfeel with high carbonation. Definitely a classic and could easily be the best beer you can get for the money - so complex and full of flavor, yet so easy-to-drink.  Why havent I bought a case of this stuff? Such a nice beer.

Belgian style beer tasting night. Bottle, 10 months old. Orange amber beer with large head that produces a fizz when poured. Aroma of orange peel and hops. The taste is again oranges, sour hops and a little peppery. The palate is very smooth and dry. An excellent beer, my favourite Belgian so far.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text:
Appearance: hazy brown color, nice thick white head, retains thick head and laces nicely

Aroma: fresh, lemon, cherry, smells good, creamy

Taste: hint of lemon and molasses, spice, some bitterness at the finish, bit of sweetness, grass

Palate: smooth, slightly bitter aftertaste

Overall: unique beer, lots of subtle flavors but no prominent ones, one of the best head retentions I've seen in a while, not as dry as I was expecting, drinking 2 years 3 months after bottling

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2013 Color is hazy amber with huge rocky head. Brilliant! Aroma is very strong includes yeasty and fruity. Taste is rich, lots of fruity notes, herbs, pint of yeast, wonderful hops flavour at finish. Full body. Aboslutely remerkable! One of the best beer I?ve ever drank!
My absolute favorite beer, no beer to compare this with ! Very sharp when young , gets softner when older but still great !

This is an incredibly beautiful beer pouring an opaque golden brown with a thick head of persistent foam. It is incredibly dry over a rich malty base. A good beer to sip but it is too dry for my taste. Worth trying and a good classic trappist beer.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2013 Pours a hazy golden yellow from the bottle with fluffy white head and good lacing. Aroma of tart fruit and Belgian yeasty esters, taste follows with a champagne like mouth feel and thin body. Pretty good, bottle conditioning makes it, otherwise it would be shite.

This is in my view the best Trappist on the world. Orval even looks good with a great foam head and a nice dark pale color. Great Strisselspalt nose and balanced taste with a long lasting hoppy aftertaste. The hard hop is more expressive in an Orval older than 6 months.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone By Belleketels

I had to try the beer that allegedly stirred up the modern American craft brewing scene, and it didnt disappoint.  It reminded me a lot of Unibroues work: copper color, white and ample head (the bottle runneth over with the foam), sizzling with carbonation, floral and lemons in the nose, fruit and yeast in the taste. Light bodied, long lasting grass flavors. I wouldnt go as far to say my mind was blown, but I found it really enjoyable. Its a little taste of brewing history thats led to bigger and bolder ambitions.

Pours hazy orange with a billowing head of resilient foam that  finally dwindled to a rocky cap with dense, sticky lacing.  A spectacular pour into a tulip.  Nose is complex and kept expanding as it warmed.  Sweet Belgian yeast, apples, floral, banana, some medicinal alcohol, a little carmel malt poking through all that bright fruit and brett funk and ultimately finds some spice character. Taste is superb.  Relaxed, smooth, full without heaviness, some lemon, some hay and horse blanket.  No alcohol on the palate at all.  Drinks very dry and leaves a long bitter finish that isnt tart or sour.  Its earthy and hop bitter.  Very impressive, indulgent,  full of traditional character and easily approachable for a session.

Yeux : Opaque et orangée, comme un coucher de soleil derrière dépais nuage (ici les nuages sont représentés par une mousse épaisse et crémeuse). Cest poétique, mais cest vrai!

Nez : La perception est difficile. Arôme fruité et légèrement floral. On sent déjà le houblon. Quand trop dodeurs agréables se mélangent, on se contente de dire : ça sent bon!

Bouche : Alors là, cest vraiment amer. Mais comme lamertume est un goût qui sapprend (un peu comme pour les olives), quand on aime cest pour toujours. On garde le palais imprégné de houblon plusieurs minutes après la dernière gorgée. La bière est relativement forte, mais tellement goûteuse quon oublie lalcool dans une mer de saveurs.

Gorge : La sensation sèche initiée en bouche sallonge en beauté en arrière-goût. Et dire que Molson Dry se vante dêtre sans arrière-goût Je vous jure quavec la Orval, on ne sen passerait pas!

Verdict : Difficile de faire mieux dans le genre. La Orval se laisse boire. Voilà une bière quon achète une à la fois pour un moment de dégustation unique. Bret Power!

330 mL bottle.  Pours an orange tinged amber with a huge white head.  Aromas of spicy yeast, lemon zest, candle wax, green herb and hop. Surprisingly light on the palate, good carbonation and very refreshing.  Dry and flavorful, a great brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle. Cloudy copper body, big yellow head, medium retention. Aroma of yeast, fresh grass, apples and spices. Taste: lots of spices, mostly pepper, yeast, bitter herbal hops, autumn leaves. Light.

I was lucky enough to find a bottle that had already been aged for 3 years.  So Im reviewing that bottle.  Taste is very sweet at the front with cherries, blackberry, rasberry, and other sweet/sour fruit.  Once it reaches the back of the pallet there is a sour/bitter taste that doesnt explode, but is strong enough to take notice of.  Excellent beer when aged.  Ill have to try a regular one and tell the difference.

ABV 6,2%
I got this beer at my local liquor store without knowing anything about it. It was just another option among all the other beers on the shelf. After coming home though and reading all those positive reviews, I was looking forward to drinking it. Instead, for a bunch of reasons, it stayed in my fridge till now.
A uniquely shaped bottle of 330 ml, with just one small, modest label mentioning the beers name and other info, around the neck of the bottle. Poured into a chalice, after letting it warm up a little bit, since it has a recommended drinking temperature of 12°-14° C. Dark amber coloured, with a two finger head, white in colour, with some yelow spots every here and there.. Foam is thick in texture. Quite a few bubbles rising to the surface. Head has an average retention.Once most of it is gone, a thick enough part stays behindand covers the surface.
Aroma was quite complex when I sniffed it the moment I opened the bottle, with the most obvious smell being a fig aroma.. After smelling it from the glass, I sense plums, pears, some light caramel aromaand maybe some old redgrapes. Great aroma.
Taste is great too, somehow in the middle between fruity sweet and hoppy bitter, with the scale turning on the bitterness side when it comes to the aftertaste. Its very difficult to name some flavours exactly. There are fruity flavours, some clove too. Now I perceive some white wine flavour and some spices too. This beer is so complex, to the point you get another flavour with every sip. Alcohol very well concealed.
Full body with average carbonation, a bit tart on the palate.
Overall, a fantastic beer. Its complexity makes for a great sipping beer. Those monks are doing a great job at their brewery.

Lively carbination as a big, light tan, foamy head forms above the liquid. Light brown/amber color. Aroma is of fruits, brett, hops, and leather. Creamy mouthful, although easy to drink. Lacking a little in taste, but still complex enough to pick up multiple flavors. Good beer.
Pleasant aroma, taste and palate, but Im not thrilled. [short review due to it coming from my backlog]

Pretty good, but a very bitter aftertaste that does not compare well with other Godly beers. According to what I have read the last monk to be the brewer of this beer was in 1793. Seculars now run the brewery, but profits go to maintaining the abbey and charities. The real outrage is that the monks get a version that is half the alcohol. Godfrey Daniel!

À loeil : 
Bière rousse foncée et ténébreuse, très pétillante. Une mousse forte coiffe le tout.
Au nez :
Petit nez de conifère et dalcool. Il cache le goût, ce qui peut être une qualité comme un défaut.
Au goût : 
Plus doux que le nez. Sucre et amertume séquilibre. La finale est un peu trop sèche à mon avis. Sans trop deffervescence, le houblon a toute la place ! En 3 mots : corsée, épicée, forte
330ml瓶を購入。{ via Beer Buddy for iPhone
11.2 ounce bottle at Anchor and Hope; fruity aroma and flavor, great palate.

Great head retention and color. A lot of body and finishes very very dry. Flavor was lacking compared to some of the other Trappist beers. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml.  Pours a cloudy honey colour with a massive head of fluffy off-white bubbles.  Aroma is faint, but unfortunately the most noticable scent can be described as "barnyard".  There is also a pretty heavy smell of ciders of the alcoholic variety, as well as dough, light spice, and a faint floral note.  The taste is surprisingly dry, with heavy bread notes, light cider notes, spice, metallic notes, and a taste that makes me think of Unicum bitters.  Add to that, manure.  Sorry, definitely not for me.
UPDATED: FEB 11, 2013 Probably one of the best beers that I ever tasted. The aroma is great and I like the way it pours into the glass and creates a thick head. Definitely a beer to sip slowly.
Great foamy head! Nose is spicy and sweet. Another quality solid trappist! Loved every mouthful of this one. Just the right tartness and punch! Way to go

2013/01/21 - Pours a hazy light amber color with a large frothy head that leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is spices, dough, apple and citrus. Taste is sweet/ spicy up front and lightly bitter and dry to finish. Mouthfeel is medium to heavy. Not as smooth as I had hoped, but very good none the less

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Scents of dates, figs, sweet bread. Taste is unique, not easy to describe. Very dry, medium to high carbonation, but not sharp. Complex yet easily drinkable.
Si presenta piuttosto velata, aroma ricco di floreale, spezie e lievito. In bocca dapprima caramello, poi amaro erbaceo e floreale, secco e prolungato.

straight from the bottle citrus but probably hops..aroma is light hops. Yes somewhat sharp hops but mellows quickly..high alcohol but you would never know. Finishes slightly creamy slight lemon hops remains.
Carbonation seems low but  makes itself evident after swallowing (haha)
There is a caramel or toffee..cane sugar style mild that knocks down the hoppiness good beer.Smooth

Nice caramel/toffee brownlike color. Strong aroma of spices and alcohol. Bitter taste with a touch of alcohol in the background, and a bitter aftertaste.

Mooie caramel/toffee bruinkleurig bier. Sterk aroma van kruiden en alcohol. Bitter gehemelte, bittere smaak met de lichte toets van alcohol op de achtergrond.

Bottle from the LCBO (6.9%). Pours a hazy deep orange with a lot of fine white head that dissipates a bit slowly. Smell is a bit sweet with some caramel, some grassy hops, and some definite yeast funky bready earthiness. Palate is on the lighter side of medium with a whole lot of frothy carbonation in the mouth. Taste is hard to describe, a bit sweet and acidic at first, the carbonation takes a strong hold and then tastes a bit bitter, and after the carbonation recedes youre left with a bitter hoppy flavour. Very interesting, though not really up my alley.

Tradicional saison belga, essa breja trapista tem características únicas. Primeiro, pq a abadia só produz um tipo de cerveja, o que a torna realmente singular. Segundo, por conta do aroma e paladar característico, com notas herbáceas; mas principalmente com forte nota de couro. Terceiro, pq é uma breja simplesmente espetacular! Alta carbonatação, de cor amarelo-cobre, com um corpo médio e drinkability no ponto. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2013 aroma: caramel, grass, yeast
apparenza: amber, cloudy, frothy, 
gusto: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, 
palato: medium body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter, 
avendola bevuta tempo fa era doveroso riassaggiarla..aroma molto pulito e rinfrescante,lieviti,luppoli freschi e malto caramellato..gusto identico,deciso,fresco e netto col luppolo che spinge un pò di più,anche nel finale rendendola amarognola e piacevole..trappista insolita ma nettamente ok!

(Fresh 330ml bottle from LCBO, label 6.9% ABV) Pours a hazy dark brownish amber with a huge, very rocky head that quickly recedes with a little lace. Aroma is funky earth, floral hops, citrus pith, spice, alcohol. Flavour up front is slightly tart pale fruit, bit of grain, herbal with brett yeast, becoming spicy and vegetal with peppers, woody. Finishes with bitter citrusy hops, leather, black pepper, little bit of grain lingering too, dry but not astringent. Mouthfeel is creamy with frothy carb and an oily, fairly thick palate and not much booze in the mouth. A dry, brusque and spicy but very complex beer with a unique character and lots of hops for a Belgian.
Cerveza rubia ligeramente turbia. De olor muy floral. Sabor también floral, amargo. Cuerpo un poco graso. Una delicia.
Just love it or hate it, it makes you fell alive. PH too low because the fermentation profile and the wild yeast that is used.
Lekker blond bier, met straffe nasmaak. Een prettig biertje bij winters eten!!!!!!!

Bottle. Color is a hazy yellow. Head is HUGE and stays forever ...dammit. ;-) Smells a bit like banana, but not much more. Very very dry and has a very dominating taste of hops. Taste is roasty, spicy and woody. I usually love Belgian Ales but this is not really for me.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2014 Mild banana esters,  belgian yeast and sour notes in the aroma. Maybe a bit of floral hops. Hazy brown, huge foamy white head that lasts forever. Very complex, sweet malt comes first, then the sourness and a mild hop bitterness finish, very dry. Medium bodied but extremely carbonated. Complex and interesting brew.

1,5 years old bottle, labelled 5,6% abv. Pours brown, enormus off-white head. Aroma: alcohol, dark syrup, sharp notes of solvent (especially when warmer). Lots of dark fruits in the flavor; plums, dates, peach and such. Alcohol and solvent gives a bit of a sharp taste.

Nice hop flavor. Tastes earthy with some citrus notes. Nice amount of carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pure. Not a beer fot the modal drinker. A lot of hop and bitterness. Not too strong. More and more difficult to find, even in Belguim! My number 1!

330ml bottle, bottled 26/04/12. Pours a deep amber color with a big, soapy beige head that leaves lots of lace as it slowly recedes. Aroma has orange peel, light earthy funk, rich grains, mild citrus. Taste has biscuity malt, earthy hops, mild tart funk, slight leather, light citrus and a slightly bitter, dry finish. Mouthfeel is rich and sparkly with good carbonation. Classic.

Probably my least favorite trappist beer that I have had to date. Pours an amber/copper hue with a white head. Nose is of malt, some hops. Very one-dimensional. Almost like a "light" version of what a good trappist brew should be. None of the wonderful dried fruit character and belgian candy sugar notes. Just...boring. That being said if youre just getting into Belgians, then maybe give this one a try but if youre already a seasoned belgian/trappist drinker then this one is going to be very lackluster.
Amber color with ivory head. Floral, malty and citrous aroma. Light bitter at taste with frizzy carbonation.
Amberish colour, hopy, fruity and earthy aroma. Banane?Caramel? bitter, sour taste. alcohol after that. 2009 bottle.
Cloudy amber color with white head.  Spicy fruity aroma.  Fruity flavor with some spiciness.  Citrus hop finish.

Jag har så sjukt svårt för den här ölen. Vet att den hyllas av ölnördar till höger och vänster men jag tycker att den doftar och smakar solvarm spya. Thats it. En doft och smak jag bara stött på i åbro sigill julöl tidigare. Just den där typiska doften av en spya.

The champagne of beers, in my opinion. Have had this from fresh to 18 months old, and am aging some further for future evaluation. Always pours amber with a wild rocky head. Intense floral, spice and yeast aromas. Super-dry. Long, long finish. The stuff of memories.

Pours a cloudy iced tea brown with an aggressively frothy, thick white head that laces quite well. A sweet, almost melon-like aroma. Upon the first sip, the thick, soapy white head provides a soft, frothy mouthfeel that eventually fizzles down to a dry, hoppy flavor that leaves the tongue tingling with peppery effect. Overall, the flavor is delicate and there are notes of honeydew, spinach, lavender, and various peppers. Very solid trappist brew with a unique flavor and impeccable palate.

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2014 I had it 3 times, and every time I appreciated it better!
Very thick head, collapsing but stable. Lovely orange colour. Nose is bitter with vegetables and spices/flowers notes. Taste starts immediately very bitter, and very "winey", something very original, with acidic notes too. Carbonation is moderate, very nice. Bitterness lingers. Amazing.

Poured from a bottle.  Great appearance: hazy amber, foamy head that thins with nice lacing.  Flavor is good but for me not worth the price of the bottle.  Dominant theme is light lingering  bitter fruitiness.   

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I just had this beer and i have to accept its absolutely one of the best beers I ever tasted. Only the Sint Bernardus 12 seems to be close. The taste is very full and has a kind of wooden taste. The Westvleteren 8 is absolutely more fruity, but less exceptionnal. 

I absolutely recommend the beer and the website that helped me to get the beer for a good price (even if i dont know if this is allowed in my review: http://westvleteren12.webs.com/ ) 

Enjoye
Bottle shared with McTapps. Really disappointing due to its heavily bitter aftertaste. Aroma is a bit of sour cucumber. Not bad but not really tasteful.

Milky brown colour and a very big and steady head for the looks. Thin body and nose of bitter-sour lemon peel. Taste of cherry stones, dry barley, sour lemons and bitter hops. Very mouldy, dull and too sour. Would have given the beer probably a higher score if it would officially be a Wild/Sour Ale..
Zoute bitterige aanzet, waarna de bitterheid de boventoon overneemt en in de wrang-bittere afdronk weer enige plaats gunt aan het zoute element. De nasmaak is eerder droog

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2014 Second rating: 4 years aged bottle. Clear dark copper color, white head. Taste is lambic! Sour apples and cherrys, fruity, high co2. Taste is typical belgian, balanced, hops are gone, sweet notes, high co2.

First rating:2012 bottle at home. Hazy deep golden color, smooth white head. Malty aroma with sweetness, hops and some yeast. Nice taste, suprisingly quite strong hops, hint of sweetness, malty body, dry finish and some fruits maybe. 3.7.

Early rating...
Deep unclear amber with a lightly tinted head of foam thats fed by lively carbonation.
The nose is a bit sharp, combining yeast, hops and underneath it all a little candy sugar though not much, almost a smell of iron. Pleasant but not exceptional for an amber ale.
The taste is pretty aggressive, quite bitter and citric in the sense of a lime, rather than a more sour fruit. Its that citrussy bitterness that also keeps it from falling into the category refreshing.
The carbonation goes well with the "bite" of the first taste.
A delicate bitterness remains in the aftertaste as well as the faintest hint of sourness but little else, a fine taste but not that complex all in all.
Not really my thing at the time but definitely different and unique.

Pours a rather hazy light brown color with a very thick white head. Nose is actually a tad spicy, which is interesting. Taste has a bit of sweetness from the yeast, some of the spice tones, and yet just a smidge of bitterness. Feel is just a tad oily to me.

Pours a large frothy off-white head that mostly lasts. Body is hazy and sparkling with yellow to amber color. Aroma contains dark bread, citrus fruits, dough, raisin and apple. The flavor starts off light acidic, to go to sweet. Bitterness is resent all the time, finish is stronger in bitterness and dry. No explosion of aroma's or flavors, but well balanced and therefor plain good.

33cl bottle. Pours deep copper orange with huge thick white head; loads of lacing throughout. Aroma is wonderful light Brett funk, earthy and spicy hop notes, candi sugar, orange peel, light citrus fruit, slight must, lemon rind. Beautiful. Taste is incredibly delicately balanced: plenty of full bready malt combining with earthy and citric hop tones, with a great hit of yeast funk throughout. Palate is wonderfully crisp and bone dry. Lasting orange peel and light barnyard flavour on the palate as well as a tasty spicy/citric hop bite. A classic, no doubt.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2013 Bottle at BXL East.  Pours hazy dark amber with thick white head.   Intense aroma and taste of citrus and stone fruits and some hay and yeast. Wonderful appearance and a complex balance on the palate, a very special beer indeed.

Juicy fruit smell, highly carbonated, fruity smell. ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

- via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy amber color with nice white head. Floral, earthy aroma with some funk and hints of banana.  Tastes more bitter than other trappists I've had with some lemon and grass notes.  The wild yeast provides that barnyard flavor.  Very nice mouthfeel with medium high carbonation.  This is in a class by itself in flavor and style.  Very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Vuoden kypsytelty versio. Kaatuu trappistipikariin kuparinruskeana/punaisena ja runsaalla ja uskomattoman kestävällä vaahdolla, joka jää lasin reunoille. Haju on jopa lambicmaisen hapan, kuivattua hedelmää ja marjaisuutta. Nappasipa omaan nokkaani kunnon pihvin hajukin. Maku on hapan, hieman sitruksinen ja marjainen. Suutuntuma on keskitäyteläinen. Kokonaisuutena näin kypsyneenä aivan loistava olut, joka tuoreena ei maistunut mausteisuutensa takia. Tämä laskee kokonaisvaikutelmapisteitä parilla. Kypsytys tuonut lambicmaisia piirteitä mukanaan.

Bottle at Japalo. 
Aroma leather, barn, hay. 
Hazy amber , white head small bubbles. 
Medium body, very dry 
Belgian.. :) but not my favorit.






:)
Bolton Brew.

33cl bottle from 14 months ago (but labeled as good through 2016).  Pours a murky orange color with persistent fluffy white head and good lacing.  Smells of coriander, yeast, and sweet fruits.  The aroma is complex and difficult to describe, but I detect candy sugar,  pineapple, lime, and earthy hops, Taste goes from sweet to bitter then sour on the finish.  difficult to describe but wonderful.  Medium to light body with active carbonation and a pleasure to drink. This is a first class trappist ale like no other that Ive tried.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2013 Cest le couleur du miel avec une grande mousse blanche. Il a larôme des friandies dur, un peu de levure, et aussi du poivre et de la marmalade doranges.  Le goût initiale est de malt sucré, des fruits, et du poivre. Laprès goût est un peu amer et un tout petit peu aigre comme la marmalade. Je peut vraiment goûter du poivre au fin. Très unique est pas mal hors du normale.

Ive passed over this peculiar looking bottle for years now, I guess today will be the day to try it. 
Pours into the glass a lightly hazy deep golden color with a frothy meringue head that persists forever.  The label is correct about the fruitiness I get that in spades as soon as I pop the cap off the top of the bottle. Pepper, spice, yeast, and a bit of golden syrup round out the nose. The flavor is sugary sweet with a lot of orange and sweet dark fruits along with some pepper, a hint of hop and a touch of alcohol. Medium to thin body with a spirited level of carbonation and a bubbly sweet mouthfeel. This is a really nice beer thats easy to drink, I cant believe it took so many years to try this.

Possiblement la meilleure des trappistes, elle présente des notes boisées et céréalières charmantes, sous une généreuse mousse couleur cassonade. Ses saveurs ressortent beaucoup mieux à la température de service mentionnée sur létiquette ; dans les meilleures circonstances, elle frôle la perfection.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2017 Bottle - 6 weeks old. Hazy orange/amber body with a thin white head. Steady carbonation. Good lacing. Aroma of red apple, lemon zest and marzipan. Flavour of grass, orange sherbet, sour cider and hop spice. Medium body with a frothy mouthfeel. Soft fizz. This is the freshest Orval Ive had so far. If Im honest, I expected to like this more. I suppose it shows the benefit of letting the beer age for a while in the bottle. 5 8 8 5 16 = 4.2

Bottle - 4 months old. Hazy amber body with a thick off-white head that holds well. Lively carbonation. Good lacing. Aroma of candy floss, green apple and coriander. Flavour of rhubarb, salted lime, cucumber, cloudy cider, grass and lemon sherbet. Medium body with a frothy mouthfeel. Very fizzy. Just stunning - fresh and complex.
5 8 9 5 17 = 4.4

Bottle - 5 months old. Hazy amber body with a medium off-white head that holds well. Steady carbonation. Good lacing. Aroma of salted lemon, rhubarb, green apple and coriander. Flavour of lime, basil, cider and lemon sherbet. Medium body with a frothy mouthfeel. Very fizzy. A beer unlike any other. 5 8 9 5 18 = 4.5

Bottle - 12 months old. Similar to the younger bottles, described above, but the flavour is more lemony and the finish is drier. The aroma also has notes of underripe melon. A truly stunning beer. Review of older bottles to follow...
5 10 9 5 18 = 4.7

Bottle - 14 months old. Clear amber body with a thin off-white head. Lively carbonation. Faint lacing. Aroma of white wine vinegar, marzipan and lemon. Flavour of cider, coriander and grass. Medium body with a frothy mouthfeel. Very fizzy. A stunning beer but, for me, it lacks the zing and vibrancy of younger bottles. 4 8 8 4 17 = 4.1

Bottle - 23 months old. Hazy amber body with a medium off-white head. Lively carbonation. Faint lacing. Aroma of grass, herbs and lemon. Flavour of salted lime, white sugar and lemon sherbet. Medium body with a frothy texture. Light fizz. A smooth, subtle beer. It doesnt have the sharpness of younger bottles but its well rounded and complex. This is the oldest Orval Ive tasted. On this evidence, Id like to try an even older bottle. 5 8 9 5 18 = 4.5

33 cl bottle. Very good and original beer. The appearance is fantastic. Golden color, sparkling liquid and white frothy persistent head. I especially appreciate the aroma of this brew. Quite hoppy, with hints of yeast, fresh grass, herbs and candy sugar. The taste is definitely a winner, one of a kind. Strong delicious flavour that rapidly turns into a soft sour/bitter taste. Very bitter and sour finish, which stays for long. Medium body, creamy texture and lively carbonation. A great beer, the most peculiar trappist I have ever tasted. To enjoy its beautiful aroma and taste as much as possible.

#24
Was für ein Bier, unglaublicher Nektar! Gerade mal ein Jahr alt seit seiner Abfüllung, sprudelt es mit reichlich feinem Schaum im Berliner Weiße Glas. Hell-rötlich-trüb ist die Optik. Das Aroma ist einzigartig komponiert: Pfirsich-Cidre-Malzig-Hefig-Bierig, toll!! Die Fruchtigkeit herrscht auch im Geschmack reichlich vor, dann kommt ein vollmundiger Körper. Die Süße des Malzes endet in einem hölzernen Bitterton. Das soll ein Bier sein? Unglaublicher Nektar! Die restlichen Flaschen dürfen noch zwei, drei Jahre vor sich hin schlummern. Die mangelnde Ausgewogenheit dürfte dann auch ihre Ecken und Kanten verloren haben. Orval ist große Klasse!
	
Test vom 16.1.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 15,15,12,12,14,14 - 13,65

I finally got to try this trappist delight. Bottle poured into a Belgian ale glass. A thick off white head and beautiful orange color. One of the best aromas I have experienced in a beer. Smells like fresh berries and spicy hops intertwined into one. Its hard to describe the taste because I have never tasted anything like it. Slightly sweet, slightly hoppy, very smooth palate. Delicious. Highly recommended
Geweldig bier. Complex, nooit hetzelfde en veroudert erg mooi. Ik heb altijd een paar flesjes in de kelder liggen.

Flaske fra Belgisk Bryg, hjemme i mitt Duvel-glass: lyden når korken fjernes bringen bud om spenstige saker, og skummet er tårnhøyt - godt at Duvel-glasset har solide kanter! Fra BB: " Fremstillet af tre forskellige malt-sorter og ti forskellige gær-stammer. Tæt flødeskumsagtig skum. En fyldig bitter smag (skyldes dry hopping). Lys kandis bidrager til den lyse farve og den karakteristiske smag." Tiltredes, på vegne av Holmen Nanobryggeris avskriftskomité, med notat om at dette er en en velhumlet og tørr, særpreget klassiker innen trappistøl.

Bouteille 330 ml. Embouteillée le 31 mai 2012. Servie dans un verre trappiste. Robe ambrée semi opaque. Épais collet blanc persistant. Dentelle. Belle apparence. Arôme de levures belges (un peu de brets?), dagrumes et de malts, très plaisante. Bonne amertume au goût (agrumes), mais la bière devient plus maltée à mesure quelle se réchauffe.  Quelque peu mince en bouche. Finale sèche. Excellente Belgian Ale. Je serais curieux den goûter une vieillie deux ans...
Mooi donker bier met kaki kleurig volle kraag. kruidige geur en een prachtig flesje

330ml bottle. Some tart, yeast and spicy aromas. Dry-hopping noticed. Pours murky light  orange, with huge off-white head, persistent, good lacing. Medium body, high carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is dry, some sweet, subtle tartness, spicy, fruit. Long dry aftertaste. Nice, peculiar and enjoyable.

(33 cl bottle from Toft Vin; bottled on September 12th 2012) Pours a cloudy apricot with huge, frothy head that leaves foamy lace on the side of the glass and seems to stay around forever. Aroma is cidery and I find it hard to detect a hop presence there. Occassionally a hint of butyric acid comes to mind but less so as it warms. More herbal or mossy notes to be found in the aroma as it reaches recommended serving temperature. The bitterness is more pronounced in the taste, where it comes across as green, slightly herbal and well balanced against the other taste impression of tart driness. Oily texture, richly carbonated with a light to medium body and a lingering, dry finish. I can see the influence from this on beers like Anchorage Whiteout and the socalled white IPA style. As a hophead who enjoys the new hybrid hops more than bretty and tart beers I guess that explains why Id be more partial to the more recent styles.
The cut-out bin of Trappist beers.  Shared with a friend based on solid ratings.  Not impressed.

UPDATED: JUN 18, 2014 11.2 oz bottle dated 02/29/12.  Pours hazy amber with tall, foamy, long lasting white head and nice lacing.  Aroma is of sourdough, Belgian yeast, candy sugar and earthy hops.  Body is full and creamy.  Taste is Belgian yeast, caramel malt, ripe fruit, peppery hops.  Finish is long, peppery.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy amber color with frothy white head.  Aroma is floral and earthy, with funky leather notes from the brett.  Light bitter taste, with just a bit of sourness.  Light body and lively carbonation.  The finish is very pleasant: dry, bitter, and slightly sour.  Overall a fantastic beer, packed with flavor.

Extremely Dry, champagne like. Grassy, medicinal, earthy. Smells like a flowers. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle.

33 cl bottle. Bottled 26.04.2012. BBE 26.04.2017.
Originally rated on 20090417. (8-4-8-3-16)
Pours hazy golden color with a huge frothy head, leave some nice lace on the sides. Aroma of citrus fruits, yeast, some mild spice notes, grass and some faint toffee. Flavor isnt as citrusy as the aroma, some mandarin, light toffee notes, faint spices and yeast. Quite smooth palate, some sourish notes on the finish and feels rather low on CO2 even though it clearly isnt. Very good fresh, and ages nicely.
3436

2012 Bottle. It is criminal that an emerging Brett-head such as myself waited so long to rate this beer! Pours hazy amber with a huge off-white creamy head that slowly dissipates leaving thick, clumpy foam on the side of the glass (too clumpy to be called lacing). Tons of fine champagne-like bubbles rising from imperfections on the glass. Aroma is brett, lemony funk. Flavor is about the same, lightly funky, very little sweetness, and a bit of a zesty bitter finish. Medium body, some prickly carbonation. Quite nice. Need to age one a few years and see what happens...

Ma bière Trapiste préférée !
Après avoir gouté cette crème si collante au gout de levure si particulière, on on a le droit à une explosition de houblon en bouche, malgré un IBU pas si excessif (50 ?), du au coté très sec de la bière.
Plus tard dans le pallais on découvre des saveurs fleurales très équilibrées qui durent.
fantastisch bier met een rijke smaak, droog en hoppig en uitgesproken bitter, amberkleurig

Bottle---> tulip.  Pours a hazy orange with a huge thick head that laces the glass superbly.  Smells of mild funk, mild lemon, and yeast.  Taste follows aroma with an earthy taste mixed in and white wine/champagne.  Nice crisp palate with plenty of carbonation.  Beer is quite balanced with nothing overpowering anything else.  Extremely solid.

My first Orval and I now understand the influence this beer has had around the world. A quintessential Belgium ale... Huge, beige head, that leaves nice lacing. Elegant aromas of mixed herbs, dried florals, dusty earth, funk and mild lemon citrus. Similar flavors of herbs, dusty floor boards, mild, dried florals, yeast, dirty funk and mildly, bitter citrus... Very dry, with a relatively bitter, dusty, earthy, citrus, floral finish. Good mouthfeel, good carbonation and good balance.. A world class beer, which seems to be to prototype for countless Belgium farmhouse style ales everywhere. While I was drinking this, I just kept thinking.. I've tasted this before.. Now I know why. 

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

So this is what Orval is. Huh... Not exactly what I was expecting, but oh well. Pours an auburn rusted orange. Very floral, bittersweet, yeasty, earthy, citrusy and aged hops in the mouth and nostrils. Pleasant, but worth all these Orval Appreciation Threads recently?

From a bottle shared at lost dog. Pours a hazy dark gold with a thick off white head. Yeasty aroma. Somewhat thin mouthfeel. Wonderful flavors of orange, coriander and French toast. Bitter metallic finish.

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2014 excellent trappist ale with incredibly great head (though it disappears within a few minutes), sourish fragrance, great combination of bitterness and sweetness, not too violent alcoholic flavour.
strongly recommended belgian ale

re-rated on23_05_2014 (rating remained unchanged): hazy orange colour, some off-white head; aroma of yeast, vegetables, earthy notes and some fruitiness (mango and citruses) ;taste of yeast again with vegetables, some minimal bread and mango;dry mouthfeel; still one of the bests belgian ale

Perhaps one of my all time favorites. This beer is delicious with pizza and chips but also holds its own with strong cheese and meats.  I could drink this every day and not get bored for a very long time

Bottle 05.12.2012
Visual: Pours a sligthly hazy orange with a big white foamy  head.
Aroma: Yeast, fruity (lemon), slightly hoppy.
Taste: Yeast, slightly fruity (citrus), slightly hoppy, light body and medium carbonisation. 
Fresh with hoppy twist, there are better beers out there, I just keep returning to this beer :-).




Visual:
Aroma:
Taste:

I was expecting a lot going into this beer, and I was not let down.

Very amazing. Apple-like aftertastes, caramel notes, plenty of flavors to be had in this bottle. 

Pick one up, it will be worth every penny you pay for it.

Aromas of apple-like fruity esters, bubble gum, and floral hops.  Appearance is dark orange/amber, with thick, foamy, white head that retains very well.  Taste is very dry, with flavors of cherries, apples, bananas, and baseball concession stand bubble gum.  Mouthfeel is bubbly and prickly, and finishes very dry and clean.
Everyone should try this beer.  One of my favorite amongst the elite 7. Color and head look great.

Pours orange with just a bit of quickly receding head. Smell of yeast funk, pepper, banana, and a hint of grapefruit. Light to medium mouthfeel. Effervescent. Simple and yet very well done. Yay Belgium.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy blond with nice white head. Hops and medicine nose. Semi-medium body, good carbon. And again medicine and tinkcure on palate.
